40001001	The book of the generation of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
40001002	Abraham became the father of Isaac . Isaac became the father of Jacob . Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers .
40001003	Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar . Perez became the father of Hezron . Hezron became the father of Ram .
40001004	Ram became the father of Amminadab . Amminadab became the father of Nahshon . Nahshon became the father of Salmon .
40001005	Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab . Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth . Obed became the father of Jesse .
40001006	Jesse became the father of David the king . David became the father of Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah .
40001007	Solomon became the father of Rehoboam . Rehoboam became the father of Abijah . Abijah became the father of Asa .
40001008	Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat . Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram . Joram became the father of Uzziah .
40001009	Uzziah became the father of Jotham . Jotham became the father of Ahaz . Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah .
40001010	Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh . Manasseh became the father of Amon . Amon became the father of Josiah .
40001011	Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers , at the time of the exile to Babylon .
40001012	After the exile to Babylon , Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel . Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel .
40001013	Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud . Abiud became the father of Eliakim . Eliakim became the father of Azor .
40001014	Azor became the father of Sadoc . Sadoc became the father of Achim . Achim became the father of Eliud .
40001015	Eliud became the father of Eleazar . Eleazar became the father of Matthan . Matthan became the father of Jacob .
40001016	Jacob became the father of Joseph , the husband of Mary , from whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .
40001017	So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations ; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations ; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ , fourteen generations .
40001018	Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this ; because when his mother , Mary , had been engaged to Joseph , before they came together , she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit .
40001019	Joseph , her husband , being a righteous man , and not willing to make her a public example , intended to put her away secretly .
40001020	But when he thought about these things , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream , saying , " Joseph , you son of David , don't be afraid to take to yourself Mary , your wife , for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit .
40001021	She shall bring forth a son . You shall call his name JESUS , for it is he who shall save his people from their sins . "
40001022	Now all this has happened , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet , saying ,
40001023	" Behold , the virgin shall be with child , and shall bring forth a son . They shall call his name Immanuel ; " which is , being interpreted , " God with us . "
40001024	Joseph arose from his sleep , and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him , and took his wife to himself ;
40001025	and didn't know her sexually until she had brought forth her firstborn son . He named him JESUS .
40002001	Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod , the king , behold , wise men from the east came to Jerusalem , saying ,
40002002	" Where is he who is born King of the Jews ? For we saw his star in the east , and have come to worship him . "
40002003	When Herod the king heard it , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
40002004	Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people , he asked them where the Christ would be born .
40002005	They said to him , " In Bethlehem of Judea , for thus it is written through the prophet ,
40002006	' You Bethlehem , land of Judah , Are in no way least among the princes of Judah : For out of you shall come forth a governor , Who shall shepherd my people , Israel ' " .
40002007	Then Herod secretly called the wise men , and learned from them exactly what time the star appeared .
40002008	He sent them to Bethlehem , and said , " Go and search diligently for the young child . When you have found him , bring me word , so that I also may come and worship him . "
40002009	They , having heard the king , went their way ; and behold , the star , which they saw in the east , went before them , until it came and stood over where the young child was .
40002010	When they saw the star , they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy .
40002011	They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary , his mother , and they fell down and worshipped him . Opening their treasures , they offered to him gifts : gold , frankincense , and myrrh .
40002012	Being warned in a dream that they shouldn't return to Herod , they went back to their own country another way .
40002013	Now when they had departed , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream , saying , " Arise and take the young child and his mother , and flee into Egypt , and stay there until I tell you , for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him . "
40002014	He arose and took the young child and his mother by night , and departed into Egypt ,
40002015	and was there until the death of Herod ; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet , saying , " Out of Egypt I called my son . "
40002016	Then Herod , when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men , was exceedingly angry , and sent forth , and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem , and in all the surrounding countryside , from two years old and under , according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men .
40002017	Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled , saying ,
40002018	" A voice was heard in Ramah , Lamentation , weeping and great mourning , Rachel weeping for her children ; She wouldn't be comforted , because they are no more . "
40002019	But when Herod was dead , behold , an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt , saying ,
40002020	" Arise and take the young child and his mother , and go into the land of Israel , for those who sought the young child's life are dead . "
40002021	He arose and took the young child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel .
40002022	But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father , Herod , he was afraid to go there . Being warned in a dream , he withdrew into the region of Galilee ,
40002023	and came and lived in a city called Nazareth ; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets : " He will be called a Nazarene . "
40003001	In those days , John the Baptizer came , preaching in the wilderness of Judea , saying ,
40003002	" Repent , for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand ! "
40003003	For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet , saying , " The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Make ready the way of the Lord , Make his paths straight . "
40003004	Now John himself had clothing made of camel's hair , and a leather belt around his waist . His food was locusts and wild honey .
40003005	Then people from Jerusalem , all of Judea , and all the region around the Jordan went out to him .
40003006	They were baptized by him in the Jordan , confessing their sins .
40003007	But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism , he said to them , " You offspring of vipers , who warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
40003008	Therefore bring forth fruit worthy of repentance !
40003009	Don't think to yourselves , ' We have Abraham for our father , ' for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones .
40003010	Even now the ax lies at the root of the trees . Therefore , every tree that doesn't bring forth good fruit is cut down , and cast into the fire .
40003011	I indeed baptize you in water for repentance , but he who comes after me is mightier than I , whose shoes I am not worthy to carry . He shall baptize you in the Holy Spirit .
40003012	His winnowing fork is in his hand , and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor . He will gather his wheat into the barn , but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire . "
40003013	Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John , to be baptized by him .
40003014	But John would have hindered him , saying , " I need to be baptized by you , and you come to me ? "
40003015	But Jesus , answering , said to him , " Allow it now , for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness . " Then he allowed him .
40003016	Jesus , when he was baptized , went up directly from the water : and behold , the heavens were opened to him . He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove , and coming on him .
40003017	Behold , a voice out of the heavens said , " This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased . "
40004001	Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil .
40004002	When he had fasted forty days and forty nights , he was hungry afterward .
40004003	The tempter came and said to him , " If you are the Son of God , command that these stones become bread . "
40004004	But he answered , " It is written , ' Man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God . ' "
40004005	Then the devil took him into the holy city . He set him on the pinnacle of the temple ,
40004006	and said to him , " If you are the Son of God , throw yourself down , for it is written , ' He will give his angels charge concerning you . ' and , ' On their hands they will bear you up , So that you don't dash your foot against a stone . ' "
40004007	Jesus said to him , " Again , it is written , ' You shall not test the Lord , your God . ' "
40004008	Again , the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain , and showed him all the kingdoms of the world , and their glory .
40004009	He said to him , " I will give you all of these things , if you will fall down and worship me . "
40004010	Then Jesus said to him , " Get behind me , Satan ! For it is written , ' You shall worship the Lord your God , and him only shall you serve . ' "
40004011	Then the devil left him , and behold , angels came and ministered to him .
40004012	Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up , he withdrew into Galilee .
40004013	Leaving Nazareth , he came and lived in Capernaum , which is by the sea , in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali ,
40004014	that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet , saying ,
40004015	" The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali , Toward the sea , beyond the Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ,
40004016	The people who sat in darkness saw a great light , To those who sat in the region and shadow of death , To them did light spring up . "
40004017	From that time , Jesus began to preach , and to say , " Repent ! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand . "
40004018	Walking by the sea of Galilee , he saw two brothers : Simon , who is called Peter , and Andrew , his brother , casting a net into the sea ; for they were fishermen .
40004019	He said to them , " Come , follow me , and I will make you fishers for men . "
40004020	They immediately left their nets , and followed him .
40004021	Going on from there , he saw two other brothers , James , the son of Zebedee , and John , his brother , in the boat with Zebedee , their father , mending their nets . He called them .
40004022	They immediately left the boat and their father , and followed him .
40004023	Jesus went about in all Galilee , teaching in their synagogues , preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every disease and every sickness among the people .
40004024	The report about him went forth into all Syria . They brought to him all who were sick , afflicted with various diseases and torments , possessed with demons , epileptics , and paralytics ; and he healed them .
40004025	Great multitudes from Galilee , Decapolis , Jerusalem , Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him .
40005001	Seeing the multitudes , he went up onto a mountain . When he had sat down , his disciples came to him .
40005002	He opened his mouth and taught them , saying ,
40005003	" Blessed are the poor in spirit , for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven .
40005004	" Blessed are those who mourn , for they shall be comforted .
40005005	" Blessed are the humble , for they shall inherit the earth .
40005006	" Blessed are those who hunger and thirst after righteousness , for they shall be filled .
40005007	" Blessed are the merciful , for they shall obtain mercy .
40005008	" Blessed are the pure in heart , for they shall see God .
40005009	" Blessed are the peacemakers , for they shall be called sons of God .
40005010	" Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness ' sake , for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven .
40005011	" Blessed are you when people reproach you , persecute you , and say all kinds of evil against you falsely , for my sake .
40005012	" Rejoice , and be exceedingly glad , for great is your reward in heaven . For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you .
40005013	You are the salt of the earth , but if the salt has lost its flavor , what will it be salted with ? It is then good for nothing , but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men .
40005014	You are the light of the world . A city set on a hill can't be hid .
40005015	Neither do you light a lamp , and put it under a bushel basket , but on a stand ; and it shines to all who are in the house .
40005016	Even so , let your light shine before men ; that they may see your good works , and glorify your Father who is in heaven .
40005017	Don't think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets . I didn't come to destroy , but to fulfill .
40005018	For most assuredly , I tell you , until heaven and earth pass away , not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law , until all things are accomplished .
40005019	Whoever , therefore , shall break one of these least commandments , and teach others to do so , shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven ; but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven .
40005020	For I tell you , that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees , there is no way you shall enter into the Kingdom of Heaven .
40005021	" You have heard that it was said to them of old time , ' You shall not murder ; ' and ' Whoever shall murder shall be in danger of the judgment . '
40005022	But I tell you , that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment ; and whoever shall say to his brother , ' Raca , ' shall be in danger of the council ; and whoever shall say , ' You fool , ' shall be in danger of the fire of Gehenna .
40005023	If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar , and there remember that your brother has anything against you ,
40005024	leave your gift there before the altar , and go your way . First be reconciled to your brother , and then come and offer your gift .
40005025	Agree with your adversary quickly , while you are with him in the way ; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge , and the judge deliver you to the officer , and you be cast into prison .
40005026	Most assuredly I tell you , you shall by no means get out of there , until you have paid the last penny .
40005027	" You have heard that it was said , ' You shall not commit adultery ; '
40005028	but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart .
40005029	If your right eye causes you to stumble , pluck it out and cast it from you . For it is profitable for you that one of your members should perish , than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna .
40005030	If your right hand causes you to stumble , cut it off , and cast it from you : for it is profitable for you that one of your members should perish , and not your whole body be cast into Gehenna .
40005031	" It was also said , ' Whoever shall put away his wife , let him give her a writing of divorce , '
40005032	but I tell you that whoever who puts away his wife , except for the cause of sexual immorality , makes her an adulteress ; and whoever shall marry her when she is put away commits adultery .
40005033	" Again you have heard that it was said to them of old time , ' You shall not make false vows , but shall perform to the Lord your vows , '
40005034	but I tell you , don't swear at all : neither by heaven , for it is the throne of God ;
40005035	nor by the earth , for it is the footstool of his feet ; nor by Jerusalem , for it is the city of the great King .
40005036	Neither shall you swear by your head , for you can't make one hair white or black .
40005037	But let your speech be , ' Yes , yes ; No , no . ' Whatever is more than these is of the evil one .
40005038	You have heard that it was said , ' An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth . '
40005039	But I tell you , don't resist him who is evil ; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek , turn to him the other also .
40005040	If any man would go to law with you and take away your coat , let him have your cloak also .
40005041	Whoever compels you to go one mile , go with him two .
40005042	Give to him who asks you , and don't turn away him who desires to borrow from you .
40005043	" You have heard that it was said , ' You shall love your neighbor , and hate your enemy . '
40005044	But I tell you , love your enemies , bless those who curse you , do good to those who hate you , and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you ,
40005045	that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven . For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good , and sends rain on the just and the unjust .
40005046	For if you love those who love you , what reward do you have ? Don't even the tax collectors do the same ?
40005047	If you only greet your friends , what more do you do than others ? Don't even the tax collectors do the same ?
40005048	Therefore you shall be perfect , just as your Father in heaven is perfect .
40006001	" Be careful that you don't do your charitable giving before men , to be seen by them , or else you have no reward with your Father who is in heaven .
40006002	Therefore when you do merciful deeds , don't sound a trumpet before you , as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , that they may get glory from men . Most assuredly , I tell you , they have received their reward .
40006003	But when you do merciful deeds , don't let your left hand know what your right hand does ,
40006004	so that your merciful deeds may be in secret , then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly .
40006005	" When you pray , you shall not be as the hypocrites , for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets , that they may be seen by men . Most assuredly , I tell you , they have received their reward .
40006006	But you , when you pray , enter into your inner chamber , and having shut your door , pray to your Father who is in secret , and your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly .
40006007	In praying , don't use vain repetitions , as the Gentiles do ; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking .
40006008	Therefore don't be like them , for your Father knows what things you need , before you ask him .
40006009	Pray like this . ' Our Father , who is in heaven , may your name be kept holy .
40006010	May your kingdom come . May your will be done , as in heaven , so on earth .
40006011	Give us this day our daily bread .
40006012	Forgive us our debts , as we also forgive our debtors .
40006013	Bring us not into temptation , but deliver us from evil . For yours is the kingdom , the power and the glory forever . Amen . '
40006014	For if you forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly Father will also forgive you .
40006015	But if you don't forgive men their trespasses , neither will your Father forgive your trespasses .
40006016	" Moreover when you fast , don't be , as the hypocrites , with sad faces . For they disfigure their faces , that they may be seen by men to be fasting . Most assuredly I tell you , they have received their reward .
40006017	But you , when you fast , anoint your head , and wash your face ;
40006018	that you are not seen by men to be fasting , but by your Father who is in secret , and your Father , who sees in secret , will reward you .
40006019	" Don't lay up treasures for yourselves on the earth , where moth and rust consume , and where thieves break through and steal ;
40006020	but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust consume , and where thieves don't break through and steal ;
40006021	for where your treasure is , your heart will be there also .
40006022	The lamp of the body is the eye : if therefore your eye is sound , your whole body will be full of light .
40006023	But if your eye is evil , your whole body will be full of darkness . If therefore the light that is in you is darkness , how great is the darkness !
40006024	" No one can serve two masters , for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to one , and despise the other . You can't serve both God and Mammon .
40006025	Therefore , I tell you , don't be anxious for your life , what you will eat , or what you will drink ; nor yet for your body , what you will put on . Isn't life more than food , and the body more than clothing ?
40006026	See the birds of the sky , that they don't sow , neither do they reap , nor gather into barns . Your heavenly Father feeds them . Aren't you of much more value than they ?
40006027	Which of you , by being anxious , can add one cubit to the measure of his life ?
40006028	Why are you anxious about clothing ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow . They don't toil , neither do they spin ,
40006029	yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these .
40006030	But if God so clothes the grass of the field , which today exists , and tomorrow is cast into the oven , won't he much more clothe you , you of little faith ?
40006031	Therefore don't be anxious , saying , ' What will we eat ? ' , ' What will we drink ? ' or , ' With what will we be clothed ? '
40006032	For the Gentiles seek after all these things , for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things .
40006033	But seek first God's Kingdom , and his righteousness ; and all these things will be added to you .
40006034	Therefore don't be anxious for tomorrow , for tomorrow will be anxious for itself . Each day's own evil is sufficient .
40007001	" Don't judge , so that you won't be judged .
40007002	For with whatever judgment you judge , you will be judged : and with whatever measure you measure , it will be measured to you .
40007003	Why do you see the speck that is in your brother's eye , but don't consider the beam that is in your own eye ?
40007004	Or how will you tell your brother , ' Let me remove the speck from your eye ; ' and behold , the beam is in your own eye ?
40007005	You hypocrite ! First remove the beam out of your own eye , and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother's eye .
40007006	" Don't give that which is holy to the dogs , neither cast your pearls before the pigs , lest perhaps they trample them under their feet , and turn and tear you to pieces .
40007007	" Ask , and it will be given you . Seek , and you will find . Knock , and it will be opened to you .
40007008	For everyone who asks receives . He who seeks finds . To him who knocks it will be opened .
40007009	Or what man is there of you , who , if his son asks him for bread , will give him a stone ?
40007010	Or if he asks for a fish , who will give him a serpent ?
40007011	If you then , being evil , know how to give good gifts to your children , how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him !
40007012	Therefore whatever you desire for men to do to you , you shall also do to them ; for this is the law and the prophets .
40007013	Enter in by the narrow gate ; for wide is the gate , and broad is the way , that leads to destruction , and many are those who enter in by it .
40007014	How narrow is the gate , and restricted is the way that leads to life ! Few are those who find it .
40007015	" Beware of false prophets , who come to you in sheep's clothing , but inwardly are ravening wolves .
40007016	By their fruits you will know them . Do you gather grapes from thorns , or figs from thistles ?
40007017	Even so , every good tree brings forth good fruit ; but the corrupt tree brings forth evil fruit .
40007018	A good tree can't bring forth evil fruit , neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
40007019	Every tree that doesn't grow good fruit is cut down , and thrown into the fire .
40007020	Therefore , by their fruits you will know them .
40007021	Not everyone who says to me , ' Lord , Lord , ' will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven ; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven .
40007022	Many will tell me in that day , ' Lord , Lord , didn't we prophesy by your name , by your name cast out demons , and by your name do many mighty works ? '
40007023	Then I will tell them , ' I never knew you . Depart from me , you who work iniquity . '
40007024	" Everyone therefore who hears these words of mine , and does them , I will liken him to a wise man , who built his house on a rock .
40007025	The rain came down , the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat on that house ; and it didn't fall , for it was founded on the rock .
40007026	Everyone who hears these words of mine , and doesn't do them will be like a foolish man , who built his house on the sand .
40007027	The rain came down , the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat on that house ; and it fell - - and great was its fall . "
40007028	It happened , when Jesus had finished saying these things , that the multitudes were astonished at his teaching ,
40007029	for he taught them with authority , and not like the scribes .
40008001	When he came down from the mountain , great multitudes followed him .
40008002	Behold , a leper came to him and worshipped him , saying , " Lord , if you want to , you can make me clean . "
40008003	Jesus stretched out his hand , and touched him , saying , " I want to . Be made clean . " Immediately his leprosy was cleansed .
40008004	Jesus said to him , " See that you tell nobody , but go , show yourself to the priest , and offer the gift that Moses commanded , as a testimony to them . "
40008005	When he came into Capernaum , a centurion came to him , asking him ,
40008006	and saying , " Lord , my servant lies in the house paralyzed , grievously tormented . "
40008007	Jesus said to him , " I will come and heal him . "
40008008	The centurion answered , " Lord , I'm not worthy for you to come under my roof . Just say the word , and my servant will be healed .
40008009	For I am also a man under authority , having under myself soldiers . I tell this one , ' Go , ' and he goes ; and to another , ' Come , ' and he comes ; and to my servant , ' Do this , ' and he does it . "
40008010	When Jesus heard it , he marveled , and said to those who followed , " Most assuredly I tell you , I haven't found so great a faith , not even in Israel .
40008011	I tell you that many will come from the east and the west , and will sit down with Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , in the Kingdom of Heaven ,
40008012	but the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness . There will be weeping and the gnashing of teeth . "
40008013	Jesus said to the centurion , " Go your way . Let it be done for you as you as you have believed . " His servant was healed in that hour .
40008014	When Jesus came into Peter's house , he saw his wife's mother lying sick of a fever .
40008015	He touched her hand , and the fever left her . She got up and served him .
40008016	When evening came , they brought to him many possessed with demons . He cast out the spirits with a word , and healed all who were sick ;
40008017	that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet , saying : " He took our infirmities , and bore our diseases . "
40008018	Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him , he gave the order to depart to the other side .
40008019	A scribe came , and said to him , " Teacher , I will follow you wherever you go . "
40008020	Jesus said to him , " The foxes have holes , and the birds of the sky have nests , but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head . "
40008021	Another of his disciples said to him , " Lord , allow me first to go and bury my father . "
40008022	But Jesus said to him , " Follow me , and leave the dead to bury their own dead . "
40008023	When he got into a boat , his disciples followed him .
40008024	Behold , a great tempest arose in the sea , so much that the boat was covered with the waves , but he was asleep .
40008025	They came to him , and woke him up , saying , " Save us , Lord ! We are dying ! "
40008026	He said to them , " Why are you fearful , oh you of little faith ? " Then he got up , rebuked the wind and the sea , and there was a great calm .
40008027	The men marveled , saying , " What kind of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ? "
40008028	When he came to the other side , into the country of the Gergesenes , two people possessed with demons met him there , coming forth out of the tombs , exceedingly fierce , so that no man could pass by that way .
40008029	Behold , they cried out , saying , " What do we have to do with you , Jesus , Son of God ? Have you come here to torment us before the time ? "
40008030	Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding far away from them .
40008031	The demons begged him , saying , " If you cast us out , permit us to go away into the herd of pigs . "
40008032	He said to them , " Go ! " They came out , and went into the herd of pigs : and behold , the whole herd of pigs rushed down the cliff into the sea , and died in the water .
40008033	Those who fed them fled , and went away into the city , and told everything , and what happened to those who were possessed with demons .

40009016	No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment ; for the patch would tear away from the garment , and a worse hole is made .
40009017	Neither do people put new wine into old wineskins , or else the skins would burst , and the wine be spilled , and the skins ruined . No , they put new wine into fresh wineskins , and both are preserved . "

40010001	He called to himself his twelve disciples , and gave them authority over unclean spirits , to cast them out , and to heal every disease and every sickness .
40010002	Now the names of the twelve apostles are these . The first , Simon , who is called Peter ; Andrew , his brother ; James the son of Zebedee ; John , his brother ;
40010003	Philip ; Bartholomew ; Thomas ; Matthew , the tax collector ; James the son of Alphaeus ; and Lebbaeus , whose surname was Thaddaeus ;
40010004	Simon the Canaanite ; and Judas Iscariot , who also betrayed him .
40010005	Jesus sent these twelve forth , and charged them , saying , " Don't go among the Gentiles , and don't enter into any city of the Samaritans .
40010006	Rather , go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
40010007	As you go , preach , saying , ' The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand . '
40010008	Heal the sick , cleanse the lepers , and cast out demons . Freely you received , so freely give .
40010009	Don't take any gold , nor silver , nor brass in your money belts .
40010010	Take no bag for your journey , neither two coats , nor shoes , nor staff : for the laborer is worthy of his food .
40010011	Into whatever city or village you enter , find out who in it is worthy ; and stay there until you go on .
40010012	As you enter into the household , greet it .
40010013	If the household is worthy , let your peace come on it , but if it isn't worthy , let your peace return to you .
40010014	Whoever doesn't receive you , nor hear your words , as you go forth out of that house or that city , shake off the dust from your feet .
40010015	Most assuredly I tell you , It will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment , than for that city .
40010016	Behold , I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves . Therefore be wise as serpents , and harmless as doves .
40010017	But beware of men : for they will deliver you up to councils , and in their synagogues they will scourge you .
40010018	Yes , and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake , for a testimony to them and to the Gentiles .
40010019	But when they deliver you up , don't be anxious how or what you will say , for it will be given you in that hour what you will say .
40010020	For it is not you who speak , but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you .
40010021	Brother will deliver up brother to death , and the father his child . Children will rise up against parents , and cause them to be put to death .
40010022	You will be hated by all men for my name's sake , but he who endures to the end , the same will be saved .
40010023	But when they persecute you in this city , flee into the next , for most assuredly I tell you , you will not have gone through the cities of Israel , until the Son of Man has come .
40010024	" A disciple is not above his teacher , nor a servant above his lord .
40010025	It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher , and the servant like his lord . If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul , how much more them of his household !
40010026	Therefore don't be afraid of them , for there is nothing covered , that will not be revealed ; and hidden , that will not be known .
40010027	What I tell you in the darkness , speak in the light ; and what you hear whispered in the ear , proclaim on the housetops .
40010028	Don't be afraid of those who kill the body , but are not able to kill the soul . Rather , fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna .
40010029	" Aren't two sparrows sold for an assarion ? Not one of them falls on the ground apart from your Father's will ,
40010030	but the very hairs of your head are all numbered .
40010031	Therefore don't be afraid , you are of more value than many sparrows .
40010032	Everyone therefore who confesses me before men , him will I also confess before my Father who is in heaven .
40010033	But whoever denies me before men , him will I also deny before my Father who is in heaven .
40010034	" Don't think that I came to send peace on the earth . I didn't come to send peace , but a sword .
40010035	For I came to set a man at odds against his father , and the daughter against her mother , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
40010036	A man's foes will be those of his own household .
40010037	He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me ; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn't worthy of me .
40010038	He who doesn't take his cross and follow after me , isn't worthy of me .
40010039	He who finds his life will lose it ; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it .
40010040	He who receives you receives me , and he who receives me receives him who sent me .
40010041	He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet's reward : and he who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward .
40010042	Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink , in the name of a disciple , most assuredly I tell you he will in no way lose his reward . "

40012001	At that time , Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields . His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat .

40012003	But he said to them , " Haven't you read what David did , when he was hungry , and those who were with him ;

40012026	If Satan casts out Satan , he is divided against himself . How then will his kingdom stand ?
40012027	If I by Beelzebul cast out demons , by whom do your sons cast them out ? Therefore they will be your judges .
40012028	But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons , then the kingdom of God has come on you .
40012029	Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man , and plunder his goods , except he first bind the strong man ? Then he will plunder his house .
40012030	" He who is not with me is against me , and he who doesn't gather with me , scatters .
40012031	Therefore I tell you , every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men , but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men .

40012033	" Either make the tree good , and its fruit good , or make the tree corrupt , and its fruit corrupt ; for the tree is known by its fruit .
40012034	You offspring of vipers , how can you , being evil , speak good things ? For out of the abundance of the heart , the mouth speaks .
40012035	The good man out of his good treasure brings forth good things , and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings forth evil things .
40012036	I tell you that every idle word that men speak , they will give account of it in the day of judgment .

40012038	Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered , saying , " Teacher , we want to see a sign from you . "

40012041	The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation , and will condemn it , for they repented at the preaching of Jonah ; and behold , someone greater than Jonah is here .
40012042	The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation , and will condemn it , for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon ; and behold , someone greater than Solomon is here .
40012043	But the unclean spirit , when he is gone out of the man , passes through waterless places , seeking rest , and doesn't find it .

40012045	Then he goes , and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than himself , and they enter in and dwell there . The last state of that man becomes worse than the first . Even so will it be also to this evil generation . "

40013001	On that day Jesus went out of the house , and sat by the seaside .
40013002	Great multitudes gathered to him , so that he entered into a boat , and sat , and all the multitude stood on the beach .
40013003	He spoke to them many things in parables , saying , " Behold , the farmer went forth to sow .
40013004	As he sowed , some seeds fell by the roadside , and the birds came and devoured them .
40013005	Others fell on rocky ground , where they didn't have much soil , and immediately they sprang up , because they had no deepness of earth .
40013006	When the sun had risen , they were scorched . Because they had no root , they withered away .
40013007	Others fell on thorns . The thorns grew up and choked them :
40013008	and others fell on good soil , and yielded fruit : some one hundred times , some sixty , and some thirty .
40013009	He who has ears to hear , let him hear . "
40013010	The disciples came , and said to him , " Why do you speak to them in parables ? "
40013011	He answered them , " To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven , but it is not given to them .
40013012	For whoever has , to him will be given , and he will have abundance , but whoever doesn't have , from him will be taken away even that which he has .
40013013	Therefore I speak to them in parables , because seeing they don't see , and hearing , they don't hear , neither do they understand .
40013014	In them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled , which says , ' By hearing you will hear , and will in no way understand ; Seeing you will see , and will in no way perceive :
40013015	For this people's heart has grown callous , Their ears are dull of hearing , Their eyes they have closed ; Or else perhaps they might perceive with their eyes , Hear with their ears , Understand with their heart , And should turn again ; And I would heal them . '
40013016	" But blessed are your eyes , for they see ; and your ears , for they hear .
40013017	For most assuredly I tell you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which you see , and didn't see them ; and to hear the things which you hear , and didn't hear them .
40013018	" Hear , then , the parable of the farmer .
40013019	When anyone hears the word of the kingdom , and doesn't understand it , the evil one comes , and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart . This is what was sown by the roadside .
40013020	What was sown on the rocky places , this is he who hears the word , and immediately with joy receives it ;
40013021	yet he has no root in himself , but endures for a while . When oppression or persecution arises because of the word , immediately he stumbles .
40013022	What was sown among the thorns , this is he who hears the word , but the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word , and he becomes unfruitful .
40013023	What was sown on the good ground , this is he who hears the word , and understands it , who most assuredly bears fruit , and brings forth , some one hundred times , some sixty , some thirty . "
40013024	He set another parable before them , saying , " The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field ,
40013025	but while people slept , his enemy came and sowed darnel also among the wheat , and went away .
40013026	But when the blade sprang up and brought forth fruit , then the darnel appeared also .
40013027	The servants of the householder came and said to him , ' Sir , didn't you sow good seed in your field ? Where did this darnel come from ? '
40013028	He said to them , ' An enemy has done this . ' The servants asked him , ' Do you want us to go and gather them up ? '
40013029	But he said , ' No , lest perhaps while you gather up the darnel , you root up the wheat with them .
40013030	Let both grow together until the harvest , and in the harvest time I will tell the reapers , " First , gather up the darnel , and bind them in bundles to burn them ; but gather the wheat into my barn . " ' "
40013031	He set another parable before them , saying , " The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took , and sowed in his field ;
40013032	which indeed is smaller than all seeds . But when it is grown , it is greater than the herbs , and becomes a tree , so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches . "
40013033	He spoke another parable to them . " The Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast , which a woman took , and hid in three measures of meal , until it was all leavened . "
40013034	Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes ; and without a parable , he didn't speak to them ,
40013035	that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet , saying , " I will open my mouth in parables ; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world . "
40013036	Then Jesus sent the multitudes away , and went into the house . His disciples came to him , saying , " Explain to us the parable of the darnel of the field . "
40013037	He answered them , " He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man ,

40013039	The enemy who sowed them is the devil . The harvest is the end of the age , and the reapers are angels .
40013040	As therefore the darnel is gathered up and burned with fire ; so will it be in the end of this age .
40013041	The Son of Man will send forth his angels , and they will gather out of his kingdom all things that cause stumbling , and those who do iniquity ,
40013042	and will cast them into the furnace of fire . There will be weeping and the gnashing of teeth .
40013043	Then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father . He who has ears to hear , let him hear .
40013044	" The Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field , which a man found , and hid . In his joy , he goes and sells all that he has , and buys that field .
40013045	" Again , the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a merchant seeking fine pearls ,
40013046	who having found one pearl of great price , he went and sold all that he had , and bought it .
40013047	" Again , the Kingdom of Heaven is like a dragnet , that was cast into the sea , and gathered some fish of every kind ,
40013048	which , when it was filled , they drew up on the beach . They sat down , and gathered the good into containers , but the bad they threw away .
40013049	So will it be in the end of the world . The angels will come forth , and separate the wicked from among the righteous ,
40013050	and will cast them into the furnace of fire . There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth . "
40013051	Jesus said to them , " Have you understood all these things ? " They answered him , " Yes , Lord . "

40013056	Aren't all of his sisters with us ? Where , then did this man get all of these things ? "

40014019	He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass ; and he took the five loaves and the two fish , and looking up to heaven , he blessed , broke and gave the loaves to the disciples , and the disciples to the multitudes .
40014020	They all ate , and were filled . They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces .
40014021	Those who ate were about five thousand men , besides women and children .
40014022	Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat , and to go ahead of him to the other side , while he sent the multitudes away .
40014023	After he had sent the multitudes away , he went up into the mountain apart to pray . When evening had come , he was there alone .
40014024	But the boat was now in the midst of the sea , distressed by the waves , for the wind was contrary .
40014025	In the fourth watch of the night Jesus came to them , walking on the sea .
40014026	When the disciples saw him walking on the sea , they were troubled , saying , " It is a ghost ! " and they cried out for fear .
40014027	But immediately Jesus spoke to them , saying " Cheer up ! I AM ! Don't be afraid . "
40014028	Peter answered him and said , " Lord , if it is you , command me to come to you on the waters . "
40014029	He said , " Come ! " Peter went down from the boat , and walked on the waters to come to Jesus .
40014030	But when he saw that the wind was strong , he was afraid , and beginning to sink , he cried out , saying , " Lord , save me ! "
40014031	Immediately Jesus stretched forth his hand , and took hold of him , and said to him , " You of little faith , why did you doubt ? "
40014032	When they got up into the boat , the wind ceased .

40015001	Then Pharisees and scribes come to Jesus from Jerusalem , saying ,
40015002	" Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders ? For they don't wash their hands when they eat bread . "
40015003	He answered them , " Why do you also disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition ?
40015004	For God commanded , ' Honor your father and your mother , ' and , ' He who speaks evil of father or mother , let him be put to death . '
40015005	But you say , ' Whoever will tell his father or his mother , " Whatever help you might otherwise have gotten from me is a gift devoted to God , "
40015006	he will not honor his father or mother . ' You have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition .
40015007	You hypocrites ! Well did Isaiah prophesy of you , saying ,
40015008	' These people draw near to me with their mouth , And honor me with their lips ; But their heart is far from me .
40015009	But in vain do they worship me , Teaching as doctrine rules made by men . ' "
40015010	He called the multitude to himself , and said to them , " Hear , and understand .
40015011	That which enters into the mouth doesn't defile the man ; but that which proceeds out of the mouth , this defiles the man . "
40015012	Then the disciples came , and said to him , " Do you know that the Pharisees were offended , when they heard this saying ? "
40015013	But he answered , " Every plant which my heavenly Father didn't plant will be uprooted .

40015015	Peter answered him , " Explain the parable to us . "
40015016	So Jesus said , " Do you also still not understand ?
40015017	Don't you understand that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the belly , and then out of the body ?
40015018	But the things which proceed out of the mouth come forth out of the heart , and they defile the man .
40015019	For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts , murders , adulteries , sexual sins , thefts , false testimony , and blasphemies .
40015020	These are the things which defile the man ; but to eat with unwashed hands doesn't defile the man . "
40015021	Jesus went out from there , and withdrew into the parts of Tyre and Sidon .

40016001	The Pharisees and Sadducees came , and testing him , asked him to show them a sign from heaven .

40016005	The disciples came to the other side and forgot to take bread .

40018001	In that hour the disciples came to Jesus , saying , " Who then is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven ? "
40018002	Jesus called a little child to himself , and set him in the midst of them ,
40018003	and said , " Most assuredly I tell you , unless you turn , and become as little children , you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven .
40018004	Whoever therefore will humble himself as this little child , the same is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven .
40018005	Whoever will receive one such little child in my name receives me ,
40018006	but whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble , it would be better for him that a huge millstone should be hung around his neck , and that he should be sunk in the depths of the sea .
40018007	Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling ! For it must be that the occasions come , but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes !
40018008	If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble , cut it off , and cast it from you . It is better for you to enter into life maimed or crippled , rather than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the eternal fire .
40018009	If your eye causes you to stumble , pluck it out , and cast it from you . It is better for you to enter into life with one eye , rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire .
40018010	See that you don't despise one of these little ones , for I tell you that in heaven their angels always see the face of my Father who is in heaven .
40018011	For the Son of Man came to save that which was lost .
40018012	" What do you think ? If a man has one hundred sheep , and one of them goes astray , doesn't he leave the ninety-nine , go to the mountains , and seek that which has gone astray ?
40018013	If he happens to find it , most assuredly I tell you , he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray .
40018014	Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish .
40018015	" If your brother sins against you , go , show him his fault between you and him alone . If he listens to you , you have gained back your brother .
40018016	But if he doesn't listen , take one or two more with you , that at the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established .
40018017	If he refuses to listen to them , tell it to the assembly . If he refuses to hear the assembly also , let him be to you as a Gentile or a tax collector .
40018018	Most assuredly I tell you , whatever things you will bind on earth will be bound in heaven , and whatever things you will loose on earth will be loosed in heaven .
40018019	Again , assuredly I tell you , that if two of you will agree on earth concerning anything that they will ask , it will be done for them by my Father who is in heaven .
40018020	For where two or three are gathered together in my name , there I am in the midst of them . "

40018022	Jesus said to him , " I don't tell you until seven times , but , until seventy times seven .
40018023	Therefore the Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king , who wanted to reconcile accounts with his servants .
40018024	When he had begun to reconcile , one was brought to him who owed him ten thousand talents .
40018025	But because he couldn't pay , his lord commanded him to be sold , with his wife , his children , and all that he had , and payment to be made .
40018026	The servant therefore fell down and kneeled before him , saying , ' Lord , have patience with me , and I will repay you all . '
40018027	The lord of that servant , being moved with compassion , released him , and forgave him the debt .
40018028	But that servant went out , and found one of his fellow-servants , who owed him one hundred denarii , and he laid hold on him , and took him by the throat , saying , ' Pay me what you owe ! '
40018029	So his fellow-servant fell down at his feet and begged him , saying , ' Have patience with me , and I will repay you . '
40018030	He would not , but went and cast him into prison , until he should pay back that which was due .
40018031	So when his fellow-servants saw what was done , they were exceedingly sorry , and came and told to their lord all that was done .
40018032	Then his lord called him in , and said to him , ' You wicked servant ! I forgave you all that debt , because you begged me .
40018033	Shouldn't you also have had mercy on your fellow-servant , even as I had mercy on you ? '
40018034	His lord was angry , and delivered him to the tormentors , until he should pay all that was due to him .
40018035	So will my heavenly Father also do to you , if you don't each forgive his brother from your hearts for his misdeeds . "
40019001	It happened when Jesus had finished these words , he departed from Galilee , and came into the borders of Judea beyond the Jordan .

40020001	" For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household , who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard .

40021023	When he had come into the temple , the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching , and said , " By what authority do you do these things ? Who gave you this authority ? "
40021024	Jesus answered them , " I also will ask you one question , which if you tell me , I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things .
40021025	The baptism of John , where was it from ? From heaven or from men ? " They reasoned with themselves , saying , " If we will say , ' From heaven , ' he will tell us , ' Why then did you not believe him ? '
40021026	But if we will say , ' From men , ' we fear the multitude , for all hold John as a prophet . "
40021027	They answered Jesus , and said , " We don't know . " He also said to them , " Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things .
40021028	But what do you think ? A man had two sons , and he came to the first , and said , ' Son , go work today in my vineyard . '
40021029	He answered , ' I will not , ' but afterward he repented himself , and went .
40021030	He came to the second , and said likewise . He answered , ' I go , sir , ' but he didn't go .
40021031	Which of the two did the will of his father ? " They said to him , " The first . " Jesus says to them , " Most assuredly I tell you , that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into the kingdom of God before you .
40021032	For John came to you in the way of righteousness , and you didn't believe him , but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him . When you saw it , you didn't even repent afterward , that you might believe him .
40021033	" Hear another parable . There was a man who was a master of a household , who planted a vineyard , set a hedge about it , dug a winepress in it , built a tower , leased it out to farmers , and went into another country .
40021034	When the season of the fruits drew near , he sent his servants to the farmers , to receive his fruits .
40021035	The farmers took his servants , beat one , killed another , and stoned another .
40021036	Again , he sent other servants more than the first : and they did to them in like manner .
40021037	But afterward he sent to them his son , saying , ' They will respect my son . '
40021038	But the farmers , when they saw the son , said among themselves , ' This is the heir . Come , let's kill him , and seize his inheritance . '
40021039	So they took him , and threw him out of the vineyard , and killed him .
40021040	When therefore the lord of the vineyard will come , what will he do to those farmers ? "
40021041	They told him , " He will miserably destroy those miserable men , and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers , who will give him the fruits in their seasons . "
40021042	Jesus said to them , " Did you never read in the scriptures , ' The stone which the builders rejected , The same was made the head of the corner . This was from the Lord . It is marvelous in our eyes ? '
40021043	" Therefore I tell you , the kingdom of God will be taken away from you , and will be given to a nation bringing forth its fruits .
40021044	He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces , but on whoever it will fall , it will scatter him as dust . "
40021045	When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables , they perceived that he spoke of them .

40022001	Jesus answered and spoke again in parables to them , saying ,
40022002	" The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king , who made a marriage feast for his son ,
40022003	and sent forth his servants to call those who were invited to the marriage feast , but they would not come .
40022004	Again he sent forth other servants , saying , ' Tell those who are invited , " Behold , I have made ready my dinner . My oxen and my fatlings are killed , and all things are ready . Come to the marriage feast . " '
40022005	But they made light of it , and went their ways , one to his own farm , another to his merchandise ,
40022006	and the rest grabbed his servants , and treated them shamefully , and killed them .
40022007	But the king was angry , and he sent his armies , destroyed those murderers , and burned their city .
40022008	Then he said to his servants , ' The wedding is ready , but they who were invited were not worthy .
40022009	Go therefore to the intersections of the highways , and as many as you may find , invite to the marriage feast . '
40022010	Those servants went out into the highways , and gathered together as many as they found , both bad and good . The wedding was filled with guests .

40022023	On that day Sadducees ( those who say that there is no resurrection ) came to him . They asked him ,

40022026	In like manner the second also , and the third , to the seventh .

40022039	A second likewise is this , ' You shall love your neighbor as yourself . '

40023001	Then Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples ,
40023002	saying , " The scribes and the Pharisees sat on Moses ' seat .
40023003	All things therefore whatever they tell you to observe , observe and do , but don't do their works ; for they say , and don't do .

40023013	" Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! For you devour widows ' houses , and as a pretense you make long prayers . Therefore you will receive greater condemnation .
40023014	" But woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! Because you shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men ; for you don't enter in yourselves , neither do you allow those who are entering in to enter .

40023019	You blind fools ! For which is greater , the gift , or the altar that sanctifies the gift ?

40023021	He who swears by the temple , swears by it , and by him who is living in it .

40023023	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , hypocrites ! For you tithe mint , dill , and cumin , and have left undone the weightier matters of the law - justice , mercy , and faith . But you ought to have done these , and not to have left the other undone .

40023028	Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men , but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity .

41004018	Others are those who are sown among the thorns . These are those who have heard the word ,
41004019	and the cares of this age , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word , and it becomes unfruitful .
41004020	These are those who were sown on the good ground : such as hear the word , and accept it , and bear fruit , some thirty times , some sixty times , and some one hundred times . "
41004021	He said to them , " Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket or under the bed ? Isn't it put on the lampstand ?
41004022	For there is nothing hidden , except that it should be made known ; neither was anything made secret , but that it should come to light .
41004023	If any man has ears to hear , let him hear . "
41004024	He said to them , " Take heed what you hear . With whatever measure you measure , it will be measured to you , and more will be given to you who hear .
41004025	For whoever has , to him will more be given , and he who has not , from him will be taken away even that which he has . "
41004026	He said , " So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed on the earth ,
41004027	and should sleep and rise night and day , and the seed should spring up and grow , he doesn't know how .
41004028	For the earth bears fruit : first the blade , then the ear , then the full grain in the ear .
41004029	But when the fruit is ripe , immediately he puts forth the sickle , because the harvest has come . "
41004030	He said , " How will we liken the kingdom of God ? Or by what parable will we compare it ?
41004031	It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth ,
41004032	yet when it is sown , grows up , and becomes greater than all the herbs , and puts out great branches , so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow . "
41004033	With many such parables he spoke the word to them , as they were able to hear it .
41004034	Without a parable he didn't speak to them ; but privately to his own disciples he explained all things .
41004035	On that day , when evening had come , he said to them , " Let's go over to the other side . "
41004036	Leaving the multitude , they took him with them , even as he was , in the boat . Other small boats were also with him .
41004037	There arose a great wind storm , and the waves beat into the boat , so much that the boat was already filled .
41004038	He himself was in the stern , asleep on the cushion , and they woke him up , and told him , " Teacher , don't you care that we are dying ? "
41004039	He awoke , and rebuked the wind , and said to the sea , " Peace . Be still . " The wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
41004040	He said to them , " Why are you so afraid ? How is it that you have no faith ? "
41004041	They were greatly afraid , and said to one another , " Who then is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ? "
41005001	They came to the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
41005002	When he had come out of the boat , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
41005003	who had his dwelling in the tombs . Nobody could bind him any more , not even with chains ,
41005004	because he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been torn apart by him , and the fetters broken in pieces . Nobody had the strength to tame him .
41005005	Always , night and day , in the tombs and in the mountains , he was crying out , and cutting himself with stones .
41005006	When he saw Jesus from afar , he ran and bowed down to him ,
41005007	and crying out with a loud voice , he said , " What have I to do with you , Jesus , you Son of the Most High God ? I adjure you by God , don't torment me . "
41005008	For he said to him , " Come out of the man , you unclean spirit ! "
41005009	He asked him , " What is your name ? " He said to him , " My name is Legion , for we are many . "
41005010	He begged him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
41005011	Now there was there on the mountainside a great herd of pigs feeding .
41005012	All the demons begged him , saying , " Send us into the pigs , that we may enter into them . "

41005014	Those who fed them fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . The people came to see what it was that had happened .
41005015	They came to Jesus , and saw him who was possessed by demons sitting , clothed and in his right mind , even him who had the legion ; and they were afraid .
41005016	Those who saw it declared to them how it happened to him who was possessed by demons , and about the pigs .
41005017	They began to beg him to depart from their borders .
41005018	As he was entering into the boat , he who had been possessed by demons begged him that he might be with him .

41005020	He went his way , and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him , and everyone marveled .
41005021	When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side , a great multitude was gathered to him ; and he was by the sea .
41005022	Behold , one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name , came ; and seeing him , he fell at his feet ,
41005023	and begged him much , saying , " My little daughter is at the point of death . Please come and lay your hands on her , that she may be made healthy , and live . "

41006001	He went out from there . He came into his own country , and his disciples followed him .

41006049	but they , when they saw him walking on the sea , supposed that it was a ghost , and cried out ;

41007001	Then the Pharisees , and some of the scribes gathered together to him , having come from Jerusalem .
41007002	Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled , that is , unwashed , hands , they found fault .
41007003	( For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , don't eat unless they wash their hands and forearms , holding to the tradition of the elders .
41007004	They don't eat when they come from the marketplace , unless they bathe themselves , and there are many other things , which they have received to hold to : washings of cups , pitchers , bronze vessels , and couches . )
41007005	The Pharisees and the scribes asked him , " Why don't your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders , but eat their bread with unwashed hands ? "
41007006	He answered them , " Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites , as it is written , ' This people honors me with their lips , But their heart is far from me .
41007007	But in vain do they worship me , Teaching as doctrines the commandments of men . '
41007008	" For you set aside the commandment of God , and hold tightly to the tradition of men - - the washing of pitchers and cups , and you do many other such things . "
41007009	He said to them , " Full well do you reject the commandment of God , that you may keep your tradition .
41007010	For Moses said , ' Honor your father and your mother ; ' and , ' He who speaks evil of father or mother , let him be put to death . '
41007011	But you say , ' If a man will tell his father or his mother , " Whatever you might have been profited by me is Corban , that is to say , given to God ; " '
41007012	and you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother ,
41007013	making void the word of God by your tradition , which you have handed down . You do many things like this . "
41007014	He called all the multitude to himself , and said to them , " Hear me , all of you , and understand .

41007016	If anyone has ears to hear , let him hear ! "
41007017	When he had entered into the house from the multitude , his disciples asked him about the parable .

41007019	because it doesn't go into his heart , but into his belly , and into the latrine , thus making all foods clean ? "
41007020	He said , " That which proceeds out of the man , that defiles the man .
41007021	For from within , out of the hearts of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , sexual sins , murders , thefts ,
41007022	covetings , wickedness , deceit , lustful desires , an evil eye , blasphemy , pride , and foolishness .
41007023	All these evil things proceed from within , and defile the man . "
41007024	From there he arose , and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon . He entered into a house , and wanted no one to know it , but he couldn't escape detection .
41007025	For a woman , whose little daughter had an unclean spirit , having heard of him , came and fell down at his feet .

41007029	He said to her , " For this saying , go your way . The demon has gone out of your daughter . "

41007032	They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech . They begged him to lay his hand on him .

41007035	Immediately his ears were opened , and the bond of his tongue was loosed , and he spoke clearly .

41008001	In those days , when there was a very great multitude , and they had nothing to eat , Jesus called his disciples to himself , and said to them ,

41009039	But Jesus said , " Don't forbid him , for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name , and be able quickly to speak evil of me .
41009040	For whoever is not against us is on our side .
41009041	For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name , because you are Christ's , most assuredly I tell you , he will in no way lose his reward .
41009042	Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble , it would be better for him if a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he were cast into the sea .
41009043	If your hand causes you to stumble , cut it off . It is better for you to enter into life maimed , rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna , into the unquenchable fire ,
41009044	' where their worm doesn't die , and the fire is not quenched . '
41009045	If your foot causes you to stumble , cut it off . It is better for you to enter into life lame , rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna , into the fire that will never be quenched - -
41009046	' where their worm doesn't die , and the fire is not quenched . '
41009047	If your eye causes you to stumble , cast it out . It is better for you to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye , rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire ,
41009048	' where their worm doesn't die , and the fire is not quenched . '
41009049	For everyone will be salted with fire , and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt .
41009050	Salt is good , but if the salt has lost its saltiness , with what will you season it ? Have salt in yourselves , and be at peace with one another . "
41010001	He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan . Multitudes came together to him again . As he usually did , he taught them again .
