43018015	Simon Peter followed Jesus , as did another disciple . Now that disciple was known to the high priest , and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest ;
43018016	but Peter was standing at the door outside . So the other disciple , who was known to the high priest , went out and spoke to her who kept the door , and brought in Peter .
43018017	Then the maid who kept the door said to Peter , " Are you also one of this man's disciples ? " He said , " I am not . "
43018018	Now the servants and the officers were standing there , having made a fire of coals , for it was cold . They were warming themselves . Peter was with them , standing and warming himself .
43018019	The high priest therefore asked Jesus of his disciples , and of his teaching .
43018020	Jesus answered him , " I spoke openly to the world . I always taught in synagogues , and in the temple , where the Jews always meet . I said nothing in secret .
43018021	Why do you ask me ? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them . Behold , these know the things which I said . "
43018022	When he had said this , one of the officers standing by slapped Jesus with his hand , saying , " Do you answer the high priest like that ? "
43018023	Jesus answered him , " If I have spoken evil , testify of the evil ; but if well , why do you beat me ? "
43018024	Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas , the high priest .
43018025	Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself . They said therefore to him , " Are you also one of his disciples ? " He denied it , and said , " I am not . "
43018026	One of the servants of the high priest , being a relative of him whose ear Peter cut off , said , " Didn't I see you in the garden with him ? "
43018027	Peter therefore denied again , and immediately the rooster crowed .
43018028	They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium . It was early , and they themselves didn't enter into the Praetorium , that they might not be defiled , but might eat the Passover .
43018029	Pilate therefore went out to them , and said , " What accusation do you bring against this man ? "
43018030	They answered him , " If this man weren't an evildoer , we wouldn't have delivered him up to you . "
43018031	Pilate therefore said to them , " Take him yourselves , and judge him according to your law . " Therefore the Jews said to him , " It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death , "
43018032	that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled , which he spoke , signifying by what kind of death he should die .
43018033	Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium , called Jesus , and said to him , " Are you the King of the Jews ? "
43018034	Jesus answered him , " Do you say this of yourself , or did others tell it to you concerning me ? "
43018035	Pilate answered , " Am I a Jew ? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me . What have you done ? "
43018036	Jesus answered , " My kingdom is not of this world . If my kingdom were of this world , then my servants would fight , that I wouldn't be delivered to the Jews . But now my kingdom is not from here . "
43018037	Pilate therefore said to him , " Are you a king then ? " Jesus answered , " You say that I am a king . To this end have I been born , and to this end I have come into the world , that I should testify to the truth . Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice . "
43018038	Pilate said to him , " What is truth ? " When he had said this , he went out again to the Jews , and said to them , " I find no basis for a charge against him .
43018039	But you have a custom , that I should release to you one at the Passover . Therefore do you desire that I release to you the King of the Jews ? "
43018040	Then they all cried out again , saying , " Not this man , but Barabbas ! " Now Barabbas was a robber .
43019001	Then Pilate therefore took Jesus , and flogged him .
43019002	The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown , and put it on his head , and dressed him in a purple garment .
43019003	They said , " Hail , King of the Jews ! " and they struck him with their hands .
43019004	Then Pilate went out again , and said to them , " Behold , I bring him out to you , that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him . "

43019031	Therefore the Jews , because it was the Preparation , so that the bodies wouldn't remain on the cross on the Sabbath ( for that Sabbath was a special one ) , asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken , and that they might be taken away .

43019033	but when they came to Jesus , and saw that he was already dead , they didn't break his legs .

43019035	He who has seen has testified , and his testimony is true . He knows that he tells the truth , that you also may believe .

43019041	Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden . In the garden a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid .

44001001	The first book I wrote , Theophilus , concerned all that Jesus began both to do and to teach ,

44002001	Now when the day of Pentecost had come , they were all with one accord in one place .

44002007	They were all amazed and marveled , saying to one another , " Behold , aren't all these who speak Galileans ?

44002010	Phrygia , Pamphylia , Egypt , the parts of Libya around Cyrene , visitors from Rome , both Jews and proselytes ,

44002016	But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel :

44002021	It will be , that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved . '
44002022	" You men of Israel , hear these words . Jesus of Nazareth , a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him in the midst of you , even as you yourselves know ,
44002023	him , being delivered up by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God , you have taken by the hand of lawless men , crucified and killed ;
44002024	whom God raised up , having freed him from the agony of death , because it was not possible that he should be held by it .
44002025	For David says concerning him , ' I saw the Lord always before my face , For he is on my right hand , that I should not be moved .
44002026	Therefore my heart was glad , and my tongue rejoiced . Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope ;
44002027	Because you will not leave my soul in Hades , Neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay .
44002028	You made known to me the ways of life . You will make me full of gladness with your presence . '
44002029	" Brothers , I may tell you freely of the patriarch David , that he both died and was buried , and his tomb is with us to this day .
44002030	Therefore , being a prophet , and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body , according to the flesh , he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne ,
44002031	he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ , that neither was his soul left in Hades , nor did his flesh see decay .
44002032	This Jesus God raised up , whereof we all are witnesses .
44002033	Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God , and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit , he has poured forth this , which you now see and hear .
44002034	For David didn't ascend into the heavens , but he says himself , ' The Lord said to my Lord , " Sit by my right hand ,
44002035	Until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet . " '
44002036	" Let all the house of Israel therefore know assuredly that God has made him both Lord and Christ , this Jesus whom you crucified . "
44002037	Now when they heard this , they were cut to the heart , and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles , " Brothers , what will we do ? "
44002038	Peter said to them , " Repent , and be baptized , everyone of you , in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins , and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit .
44002039	For to you is the promise , and to your children , and to all who are far off , even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself . "
44002040	With many other words he testified , and exhorted them , saying , " Save yourselves from this crooked generation ! "
44002041	Then those who gladly received his word were baptized . There were added that day about three thousand souls .
44002042	They continued steadfastly in the apostles ' teaching and fellowship , in the breaking of bread , and prayer .
44002043	Fear came on every soul , and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles .
44002044	All who believed were together , and had all things common .
44002045	They sold their possessions and goods , and distributed them to all , according as anyone had need .
44002046	Day by day , continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple , and breaking bread at home , they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart ,
44002047	praising God , and having favor with all the people . The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved .
44003001	Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer , the ninth hour .
44003002	A certain man who was lame from his mother's womb was being carried , whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful , to ask alms of those who entered into the temple .
44003003	Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple , he asked to receive alms .
44003004	Peter , fastening his eyes on him , with John , said , " Look at us . "
44003005	He listened to them , expecting to receive something from them .
44003006	But Peter said , " Silver and gold have I none , but what I have , that I give you . In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth , rise and walk ! "
44003007	He took him by the right hand , and raised him up . Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength .
44003008	Leaping up , he stood , and began to walk . He entered with them into the temple , walking , leaping , and praising God .
44003009	All the people saw him walking and praising God .
44003010	They recognized him , that it was he who sat begging for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple . They were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened to him .
44003011	As the lame man who was healed held Peter and John , all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon's , greatly wondering .
44003012	When Peter saw it , he answered to the people , " You men of Israel , why do you marvel at this man ? Why do you fasten your eyes on us , as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk ?
44003013	The God of Abraham , Isaac , and Jacob , the God of our fathers , has glorified his Servant Jesus , whom you delivered up , and denied before the face of Pilate , when he had determined to release him .
44003014	But you denied the Holy and Righteous One , and asked for a murderer to be granted to you ,
44003015	and killed the Prince of life , whom God raised from the dead , whereof we are witnesses .
44003016	By faith in his name has his name made this man strong , whom you see and know . Yes , the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all .
44003017	" Now , brothers , I know that you did this in ignorance , as did also your rulers .
44003018	But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets , that Christ should suffer , he thus fulfilled .
44003019	Repent therefore , and turn again , that your sins may be blotted out , that so there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord ,
44003020	and that he may send Christ Jesus , who was ordained for you before ,
44003021	whom the heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things , whereof God spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets that have been from ancient times .
44003022	For Moses indeed said to the fathers , ' The Lord God will raise up a prophet to you from among your brothers , like me . You will listen to him in all things whatever he says to you .
44003023	It will be , that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people . '
44003024	Yes , and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after , as many as have spoken , they also told of these days .
44003025	You are the sons of the prophets , and of the covenant which God made with our fathers , saying to Abraham , ' In your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed . '
44003026	God , having raised up his servant , Jesus , sent him to you first , to bless you , in turning away everyone of you from your wickedness . "
44004001	As they spoke to the people , the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them ,
44004002	being upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead .
44004003	They laid hands on them , and put them in custody until the next day , for it was now evening .
44004004	But many of those who heard the word believed , and the number of the men came to be about five thousand .
44004005	It happened in the morning , that their rulers , elders , and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem .
44004006	Annas the high priest was there , with Caiaphas , John , Alexander , and as many as were relatives of the high priest .
44004007	When they had stood them in the midst , they inquired , " By what power , or in what name , have you done this ? "
44004008	Then Peter , filled with the Holy Spirit , said to them , " You rulers of the people , and elders of Israel ,
44004009	if we are examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man , by what means this man has been healed ,
44004010	be it known to you all , and to all the people of Israel , that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth , whom you crucified , whom God raised from the dead , in him does this man stand here before you whole .
44004011	He is ' the stone which was regarded as worthless by you , the builders , which was made the head of the corner . '
44004012	There is salvation in none other , for neither is there any other name under heaven , that is given among men , in which we must be saved ! "
44004013	Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John , and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men , they marveled . They recognized that they had been with Jesus .
44004014	Seeing the man who was healed standing with them , they could say nothing against it .
44004015	But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council , they conferred among themselves ,
44004016	saying , " What will we do to these men ? Because indeed a notable miracle has been done through them , as can be plainly seen by all who dwell in Jerusalem , and we can't deny it .
44004017	But so that this spreads no further among the people , let's threaten them , that from now on they don't speak to anyone in this name . "
44004018	They called them , and charged them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus .
44004019	But Peter and John answered them , " Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God , judge for yourselves ,
44004020	for we can't help telling the things which we saw and heard . "
44004021	They , when they had further threatened them , let them go , finding no way to punish them , because of the people ; for everyone glorified God for that which was done .
44004022	For the man was more than forty years old , on whom this miracle of healing was performed .
44004023	Being let go , they came to their own company , and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them .
44004024	They , when they heard it , lifted up their voice to God with one accord , and said , " O Lord , you are God , who made the heaven , the earth , the sea , and all that is in them ;
44004025	who by the mouth of your servant , David , said , ' Why do the nations rage , And the peoples plot a vain thing ?
44004026	The kings of the earth take a stand , And the rulers take council together , Against the Lord , and against his Christ . '
44004027	For truly , in this city against your holy servant , Jesus , whom you anointed , both Herod and Pontius Pilate , with the Gentiles and the people of Israel , were gathered together
44004028	to do whatever your hand and your council foreordained to happen .
44004029	Now , Lord , look at their threats , and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness ,
44004030	while you stretch forth your hand to heal ; and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of your holy Servant Jesus . "
44004031	When they had prayed , the place was shaken where they were gathered together . They were all filled with the Holy Spirit , and they spoke the word of God with boldness .
44004032	The multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul . Not one of them claimed that anything of the things which he possessed was his own , but they had all things common .
44004033	With great power , the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus . Great grace was on them all .
44004034	For neither was there among them any who lacked , for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them , and brought the prices of the things that were sold ,
44004035	and laid them at the apostles ' feet , and distribution was made to each , according as anyone had need .
44004036	Joses , who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas ( which is , being interpreted , Son of Exhortation ) , a Levite , a man of Cyprus by race ,
44004037	having a field , sold it , and brought the money and laid it at the apostles ' feet .
44005001	But a certain man named Ananias , with Sapphira , his wife , sold a possession ,
44005002	and kept back part of the price , his wife also being aware of it , and brought a certain part , and laid it at the apostles ' feet .
44005003	But Peter said , " Ananias , why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit , and to keep back part of the price of the land ?
44005004	While you kept it , didn't it remain your own ? After it was sold , wasn't it in your power ? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart ? You haven't lied to men , but to God . "
44005005	Ananias , hearing these words , fell down and died . Great fear came on all who heard these things .
44005006	The young men arose and wrapped him up , and they carried him out and buried him .
44005007	About three hours later , his wife , not knowing what was had happened , came in .
44005008	Peter answered her , " Tell me whether you sold the land for so much . " She said , " Yes , for so much . "
44005009	But Peter asked her , " How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord ? Behold , the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door , and they will carry you out . "
44005010	She fell down immediately at his feet , and died . The young men came in and found her dead , and they carried her out and buried her by her husband .
44005011	Great fear came on the whole assembly , and on all who heard these things .
44005012	By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people . They were all with one accord in Solomon's porch .
44005013	None of the rest dared to join them , however the people honored them .
44005014	More believers were added to the Lord , multitudes of both men and women .
44005015	They even carried out the sick into the streets , and laid them on cots and mattresses , so that as Peter came by , at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them .
44005016	Multitudes also came together from the cities around Jerusalem , bringing sick people , and those who were tormented by unclean spirits : and they were all healed .
44005017	But the high priest rose up , and all those who were with him ( which is the sect of the Sadducees ) , and they were filled with jealousy ,
44005018	and laid hands on the apostles , and put them in public custody .
44005019	But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night , and brought them out , and said ,
44005020	" Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life . "
44005021	When they heard this , they entered into the temple about daybreak , and taught . But the high priest came , and those who were with him , and called the council together , and all the senate of the children of Israel , and sent to the prison to have them brought .
44005022	But the officers who came didn't find them in the prison . They returned and reported ,
44005023	" We found the prison shut and locked , and the guards standing before the doors , but when we had opened it up , we found no one inside . "
44005024	Now when the high priest , the captain of the temple , and the chief priests heard these words , they were very perplexed about them and what might become of this .
44005025	One came and told them , " Behold , the men whom you put in prison are in the temple , standing and teaching the people . "
44005026	Then the captain went with the officers , and brought them without violence , for they were afraid that the people might stone them .
44005027	When they had brought them , they set them before the council . The high priest questioned them ,
44005028	saying , " Didn't we strictly charge you not to teach in this name ? Behold , you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching , and intend to bring this man's blood on us . "
44005029	But Peter and the apostles answered , " We must obey God rather than men .
44005030	The God of our fathers raised up Jesus , whom you killed , hanging him on a tree .
44005031	God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior , to give repentance to Israel , and remission of sins .
44005032	We are His witnesses of these things ; and so also is the Holy Spirit , whom God has given to those who obey him . "
44005033	But they , when they heard this , were cut to the heart , and determined to kill them .
44005034	But one stood up in the council , a Pharisee named Gamaliel , a teacher of the law , honored by all the people , and commanded to take the apostles out a little while .
44005035	He said to them , " You men of Israel , be careful concerning these men , what you are about to do .
44005036	For before these days Theudas rose up , making himself out to be somebody ; to whom a number of men , about four hundred , joined themselves : who was slain ; and all , as many as obeyed him , were dispersed , and came to nothing .
44005037	After this man , Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment , and drew away some people after him . He also perished , and all , as many as obeyed him , were scattered abroad .
44005038	Now I tell you , refrain from these men , and leave them alone . For if this counsel or this work is of men , it will be overthrown .
44005039	But if it is of God , you will not be able to overthrow it , and you would be found even to be fighting against God . "
44005040	They agreed with him . When they had called the apostles to them , they beat them and charged them not to speak in the name of Jesus , and let them go .
44005041	They therefore departed from the presence of the council , rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus ' name .
44005042	Every day , in the temple and at home , they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus , the Christ .
44006001	Now in those days , when the number of the disciples was multiplying , there arose a grumbling of the Grecian Jews against the Hebrews because their widows were neglected in the daily service .
44006002	The twelve called the multitude of the disciples to them and said , " It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables .
44006003	Therefore select from among you , brothers , seven men of good report , full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom , whom we may appoint over this business .
44006004	But we will continue steadfastly in prayer and in the ministry of the word . "
44006005	These words pleased the whole multitude . They chose Stephen , a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit , Philip , Prochorus , Nicanor , Timon , Parmenas , and Nicolaus , a proselyte of Antioch ;
44006006	whom they set before the apostles . When they had prayed , they laid their hands on them .
44006007	The word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly . A great company of the priests were obedient to the faith .
44006008	Stephen , full of faith and power , performed great wonders and signs among the people .
44006009	But some of those who were of the synagogue called " The Libertines , " and of the Cyrenians , of the Alexandrians , and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose , disputing with Stephen .
44006010	They weren't able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke .
44006011	Then they secretly induced men who said , " We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God . "
44006012	They stirred up the people , the elders , and the scribes , and came on him and seized him , and brought him in to the council ,
44006013	and set up false witnesses who said , " This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law .
44006014	For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place , and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us . "
44006015	All who sat in the council , fastening their eyes on him , saw his face like it was the face of an angel .
44007001	The high priest said , " Are these things so ? "
44007002	He said , " Brothers and fathers , listen . The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham , when he was in Mesopotamia , before he lived in Haran ,
44007003	and said to him , ' Get out of your land , and from your relatives , and come into a land which I will show you . '
44007004	Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans , and lived in Haran . From there , when his father was dead , God moved him into this land , where you are now living .
44007005	He gave him no inheritance in it , no , not so much as to set his foot on . He promised that he would give it to him in possession , and to his seed after him , when he still had no child .
44007006	God spoke thus , that his seed would live as aliens in a strange land , and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years .
44007007	' I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage , ' said God , ' and after that will they come out , and serve me in this place . '
44007008	He gave him the covenant of circumcision . So Abraham became the father of Isaac , and circumcised him the eighth day . Isaac became the father of Jacob , and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs .
44007009	" The patriarchs , moved with jealousy against Joseph , sold him into Egypt . God was with him ,
44007010	and delivered him out of all his afflictions , and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh , king of Egypt . He made him governor over Egypt and all his house .
44007011	Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan , and great affliction . Our fathers found no food .
44007012	But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt , he sent forth our fathers the first time .
44007013	On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers , and Joseph's race was revealed to Pharaoh .
44007014	Joseph sent , and called Jacob , his father , to him , and all his relatives , seventy-five souls .
44007015	Jacob went down into Egypt , and he died , himself and our fathers ,
44007016	and they were brought back to Shechem , and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the sons of Hamor of Shechem .
44007017	" But as the time of the promise came close which God swore to Abraham , the people grew and multiplied in Egypt ,
44007018	until there arose a different king , who didn't know Joseph .
44007019	The same dealt slyly with our race , and mistreated our fathers , that they should throw out their babies , so that they wouldn't stay alive .
44007020	At that time Moses was born , and was exceedingly handsome . He was nourished three months in his father's house .
44007021	When he was thrown out , Pharaoh's daughter took him up , and reared him as her own son .
44007022	Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians . He was mighty in his words and works .
44007023	But when he was forty years old , it came into his heart to visit his brothers , the children of Israel .
44007024	Seeing one of them suffer wrong , he defended him , and avenged him who was oppressed , striking the Egyptian .
44007025	He supposed that his brothers understood that God , by his hand , was giving them deliverance ; but they didn't understand .
44007026	The day following , he appeared to them as they fought , and urged them to be at peace again , saying , ' Sirs , you are brothers . Why do you wrong one to another ? '
44007027	But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away , saying , ' Who made you a ruler and a judge over us ?
44007028	Do you want to kill me , as you killed the Egyptian yesterday ? '
44007029	Moses fled at this saying , and became an alien in the land of Midian , where he became the father of two sons .
44007030	" When forty years were fulfilled , an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai , in a flame of fire in a bush .
44007031	When Moses saw it , he wondered at the sight . As he came close to see , a voice of the Lord came to him ,
44007032	' I am the God of your fathers , the God of Abraham , the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob . ' Moses trembled , and dared not look .
44007033	The Lord said to him , ' Take your sandals off of your feet , for the place where you stand is holy ground .
44007034	I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt , and have heard their groaning . I have come down to deliver them . Now come , I will send you into Egypt . '
44007035	" This Moses , whom they refused , saying , ' Who made you a ruler and a judge ? ' - - God has sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer with the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush .
44007036	This man led them forth , having worked wonders and signs in Egypt , in the Red Sea , and in the wilderness forty years .
44007037	This is that Moses , who said to the children of Israel , ' The Lord God will raise up a prophet to you from among your brothers , like me . '
44007038	This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel that spoke to him in the Mount Sinai , and with our fathers , who received living oracles to give to us ,
44007039	to whom our fathers wouldn't be obedient , but rejected him , and turned back in their hearts to Egypt ,
44007040	saying to Aaron , ' Make us gods that will go before us , for as for this Moses , who led us forth out of the land of Egypt , we don't know what has become of him . '
44007041	They made a calf in those days , and brought a sacrifice to the idol , and rejoiced in the works of their hands .
44007042	But God turned , and gave them up to serve the host of the sky , as it is written in the book of the prophets , ' Did you offer to me slain animals and sacrifices Forty years in the wilderness , O house of Israel ?
44007043	You took up the tent of Moloch , The star of your god Rephan , The figures which you made to worship . I will carry you away beyond Babylon . '
44007044	" Our fathers had the tent of the testimony in the wilderness , even as he who spoke to Moses appointed , that he should make it according to the pattern that he had seen .
44007045	Which also our fathers , in their turn , brought in with Joshua when they entered into the possession of the nations , whom God drove out before the face of our fathers , to the days of David ,
44007046	who found favor in the sight of God , and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob .
44007047	But Solomon built him a house .
44007048	However , the Most High doesn't dwell in temples made with hands , as the prophet says ,
44007049	' heaven is my throne , And the earth the footstool of my feet . What kind of house will you build me ? ' says the Lord ; ' Or what is the place of my rest ?
44007050	Didn't my hand make all these things ? '
44007051	" You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears , you always resist the Holy Spirit ! As your fathers did , so you do .
44007052	Which of the prophets didn't your fathers persecute ? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One , of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers .
44007053	You received the law as it was ordained by angels , and didn't keep it ! "
44007054	Now when they heard these things , they were cut to the heart , and they gnashed at him with their teeth .
44007055	But he , being full of the Holy Spirit , looked up steadfastly into heaven , and saw the glory of God , and Jesus standing on the right hand of God ,
44007056	and said , " Behold , I see the heavens opened , and the Son of Man standing on the right hand of God ! "
44007057	But they cried out with a loud voice , and stopped their ears , and rushed at him with one accord .
44007058	They threw him out of the city , and stoned him . The witnesses placed their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul .
44007059	They stoned Stephen , as he called on the Lord , saying , " Lord Jesus , receive my Spirit ! "
44007060	He kneeled down , and cried with a loud voice , " Lord , don't hold this sin against them ! " When he had said this , he fell asleep .
44008001	Saul was consenting to his death . A great persecution arose against the assembly which was in Jerusalem in that day . They were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria , except for the apostles .
44008002	Devout men buried Stephen , and lamented greatly over him .
44008003	But Saul ravaged the assembly , entering into every house , and dragged both men and women off to prison .
44008004	Therefore those who were scattered abroad went around preaching the word .
44008005	Philip went down to the city of Samaria , and proclaimed to them the Christ .
44008006	The multitudes listened with one accord to the things that were spoken by Philip , when they heard and saw the signs which he did .
44008007	For unclean spirits came out of many of those who had them . They came out , crying with a loud voice . Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed .
44008008	There was great joy in that city .
44008009	But there was a certain man , Simon by name , who had used sorcery in the city before , and amazed the people of Samaria , making himself out to be some great one ,
44008010	to whom they all listened , from the least to the greatest , saying , " This man is that great power of God . "
44008011	They listened to him , because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries .
44008012	But when they believed Philip preaching good news concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ , they were baptized , both men and women .
44008013	Simon himself also believed . Being baptized , he continued with Philip . Seeing signs and great miracles done , he was amazed .
44008014	Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God , they sent Peter and John to them ,
44008015	who , when they had come down , prayed for them , that they might receive the Holy Spirit ;
44008016	for as yet he had fallen on none of them . They had only been baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus .
44008017	Then they laid their hands on them , and they received the Holy Spirit .
44008018	Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles ' hands , he offered them money ,
44008019	saying , " Give me also this power , that whoever I lay my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit . "
44008020	But Peter said to him , " May your silver perish with you , because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money !
44008021	You have neither part nor lot in this matter , for your heart isn't right before God .
44008022	Repent therefore of this , your wickedness , and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you .
44008023	For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity . "
44008024	Simon answered , " Pray for me to the Lord , that none of the things which you have spoken come on me . "
44008025	They therefore , when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord , returned to Jerusalem , and preached the gospel to many villages of the Samaritans .
44008026	But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip , saying , " Arise , and go toward the south to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza . This is a desert . "
44008027	He arose and went . Behold , there was a man of Ethiopia , a eunuch of great authority under Candace , queen of the Ethiopians , who was over all her treasure , who had come to Jerusalem to worship .
44008028	He was returning and sitting in his chariot , and was reading the prophet Isaiah .
44008029	The Spirit said to Philip , " Go near , and join yourself to this chariot . "
44008030	Philip ran to him , and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet , and said , " Do you understand you what you are reading ? "
44008031	He said , " How can I , unless someone explains it to me ? " He begged Philip to come up and sit with him .
44008032	Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this , " He was led as a sheep to the slaughter . As a lamb before his shearer is silent , So he doesn't open his mouth .
44008033	In his humiliation , his judgment was taken away . Who will declare His generations ? For his life is taken from the earth . "
44008034	The eunuch answered Philip , " Please tell who the prophet is talking about : about himself , or about some other ? "
44008035	Philip opened his mouth , and beginning from this Scripture , preached to him Jesus .
44008036	As they went on the way , they came to some water , and the eunuch said , " Behold , here is water . What is keeping me from being baptized ? "
44008037	dummy verses inserted by amos

44009001	But Saul , still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord , went to the high priest ,

44009006	But rise up , and enter into the city , and you will be told what you must do . "
44009007	The men who traveled with him stood speechless , hearing the voice , but seeing no one .

44009009	He was without sight for three days , and neither ate nor drank .
44009010	Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias . The Lord said to him in a vision , " Ananias ! " He said , " Behold , it's me , Lord . "
44009011	The Lord said to him , " Arise , and go to the street which is called Straight , and inquire in the house of Judas for one named Saul , a man of Tarsus . For behold , he is praying ,

44009037	It happened in those days that she fell sick , and died . When they had washed her , they laid her in an upper chamber .

44010001	Now there was a certain man in Caesarea , Cornelius by name , a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment ,
44010002	a devout man , and one who feared God with all his house , who gave alms generously to the people , and always prayed to God .

44010004	He , fastening his eyes on him , and being frightened , said , " What is it , Lord ? " He said to him , " Your prayers and your alms have gone up for a memorial before God .

44010006	He lodges with one Simon a tanner , whose house is by the seaside . "

44012001	Now about that time , Herod the king put forth his hands to oppress some of the assembly .

44012005	Peter therefore was kept in the prison , but constant prayer was made by the assembly to God for him .
44012006	The same night when Herod was about to bring him out , Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , bound with two chains . Guards in front of the door kept the prison .
44012007	Behold , an angel of the Lord stood by him , and a light shone in the cell . He struck Peter on the side , and woke him up , saying , " Stand up quickly ! " His chains fell off from his hands .

44012016	But Peter continued knocking . When they had opened , they saw him , and were amazed .

44012020	Now Herod was highly displeased with those of Tyre and Sidon . They came with one accord to him , and , having made Blastus , the king's chamberlain , their friend , they asked for peace , because their country depended on the king's country for food .
44012021	On an appointed day , Herod dressed himself in royal clothing , sat on the throne , and gave a speech to them .
44012022	The people shouted , " The voice of a god , and not of a man ! "
44012023	Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him , because he didn't give God the glory , and he was eaten by worms , and he died .

44012025	Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem , when they had fulfilled their service , also taking with them John whose surname was Mark .
44013001	Now in the assembly that was at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers : Barnabas , Simeon who was called Niger , Lucius of Cyrene , Manaen the foster-brother of Herod the tetrarch , and Saul .

44013006	When they had gone through the island to Paphos , they found a certain sorcerer , a false prophet , a Jew , whose name was Bar-Jesus ,
44013007	who was with the proconsul , Sergius Paulus , a man of understanding . The same called Barnabas and Saul to him , and sought to hear the word of God .
44013008	But Elymas the sorcerer ( for so is his name by interpretation ) withstood them , seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith .
44013009	But Saul , who is also called Paul , filled with the Holy Spirit , fastened his eyes on him ,
44013010	and said , " Full of all deceit and all cunning , you son of the devil , you enemy of all righteousness , will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord ?

44013012	Then the proconsul , when he saw what was done , believed , being astonished at the teaching of the Lord .

44013014	But they , passing through from Perga , came to Antioch of Pisidia . They went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day , and sat down .

44013016	Paul stood up , and beckoning with his hand said , " Men of Israel , and you who fear God , listen .
44013017	The God of this people Israel chose our fathers , and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt , and with an uplifted arm , he led them forth out of it .
44013018	For about the time of forty years he put up with them in the wilderness .

44013020	After these things he gave them judges until Samuel , the prophet .

44013022	When he had removed him , he raised up David to be their king , to whom he also testified , ' I have found David , the son of Jesse , a man after my heart , who will do all my will . '
44013023	From this man's seed , God has brought salvation to Israel according to his promise ,
44013024	before his coming , when John had first preached the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel .

44013031	and he was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who are his witnesses to the people .

44013034	" Concerning that he raised him up from the dead , now no more to return to corruption , he has spoken thus : ' I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David . '

44013048	As the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of God . As many as were appointed to eternal life believed .
44013049	The Lord's word was spread abroad throughout all the region .
44013050	But the Jews urged on the devout women of honorable estate , and the chief men of the city , and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and threw them out of their borders .
44013051	But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came to Iconium .
44013052	The disciples were filled with joy with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	It happened in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews , and so spoke that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed .
44014002	But the disobedient Jews stirred up and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers .
44014003	Therefore they stayed there a long time , speaking boldly in the Lord , who testified to the word of his grace , granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
44014004	But the multitude of the city was divided . Part sided with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
44014005	When some of both the Gentiles and the Jews , with their rulers , made a violent attempt to insult them and to stone them ,
44014006	they became aware of it , and fled to the cities of Lycaonia , Lystra , Derbe , and the surrounding region .
44014007	There they preached the gospel .
44014008	At Lystra a certain man sat , impotent in his feet , a cripple from his mother's womb , who never had walked .
44014009	He was listening to Paul speaking , who , fastening eyes on him , and seeing that he had faith to be made whole ,
44014010	said with a loud voice , " Stand upright on your feet ! " He leaped up and walked .
44014011	When the multitude saw what Paul had done , they lifted up their voice , saying in the language of Lycaonia , " The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men ! "

44014016	who in the generations gone by allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways .
44014017	Yet he didn't leave himself without witness , in that he did good and gave you rains from the sky and fruitful seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness . "
44014018	Even saying these things , they hardly stopped the multitudes from making a sacrifice to them .
44014019	But some Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there , and having persuaded the multitudes , they stoned Paul , and dragged him out of the city , supposing that he was dead .
44014020	But as the disciples stood around him , he rose up , and entered into the city . On the next day he went out with Barnabas to Derbe .
44014021	When they had preached the gospel to that city , and had made many disciples , they returned to Lystra , Iconium , and Antioch ,
44014022	confirming the souls of the disciples , exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that through many afflictions we must enter into the kingdom of God .
44014023	When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , on whom they had believed .
44014024	They passed through Pisidia , and came to Pamphylia .
44014025	When they had spoken the word in Perga , they went down to Attalia .
44014026	From there they sailed to Antioch , from where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled .
44014027	When they had arrived , and had gathered the assembly together , they reported all the things that God had done with them , and that he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles .
44014028	They stayed there with the disciples for a long time .
44015001	Some men came down from Judea and taught the brothers , " Unless you are circumcised after the custom of Moses , you can't be saved . "
44015002	Therefore when Paul and Barnabas had no small discord and discussion with them , they appointed Paul and Barnabas , and some others of them , to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question .
44015003	They , being sent on their way by the assembly , passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles . They caused great joy to all the brothers .
44015004	When they had come to Jerusalem , they were received by the assembly and the apostles and the elders , and they reported all things that God had done with them .
44015005	But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up , saying , " It is necessary to circumcise them , and to charge them to keep the law of Moses . "
44015006	The apostles and the elders were gathered together to see about this matter .
44015007	When there had been much discussion , Peter rose up and said to them , " Brothers , you know that a good while ago God made choice among you , that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
44015008	God , who knows the heart , testified about them , giving them the Holy Spirit , just like he did to us .
44015009	He made no distinction between us and them , cleansing their hearts by faith .
44015010	Now therefore why do you tempt God , that you should put a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
44015011	But we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus , just as they are . "
44015012	All the multitude kept silence , and they listened to Barnabas and Paul reporting what signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them .
44015013	After they were silent , James answered , " Brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Simeon has reported how God first visited the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
44015015	This agrees with the words of the prophets . As it is written ,
44015016	' After these things I will return . I will again build the tent of David , which has fallen . I will again build its ruins . I will set it up :
44015017	That the rest of men may seek after the Lord ; All the Gentiles who are called by my name , Says the Lord , who does all these things .
44015018	All his works are known to God from eternity . '
44015019	" Therefore my judgment is that we don't trouble those from among the Gentiles who turn to God ,
44015020	but that we write to them that they abstain from the pollution of idols , from sexual immorality , from what is strangled , and from blood .
44015021	For Moses from generations of old has in every city those who preach him , being read in the synagogues every Sabbath . "
44015022	Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders , with the whole assembly , to choose men out of their company , and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas : Judas called Barsabbas , and Silas , chief men among the brothers .
44015023	They wrote these things by their hand : " The apostles , the elders , and the brothers , to the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia : greetings .
44015024	Because we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words , unsettling your souls , saying , ' You must be circumcised and keep the law , ' to whom we gave no commandment ;
44015025	it seemed good to us , having come to one accord , to choose out men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
44015026	men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
44015027	We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who themselves will also tell you the same things by word of mouth .
44015028	For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit , and to us , to lay no greater burden on you than these necessary things :
44015029	that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols , from blood , from things strangled , and from sexual immorality , from which if you keep yourselves , it will be well with you . Farewell . "
44015030	So , when they were sent off , they came to Antioch . Having gathered the multitude together , they delivered the letter .
44015031	When they had read it , they rejoiced for the consolation .
44015032	Judas and Silas , also being prophets themselves , encouraged the brothers with many words , and strengthened them .
44015033	After they had spent some time there , they were sent back with greetings from the brothers to the apostles .
44015034	dummy verses inserted by amos
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
44015036	After some days Paul said to Barnabas , " Let's return now and visit our brothers in every city in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord , to see how they are doing . "
44015037	Barnabas planned to take John with them also , who was called Mark .
44015038	But Paul didn't think that it was a good idea to take with them someone who withdrew from them from Pamphylia , and didn't go with them to do the work .
44015039	Then there arose a sharp contention , so that they separated from each other . Barnabas took Mark with him , and sailed away to Cyprus ,
44015040	but Paul chose Silas , and went out , being commended by the brothers to the grace of God .
44015041	He went through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the assemblies .
44016001	He came to Derbe and Lystra : and behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timothy , the son of a Jewess who believed ; but his father was a Greek .
44016002	The brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium gave a good testimony about him .
44016003	Paul wanted to have him go forth with him , and he took and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those parts ; for they all knew that his father was a Greek .
44016004	As they went on their way through the cities , they delivered the decrees to them to keep which had been ordained by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem .
44016005	So the assemblies were strengthened in the faith , and increased in number daily .
44016006	When they had gone through the region of Phrygia and Galatia , they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia .
44016007	When they had come opposite Mysia , they tried to go into Bithynia , but the Spirit didn't allow them .
44016008	Passing by Mysia , they came down to Troas .
44016009	A vision appeared to Paul in the night . There was a man of Macedonia standing , begging him , and saying , " Come over into Macedonia and help us . "
44016010	When he had seen the vision , immediately we sought to go forth into Macedonia , concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the gospel to them .
44016011	Setting sail therefore from Troas , we made a straight course to Samothrace , and the day following to Neapolis ;
44016012	and from there to Philippi , which is a city of Macedonia , the first of the district , a Roman colony . We were staying some days in this city .
44016013	On the Sabbath day we went forth outside of the city by a riverside , where we supposed there was a place of prayer , and we sat down , and spoke to the women who had come together .
44016014	A certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , one who worshipped God , heard us ; whose heart the Lord opened to listen to the things which were spoken by Paul .
44016015	When she and her household were baptized , she begged us , saying , " If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and stay . " She urged us .
44016016	It happened , as we were going to prayer , that a certain girl having a spirit of divination met us , who brought her masters much gain by fortune telling .
44016017	The same , following after Paul and us , cried out , " These men are servants of the Most High God , who proclaim to us the way of salvation ! "
44016018	This she did for many days . But Paul , becoming distressed , turned and said to the spirit , " I charge you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her ! " It came out that very hour .
44016019	But when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone , they laid hold on Paul and Silas , and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers .
44016020	When they had brought them to the magistrates , they said , " These men , being Jews , are agitating our city ,
44016021	and set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to accept or to observe , being Romans . "
44016022	The multitude rose up together against them , and the magistrates tore their clothes off of them , and commanded them to be beaten with rods .
44016023	When they had laid many stripes on them , they threw them into prison , charging the jailer to keep them safely ,
44016024	who , having received such a charge , threw them into the inner prison , and secured their feet in the stocks .
44016025	But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken ; and immediately all the doors were opened , and everyone's bonds were loosened .
44016027	The jailer , being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open , drew his sword and was about to kill himself , supposing that the prisoners had escaped .
44016028	But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , " Don't harm yourself , for we are all here ! "
44016029	He called for lights and sprang in , and , fell down trembling before Paul and Silas ,
44016030	and brought them out and said , " Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? "
44016031	They said , " Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ , and you will be saved , you and your house . "
44016032	They spoke the word of the Lord to him , and to all who were in his house .
44016033	He took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes , and was immediately baptized , he and all his household .
44016034	He brought them up into his house , and set food before them , and rejoiced greatly , with all his house , having believed in God .
44016035	But when it was day , the magistrates sent the sergeants , saying , " Let those men go . "
44016036	The jailer reported these words to Paul , saying , " The magistrates have sent to let you go ; now therefore come out , and go in peace . "
44016037	But Paul said to them , " They have beaten us publicly , without a trial , men who are Romans , and have cast us into prison ! Do they now release us secretly ? No , most assuredly , but let them come themselves and bring us out ! "
44016038	The sergeants reported these words to the magistrates , and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans ,
44016039	and they came and begged them . When they had brought them out , they asked them to depart from the city .
44016040	They went out of the prison , and entered into Lydia's house . When they had seen the brothers , they comforted them , and departed .
44017001	Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where there was a synagogue of the Jews .
44017002	Paul , as was his custom , went in to them , and for three Sabbath days reasoned with them from the Scriptures ,
44017003	explaining and demonstrating that the Christ had to suffer , and to rise again from the dead , and saying , " This Jesus , whom I proclaim to you , is the Christ . "
44017004	Some of them were persuaded , and joined Paul and Silas , of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and not a few of the chief women .
44017005	But the disobedient Jews gathered some wicked men from the marketplace , and gathering a crowd , set the city in an uproar . Assaulting the house of Jason , they sought to bring them forth to the people .
44017006	When they didn't find them , they dragged Jason and certain brothers before the rulers of the city , crying , " These who have turned the world upside down have come here also ,
44017007	whom Jason has received . These all act contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , Jesus ! "
44017008	The multitude and the rulers of the city were troubled when they heard these things .
44017009	When they had taken security from Jason and the rest , they let them go .
44017010	The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea . When they arrived , they went into the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of the mind , examining the Scriptures daily , whether these things were so .
44017012	Many of them therefore believed ; also of the Greek women of honorable estate , and not a few men .
44017013	But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Beroea also , they came there likewise , agitating the multitudes .
44017014	Then the brothers immediately sent forth Paul to go as far as to the sea , and Silas and Timothy still stayed there .
44017015	But those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens . Receiving a commandment to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him with all speed , they departed .
44017016	Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was provoked within him as he saw the city full of idols .
44017017	So he reasoned in the synagogue with Jews and the devout persons , and in the marketplace every day with those who met him .
44017018	Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also encountered him . Some said , " What does this babbler want to say ? " Others said , " He seems to be advocating foreign demons , " because he preached Jesus and the resurrection .
44017019	They took hold of him , and brought him to the Areopagus , saying , " May we know what this new teaching is , which is spoken by you ?
44017020	For you bring certain strange things to our ears . We want to know therefore what these things mean . "
44017021	Now all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell or to hear some new thing .
44017022	Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus , and said , " You men of Athens , I perceive that you are very religious in all things .
44017023	For as I passed along , and observed the objects of your worship , I found also an altar with this inscription : ' TO AN UNKNOWN GOD . ' What therefore you worship in ignorance , this I announce to you .
44017024	The God who made the world and all things in it , he , being Lord of heaven and earth , dwells not in temples made with hands ,
44017025	neither is he served by men's hands , as though he needed anything , seeing he himself gives to all life and breath , and all things .
44017026	He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the surface of the earth , having determined appointed seasons , and the bounds of their habitation ,
44017027	that they should seek the Lord , if perhaps they might reach out for him and find him , though he is not far from each one of us .
44017028	' For in him we live , and move , and have our being . ' As some of your own poets have said , ' For we are also his offspring . '
44017029	Being then the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Divine Nature is like gold , or silver , or stone , engraved by art and device of man .
44017030	The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked . But now he commands that all men everywhere should repent ,
44017031	because he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has ordained ; whereof he has given assurance to all men , in that he has raised him from the dead . "
44017032	Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked ; but others said , " We want to hear you yet again concerning this . "
44017033	Thus Paul went out from among them .
44017034	But certain men joined with him , and believed , among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth .
44018002	He found a certain Jew named Aquila , a man of Pontus by race , who had recently come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla , because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome . He came to them ,
44018003	and because he practiced the same trade , he lived with them and worked , for by trade they were tent makers .
44018004	He reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath , and persuaded Jews and Greeks .
44018005	But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia , Paul was compelled by the Spirit , testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ .
44018006	When they opposed him and blasphemed , he shook out his clothing and said to them , " Your blood be on your own heads ! I am clean . From now on , I will go to the Gentiles ! "
44018007	He departed there , and went into the house of a certain man named Justus , one who worshipped God , whose house was next door to the synagogue .
44018008	Crispus , the ruler of the synagogue , believed in the Lord with all his house . Many of the Corinthians , hearing , believed and were baptized .
44018009	The Lord said to Paul in the night by a vision , " Don't be afraid , but speak and don't be silent ;
44018010	for I am with you , and no one will attack you to harm you , for I have many people in this city . "
44018011	He lived there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
44018012	But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia , the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat ,
44018013	saying , " This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law . "
44018014	But when Paul was about to open his mouth , Gallio said to the Jews , " If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked crime , Jews , it would be reasonable that I should bear with you ;
44018015	but if they are questions about words and names and your own law , look to it yourselves . For I don't want to be a judge of these matters . "
44018016	He drove them from the judgment seat .
44018017	Then all the Greeks laid hold on Sosthenes , the ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . Gallio didn't care about any of these things .
44018018	Paul , having stayed after this yet many days , took his leave of the brothers , and sailed from there for Syria , and Priscilla and Aquila with him . He shaved his head in Cenchreae , for he had a vow .
44018019	He came to Ephesus , and he left them there ; but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
44018020	When they asked him to stay a longer time , he declined ;
44018021	but taking his leave of them , and saying , " I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem , but I will return again to you if God wills , " he set sail from Ephesus .
44018022	When he had landed at Caesarea , he went up and greeted the assembly , and went down to Antioch .
44018023	Having spent some time there , he departed , and went through the region of Galatia , and Phrygia , in order , establishing all the disciples .
44018024	Now a certain Jew named Apollos , an Alexandrian by race , an eloquent man , came to Ephesus . He was mighty in the scriptures .
44018025	This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in spirit , he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus , although he knew only the baptism of John .
44018026	He began to speak boldly in the synagogue . But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they took him aside , and explained to him the way of God more accurately .
44018027	When he had determined to pass over into Achaia , the brothers encouraged him , and wrote to the disciples to receive him . When he had come , he helped them much , who had believed through grace ;
44018028	for he powerfully refuted the Jews , publicly showing by the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ .
44019001	It happened that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul , having passed through the upper country , came to Ephesus , and found certain disciples .
44019002	He said to them , " Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed ? " They said to him , " No , we did not so much as hear whether there is a Holy Spirit . "
44019003	He said , " Into what then were you baptized ? " They said , " Into John's baptism . "
44019004	Paul said , " John indeed baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying to the people that they should believe in the one who would come after him , that is , on Jesus . "
44019005	When they heard this , they were baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus .
44019006	When Paul had laid his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came on them , and they spoke with other languages , and prophesied .
44019007	They were about twelve men in all .
44019008	He entered into the synagogue , and spoke boldly for a period of three months , reasoning and persuading about the things concerning the kingdom of God .
44019009	But when some were hardened and disobedient , speaking evil of the Way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus .
44019010	This continued for the space of two years , so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
44019011	God worked special miracles by the hands of Paul ,
44019012	insomuch that handkerchiefs or aprons were carried away from his body to the sick , and the evil spirits went out .
44019013	But some of the itinerant Jews , exorcists , took on themselves to name over those who had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , " We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches . "
44019014	There were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jewish chief priest , who did this .
44019015	The evil spirit answered , " Jesus I know , and Paul I know , but who are you ? "
44019016	The man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overpowered them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
44019017	This became known to all , both Jews and Greeks , who lived at Ephesus . Fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
44019018	Many also of those who had believed came , confessing , and declaring their deeds .
44019019	Not a few of those who practiced magical arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all . They counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
44019020	So the word of the Lord was growing and becoming mighty .
44019021	Now after these things had ended , Paul determined in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , " After I have been there , I must also see Rome . "
44019022	Having sent into Macedonia two of those who ministered to him , Timothy and Erastus , he himself stayed in Asia for a while .
44019023	About that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way .
44019024	For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , who made silver shrines of Artemis , brought no little business to the craftsmen ,
44019025	whom he gathered together , with the workmen of like occupation , and said , " Sirs , you know that by this business we have our wealth .
44019026	You see and hear , that not at Ephesus alone , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people , saying that they are no gods , that are made with hands .
44019027	Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute , but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing , and her majesty destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worships . "
44019028	When they heard this they were filled with wrath , and cried out , saying , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! "
44019029	The whole city was filled with confusion , and they rushed with one accord into the theater , having seized Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul's companions in travel .
44019030	When Paul wanted to enter in to the people , the disciples didn't allow him .
44019031	Certain also of the Asiarchs , being his friends , sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater .
44019032	Some therefore cried one thing , and some another , for the assembly was in confusion . Most of them didn't know why they had come together .
44019033	They brought Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . Alexander beckoned with his hand , and would have made a defense to the people .
44019034	But when they perceived that he was a Jew , all with one voice for a time of about two hours cried out , " Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! "
44019035	When the town clerk had quieted the multitude , he said , " You men of Ephesus , what man is there who doesn't know that the city of the Ephesians is temple-keeper of the great goddess Artemis , and of the image which fell down from Zeus ?
44019036	Seeing then that these things can't be denied , you ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rash .
44019037	For you have brought these men here , who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess .
44019038	If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him , have a matter against anyone , the courts are open , and there are proconsuls . Let them press charges against one another .
44019039	But if you seek anything about other matters , it will be settled in the regular assembly .
44019040	For indeed we are in danger of being accused concerning this day's riot , there being no cause . Concerning it , we wouldn't be able to give an account of this commotion . "
44019041	When he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	After the uproar had ceased , Paul sent for the disciples , took leave of them , and departed to go into Macedonia .
44020002	When he had gone through those parts , and had encouraged them with many words , he came into Greece .
44020003	When he had spent three months there , and a plot was made against him by Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria , he determined to return through Macedonia .
44020004	These accompanied him as far as Asia : Sopater of Beroea ; Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians ; Gaius of Derbe ; Timothy ; and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia .
44020005	But these had gone ahead , and were waiting for us at Troas .
44020006	We sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came to them at Troas in five days , where we stayed seven days .
44020007	On the first day of the week , when the disciples were gathered together to break bread , Paul talked with them , intending to depart on the next day , and continued his speech until midnight .
44020008	There were many lights in the upper chamber where we were gathered together .
44020009	A certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window , weighed down with deep sleep . As Paul spoke still longer , being weighed down by his sleep , he fell down from the third story , and was taken up dead .
44020010	Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , " Don't be troubled , for his life is in him . "
44020011	When he had gone up , and had broken bread , and eaten , and had talked with them a long while , even until break of day , he departed .
44020012	They brought the boy alive , and were not a little comforted .
44020013	But we who went ahead to the ship set sail for Assos , there intending to take in Paul , for he had so arranged , intending himself to go by land .
44020014	When he met us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
44020015	Sailing from there , we came the following day opposite Chios . The next day we touched at Samos and stayed at Trogyllium , and the day after we came to Miletus .
44020016	For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus , that he might not have to spend time in Asia ; for he was hastening , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost .
44020017	From Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called to himself the elders of the assembly .
44020018	When they had come to him , he said to them , " You yourselves know , from the first day that I set foot in Asia , how I was with you all the time ,
44020019	serving the Lord with all humility , with many tears , and with trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews ;
44020020	how I didn't shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable , teaching you publicly and from house to house ,
44020021	testifying both to Jews and to Greeks repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
44020022	Now , behold , I go bound by the Spirit to Jerusalem , not knowing what will happen to me there ;
44020023	except that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions wait for me .
44020024	But these things don't count ; nor do I hold my life dear to myself , so that I may finish my race with joy , and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus , to fully testify to the gospel of the grace of God .
44020025	Now , behold , I know that you all , among whom I went about preaching the kingdom of God , will see my face no more .
44020026	Therefore I testify to you this day that I am clean from the blood of all men ,
44020027	for I didn't shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God .
44020028	Take heed , therefore , to yourselves , and to all the flock , in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers , to shepherd the assembly of the Lord and God which he purchased with his own blood .
44020029	For I know that after my departure , vicious wolves will enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
44020030	Men will arise from among your own selves , speaking perverse things , to draw away the disciples after them .
44020031	Therefore watch , remembering that for a period of three years I didn't cease to admonish everyone night and day with tears .
44020032	Now , brothers , I entrust you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build up , and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified .
44020033	I coveted no one's silver , or gold , or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that these hands ministered to my necessities , and to those who were with me .
44020035	In all things I gave you an example , that so laboring you ought to help the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , that he himself said , ' It is more blessed to give than to receive . ' "
44020036	When he had spoken these things , he kneeled down and prayed with them all .
44020037	They all wept a lot , and fell on Paul's neck and kissed him ,
44020038	sorrowing most of all because of the word which he had spoken , that they should see his face no more . They brought him on his way to the ship .
44021001	When it happened that we had parted from them and had set sail , we came with a straight course to Cos , and the next day to Rhodes , and from there to Patara .
44021002	Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia , we went aboard , and set sail .
44021003	When we had come in sight of Cyprus , leaving it on the left hand , we sailed to Syria , and landed at Tyre , for there the ship was to unload her cargo .
44021004	Having found disciples , we stayed there seven days . These said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
44021005	When it happened that we had accomplished the days , we departed and went on our journey . They all , with wives and children , brought us on our way until we were out of the city . Kneeling down on the beach , we prayed .
44021006	After saying goodbye to each other , we went on board the ship , and they returned home again .
44021007	When we had finished the voyage from Tyre , we arrived at Ptolemais . We greeted the brothers , and stayed with them one day .
44021008	On the next day , we , who were Paul's companions , departed , and came to Caesarea . We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , who was one of the seven , and stayed with him .
44021009	Now this man had four virgin daughters , who prophesied .
44021010	As we stayed there some days , a certain prophet , named Agabus , came down from Judea .
44021011	Coming to us , and taking Paul's belt , he bound his own feet and hands , and said , " Thus says the Holy Spirit : ' So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt , and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles . ' "
44021012	When we heard these things , both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul answered , " What are you doing , weeping and breaking my heart ? For I am ready not only to be bound , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus . "
44021014	When he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , " The Lord's will be done . "
44021015	After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us , bringing one Mnason of Cyprus , an early disciple , with whom we would stay .
44021017	When we had come to Jerusalem , the brothers received us gladly .
