44021018	The day following , Paul went in with us to James ; and all the elders were present .
44021019	When he had greeted them , he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	They , when they heard it , glorified God . They said to him , " You see , brother , how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed , and they are all zealous for the law .
44021021	They have been informed about you , that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , telling them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs .
44021022	What then ? The assembly must certainly meet , for they will hear that you have come .
44021023	Therefore do what we tell you . We have four men who have a vow on them .
44021024	Take them , and purify yourself with them , and pay their expenses for them , that they may shave their heads . Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you , but that you yourself also walk keeping the law .
44021025	But concerning the Gentiles who believe , we have written our decision that they should observe no such thing , except that they should keep themselves from food offered to idols , from blood , from strangled things , and from sexual immorality . "
44021026	Then Paul took the men , and the next day , purified himself and went with them into the temple , declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification , until the offering was offered for every one of them .
44021027	When the seven days were almost completed , the Jews from Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him ,
44021028	crying out , " Men of Israel , help ! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people , and the law , and this place . Moreover , he also brought Greeks into the temple , and has defiled this holy place ! "
44021029	For they had seen Trophimus , the Ephesian , with him in the city , and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple .
44021030	All the city was moved , and the people ran together . They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple . Immediately the doors were shut .
44021031	As they were trying to kill him , news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
44021032	Immediately he took soldiers and centurions , and ran down to them . They , when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , stopped beating Paul .
44021033	Then the commanding officer came near , arrested him , commanded him to be bound with two chains , and inquired who he was and what he had done .
44021034	Some shouted one thing , some another , among the crowd . When he couldn't find out the truth because of the noise , he commanded him to be brought into the barracks .
44021035	When he came to the stairs , it happened that he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd ;
44021036	for the multitude of the people followed after , crying out , " Away with him ! "
44021037	As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks , he asked the commanding officer , " May I say something to you ? " He said , " Do you know Greek ?
44021038	Aren't you then the Egyptian , who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins ? "
44021039	But Paul said , " I am a Jew , from Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of no insignificant city . I beg you , allow me to speak to the people . "
44021040	When he had given him permission , Paul , standing on the stairs , beckoned with his hand to the people . When there was a great silence , he spoke to them in the Hebrew language , saying ,
44022001	" Brothers and fathers , listen to the defense which I now make to you . "
44022002	When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language , they were even more quiet . He said ,
44022003	" I am indeed a Jew , born in Tarsus of Cilicia , but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , instructed according to the strict manner of the law of our fathers , being zealous for God , even as you all are this day .
44022004	I persecuted this Way to the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
44022005	As also the high priest and all the council of the elders testify , from whom also I received letters to the brothers , and journeyed to Damascus to bring them also who were there to Jerusalem in bonds to be punished .
44022006	It happened that , as I made my journey , and came close to Damascus , about noon , suddenly there shone from the sky a great light around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground , and heard a voice saying to me , ' Saul , Saul , why do you persecute me ? '
44022008	I answered , ' Who are you , Lord ? ' He said to me , ' I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom you persecute . '
44022009	Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid , but they didn't understand the voice of him who spoke to me .
44022010	I said , ' What will I do , Lord ? ' The Lord said to me , ' Arise , and go into Damascus . There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do . '
44022011	When I couldn't see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of those who were with me , I came into Damascus .
44022012	One Ananias , a devout man according to the law , well reported of by all the Jews who lived there ,
44022013	came to me , and standing by me said to me , ' Brother Saul , receive your sight ! ' In that very hour I looked up at him .
44022014	He said , ' The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will , and to see the Righteous One , and to hear a voice from his mouth .
44022015	For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	Now why do you wait ? Arise , be baptized , and wash away your sins , calling on the name of the Lord . '
44022017	It happened that , when I had returned to Jerusalem , and while I prayed in the temple , I fell into a trance ,
44022018	and saw him saying to me , ' Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly , because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you . '
44022019	I said , ' Lord , they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you .
44022020	When the blood of Stephen , your witness , was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting to his death , and guarding the cloaks of those who killed him . '
44022021	He said to me , ' Depart , for I will send you forth far from here to the Gentiles . ' "
44022022	They listened to him until he said that , then they lifted up their voice , and said , " Rid the earth of this fellow , for he isn't fit to live ! "
44022023	As they cried out , and threw off their cloaks , and threw dust into the air ,
44022024	the commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks , ordering him to be examined by scourging , that he might know for what crime they shouted against him like that .
44022025	When they had tied him up with thongs , Paul asked the centurion who stood by , " Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman , and not found guilty ? "
44022026	When the centurion heard it , he went to the commanding officer and told him , " Watch what you are about to do , for this man is a Roman ! "
44022027	The commanding officer came and asked him , " Tell me , are you a Roman ? " He said , " Yes . "
44022028	The commanding officer answered , " I bought my citizenship for a great price . " Paul said , " But I was born a Roman . "
44022029	Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him , and the commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman , because he had bound him .
44022030	But on the next day , desiring to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews , he freed him from the bonds , and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together , and brought Paul down and set him before them .
44023001	Paul , looking steadfastly at the council , said , " Brothers , I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day . "
44023002	The high priest , Ananias , commanded those who stood by him to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then said Paul to him , " God will strike you , you whitewashed wall ! Do you sit to judge me according to the law , and command me to be struck contrary to the law ? "
44023004	Those who stood by said , " Do you malign God's high priest ? "
44023005	Paul said , " I didn't know , brothers , that he was high priest . For it is written , ' You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people . ' "
44023006	But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , " Men and brothers , I am a Pharisee , a son of Pharisees . Concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged ! "
44023007	When he had said this , there arose an argument between the Pharisees and Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit ; but the Pharisees confess all of these .
44023009	A great clamor arose , and some of the scribes of the Pharisees part stood up , and contended , saying , " We find no evil in this man . But if a spirit or angel has spoken to him , let's not fight against God ! "
44023010	When a great argument arose , the commanding officer , fearing that Paul would be torn in pieces by them , commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them , and bring him into the barracks .
44023011	The following night , the Lord stood by him , and said , " Cheer up , Paul , for as you have testified about me at Jerusalem , so you must testify also at Rome . "
44023012	When it was day , some of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	There were more than forty people who had made this conspiracy .
44023014	They came to the chief priests and the elders , and said , " We have bound ourselves under a great curse , to taste nothing until we have killed Paul .
44023015	Now therefore , you with the council inform the commanding officer that he should bring him down to you tomorrow , as though you were going to judge his case more exactly . We are ready to kill him before he comes near . "
44023016	But Paul's sister's son heard of their lying in wait , and he came and entered into the barracks and told Paul .
44023017	Paul summoned one of the centurions , and said , " Bring this young man to the commanding officer , for he has something to tell him . "
44023018	So he took him , and brought him to the commanding officer , and said , " Paul , the prisoner , called me to himself , and asked me to bring this young man to you , who has something to tell you . "
44023019	The commanding officer took him by the hand , and going aside , asked him privately , " What is it that you have to tell me ? "
44023020	He said , " The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring down Paul tomorrow to the council , as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him .
44023021	Therefore don't yield to them , for more than forty men lie in wait for him , who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him . Now they are ready , looking for the promise from you . "
44023022	So the commanding officer let the young man go , charging him , " Tell no one that you have told these things to me . "
44023023	He called to himself two of the centurions , and said , " Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea , with seventy horsemen , and two hundred men armed with spears , at the third hour of the night . "
44023024	He asked them to provide animals , that they might set Paul on one , and bring him safely to Felix , the governor .
44023025	He wrote a letter like this :
44023026	" Claudius Lysias to the most excellent governor Felix : Greetings .
44023027	" This man was seized by the Jews , and was about to be killed by them , when I came on them with the soldiers and rescued him , having learned that he was a Roman .
44023028	Desiring to know the cause why they accused him , I brought him down to their council .
44023029	I found him to be accused about questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
44023030	When I was told that the Jews lay in wait for the man , I sent him to you immediately , charging his accusers also to bring their accusations against him before you . Farewell . "
44023031	So the soldiers , carrying out their orders , took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris .
44023032	But on the next day they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the barracks .
44023033	They , when they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
44023034	When the governor had read it , he asked what province he was from . When he understood that he was from Cilicia , he said ,
44023035	" I will hear you fully when your accusers also arrive . " He commanded that he be kept in Herod's palace .
44024001	After five days , the high priest , Ananias , came down with certain elders and an orator , one Tertullus . They informed the governor against Paul .
44024002	When he was called , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , " Seeing that by you we enjoy much peace , and that excellent measures are coming to this nation ,
44024003	we accept it in all ways and in all places , most excellent Felix , with all thankfulness .
44024004	But , that I don't delay you , I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words .
44024005	For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes .
44024006	He even tried to profane the temple . We arrested him .
44024007	empty verses content detected by amos
44024008	By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him . "
44024009	The Jews also joined in the attack , affirming that these things were so .
44024010	When the governor had beckoned to him to speak , Paul answered , " Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years , I cheerfully make my defense ,
44024011	seeing that you can recognize that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem .
44024012	In the temple they didn't find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd , either in the synagogues , or in the city .
44024013	Nor can they prove to you the things whereof they now accuse me .
44024014	But this I confess to you , that after the Way , which they call a sect , so I serve the God of our fathers , believing all things which are according to the law , and which are written in the prophets ;
44024015	having hope toward God , which these also themselves look for , that there will be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
44024016	Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men .
44024017	Now after some years , I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings ;
44024018	amid which they found me purified in the temple , with no crowd , nor yet with tumult . But certain Jews from Asia - -
44024019	who ought to have been here before you , and to make accusation , if they had anything against me .
44024020	Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council ,
44024021	unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them , ' Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today ! ' "
44024022	But Felix , having more exact knowledge concerning the Way , deferred them , saying , " When Lysias , the commanding officer , comes down , I will decide your case . "
44024023	He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody , and should have some privileges , and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him .
44024024	But after some days , Felix came with Drusilla , his wife , who was a Jewess , and sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	As he reasoned about righteousness , self-control , and the judgment to come , Felix was terrified , and answered , " Go your way for this time , and when it is convenient for me , I will call you to me . "
44024026	He hoped that way that money would be given to him by Paul , that he might release him . Therefore also he sent for him more often , and talked with him .
44024027	But when two years were fulfilled , Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus , and desiring to gain favor with the Jews , Felix left Paul in bonds .
44025001	Festus therefore , having come into the province , after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul , and they begged him ,
44025003	asking a favor against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem ; plotting to kill him on the way .
44025004	However Festus answered that Paul was kept in custody at Caesarea , and that he himself was about to depart shortly .
44025005	" Let them therefore , " said he , " that are in power among you go down with me , and if there is anything wrong in the man , let them accuse him . "
44025006	When he had stayed among them more than ten days , he went down to Caesarea , and on the next day he sat on the judgment seat , and commanded Paul to be brought .
44025007	When he had come , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him , bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove ,
44025008	while he said in his defense , " Neither against the law of the Jews , nor against the temple , nor against Caesar , have I sinned at all . "
44025009	But Festus , desiring to gain favor with the Jews , answered Paul and said , " Will you go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ? "
44025010	But Paul said , " I am standing before Caesar's judgment seat , where I ought to be tried . I have done no wrong to the Jews , as you also know very well .
44025011	For if I have done wrong , and have committed anything worthy of death , I don't refuse to die ; but if none of those things is true that these accuse me of , no one can give me up to them . I appeal to Caesar ! "
44025012	Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , " You have appealed to Caesar . To Caesar you will go . "
44025013	Now when some days had passed , Agrippa , the King , and Bernice arrived at Caesarea , and greeted Festus .
44025014	As they stayed there many days , Festus laid Paul's case before the King , saying , " There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix ;
44025015	about whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , asking for a sentence against him .
44025016	To whom I answered that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction , before the accused have met the accusers face to face , and have had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him .
44025017	When therefore they were come together here , I didn't delay , but on the next day sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought .
44025018	Concerning whom , when the accusers stood up , they brought no charge of such things as I supposed ;
44025019	but had certain questions against him of their own religion , and of one Jesus , who was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
44025020	I , being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things , asked whether he would go to Jerusalem and there be judged of these matters .
44025021	But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor , I commanded him to be kept until I should send him to Caesar . "
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus , " I also would like to hear the man myself . " " Tomorrow , " he said , " you will hear him . "
44025023	So on the next day , when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp , and they had entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and principal men of the city , at the command of Festus , Paul was brought in .
44025024	Festus said , " King Agrippa , and all men who are here present with us , you see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews petitioned me , both at Jerusalem and here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
44025025	But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him .
44025026	Of whom I have no certain thing to write to my lord . Therefore I have brought him forth before you , and especially before you , king Agrippa , that , after examination , I may have something to write .
44025027	For it seems to me unreasonable , in sending a prisoner , not to also specify the charges against him . "
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , " You may speak for yourself . " Then Paul stretched out his hand , and made his defense .
44026002	" I think myself happy , King Agrippa , that I am to make my defense before you this day concerning all the things whereof I am accused by the Jews ,
44026003	especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews . Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently .
44026004	" Indeed , all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up , which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem ;
44026005	having known me from the first , if they are willing to testify , that after the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
44026006	Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers ,
44026007	which our twelve tribes , earnestly serving night and day , hope to attain . Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews , King Agrippa !
44026008	Why is it judged incredible with you , if God does raise the dead ?
44026009	" I most assuredly thought with myself that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
44026010	This I also did in Jerusalem . I both shut up many of the saints in prisons , having received authority from the chief priests , and when they were put to death I gave my vote against them .
44026011	Punishing them often in all the synagogues , I tried to make them blaspheme . Being exceedingly enraged against them , I persecuted them even to foreign cities .
44026012	" Whereupon as I journeyed to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests ,
44026013	at noon , O King , I saw on the way a light from the sky , brighter than the sun , shining around me and those who traveled with me .
44026014	When we had all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language , ' Saul , Saul , why do you persecute me ? It is hard for you to kick against the goad . '
44026015	I said , ' Who are you , Lord ? ' He said , ' I am Jesus , whom you persecute .
44026016	But arise , and stand on your feet , for to this end have I appeared to you , to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen , and of the things which I will reveal to you ;
44026017	delivering you from the people , and from the Gentiles , to whom I send you ,
44026018	to open their eyes , that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God , that they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me . '
44026019	" Therefore , King Agrippa , I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision ,
44026020	but declared first to them of Damascus , at Jerusalem , and throughout all the country of Judea , and also to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , doing works worthy of repentance .
44026021	For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple , and tried to kill me .
44026022	Having therefore obtained the help that is from God , I stand to this day testifying both to small and great , saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses did say should come ,
44026023	how the Christ must suffer , and how he first by the resurrection of the dead should proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles . "
44026024	As he thus made his defense , Festus said with a loud voice , " Paul , you are crazy ! Your great learning is driving you insane ! "
44026025	But he said , " I am not crazy , most excellent Festus , but speak forth words of truth and soberness .
44026026	For the king knows of these things , to whom also I speak freely . For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him , for this has not been done in a corner .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe the prophets ? I know that you believe . "
44026028	Agrippa said to Paul , " With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian ? "
44026029	Paul said , " I pray to God , that whether with little or with much , not only you , but also all that hear me this day , might become such as I am , except for these bonds . "
44026030	The king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and those who sat with them .
44026031	When they had withdrawn , they spoke one to another , saying , " This man does nothing worthy of death or of bonds . "
44026032	Agrippa said to Festus , " This man might have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar . "
44027001	When it was determined that we should sail for Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius , of the Augustan band .
44027002	Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium , which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia , we put to sea , Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
44027003	The next day , we touched at Sidon . Julius treated Paul kindly , and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself .
44027004	Putting to sea from there , we sailed under the lee of Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
44027005	When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
44027006	There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy , and he put us on board .
44027007	When we had sailed slowly many days , and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus , the wind not allowing us further , we sailed under the lee of Crete , opposite Salmone .
44027008	With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens , near the city of Lasea .
44027009	When much time was spent , and the voyage was now dangerous , because the Fast had now already gone by , Paul admonished them ,
44027010	and said to them , " Sirs , I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss , not only of the cargo and the ship , but also of our lives . "
44027011	But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul .
44027012	Because the haven was not suitable to winter in , the majority advised to put to sea from there , if by any means they could reach Phoenix , and winter there , which is a port of Crete , looking northeast and southeast .
44027013	When the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , they weighed anchor and sailed along Crete , close to shore .
44027014	But after no long time there beat down from it a tempestuous wind , which is called Euroclydon .
44027015	When the ship was caught , and couldn't face the wind , we gave way to it , and were driven along .
44027016	Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda , we were able , with difficulty , to secure the boat .
44027017	When they had hoisted it up , they used cables to help reinforce the ship . Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars , they lowered the sea anchor , and so were driven .
44027018	As we labored exceedingly with the storm , the next day they began to throw things overboard .
44027019	On the third day , they threw out the ship's tackle with their own hands .
44027020	When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days , and no small tempest pressed on us , all hope that we should be saved was now taken away .
44027021	When they had been long without food , Paul stood up in the midst of them , and said , " Sirs , you should have listened to me , and not have set sail from Crete , and have gotten this injury and loss .
44027022	Now I exhort you to cheer up , for there will be no loss of life among you , but only of the ship .
44027023	For there stood by me this night an angel , belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve ,
44027024	saying , ' Don't be afraid , Paul . You must stand before Caesar . Behold , God has granted you all those who sail with you . '
44027025	Therefore , sirs , cheer up ! For I believe God , that it will be just as it has been spoken to me .
44027026	But we must run aground on a certain island . "
44027027	But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea , about midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land .
44027028	They took soundings , and found twenty fathoms . After a little while , they took soundings again , and found fifteen fathoms .
44027029	Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground , they let go four anchors from the stern , and wished for daylight .
44027030	As the sailors were trying to flee out of the ship , and had lowered the boat into the sea , pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow ,
44027031	Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , " Unless these stay in the ship , you can't be saved . "
44027032	Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
44027033	While the day was coming on , Paul begged them all to take some food , saying , " This day is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting , having taken nothing .
44027034	Therefore I beg you to take some food , for this is for your safety ; for there will not a hair perish from the head of any of you . "
44027035	When he had said this , and had taken bread , he gave thanks to God in the presence of all , and he broke it , and began to eat .
44027036	Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took food .
44027037	We were in all in the ship two hundred seventy-six souls .
44027038	When they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , throwing out the wheat into the sea .
44027039	When it was day , they didn't recognize the land , but they noticed a certain bay with a beach , and they decided to try to drive the ship onto it .
44027040	Casting off the anchors , they left them in the sea , at the same time untying the rudder ropes . Hoisting up the foresail to the wind , they made for the beach .
44027041	But coming to a place where two seas met , they ran the vessel aground . The bow struck and remained immovable , but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves .
44027042	The soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , so that none of them would swim out and escape .
44027043	But the centurion , desiring to save Paul , stopped them from their purpose , and commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go to the land ;
44027044	and the rest , some on planks , and some on other things from the ship . So it happened that they all escaped safely to the land .
44028001	When we had escaped , then we knew that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The natives showed us no common kindness ; for they kindled a fire , and received us all , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
44028003	But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire , a viper came out because of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
44028004	When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand , they said one to another , " No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he has escaped from the sea , yet Justice has not allowed to live . "
44028005	However he shook off the creature into the fire , and wasn't harmed .
44028006	But they expected that he would have swollen , or fallen down dead suddenly , but when they were long in expectation and saw nothing bad happen to him , they changed their minds , and said that he was a god .
44028007	Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island , named Publius , who received us , and courteously entertained us three days .
44028008	It was so , that the father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery . Paul entered in to him , prayed , and laying his hands on him , healed him .
44028009	Then when this was done , the rest also that had diseases in the island came , and were cured .
44028010	They also honored us with many honors , and when we sailed , they put on board the things that we needed .
44028011	After three months , we set sail in a ship of Alexandria which had wintered in the island , whose sign was " The Twin Brothers . "
44028012	Touching at Syracuse , we stayed there three days .
44028013	From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium . After one day , a south wind sprang up , and on the second day we came to Puteoli ,
44028014	where we found brothers , and were entreated to stay with them seven days . So we came to Rome .
44028015	From there the brothers , when they heard of us , came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns ; whom when Paul saw , he thanked God , and took courage .
44028016	When we entered into Rome , the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard , but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him .
44028017	It happened , that after three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews . When they had come together , he said to them , " I , brothers , though I had done nothing against the people , or the customs of our fathers , still was delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans ,
44028018	who , when they had examined me , desired to set me free , because there was no cause of death in me .
44028019	But when the Jews spoke against it , I was constrained to appeal to Caesar , not that I had anything about which to accuse my nation .
44028020	For this cause therefore did I ask you to see and to speak with me . For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain . "
44028021	They said to him , " We neither received letters from Judea concerning you , nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you .
44028022	But we desire to hear of you what you think . For , as concerning this sect , it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against . "
44028023	When they had appointed him a day , they came to him into his lodging in great number . He explained to them , testifying about the kingdom of God , and persuading them concerning Jesus , both from the law of Moses and from the prophets , from morning until evening .
44028024	Some believed the things which were spoken , and some disbelieved .
44028025	When they didn't agree among themselves , they departed after Paul had spoken one word , " The Holy Spirit spoke well through Isaiah , the prophet , to our fathers ,
44028026	saying , ' Go to this people , and say , In hearing , you will hear , and will in no way understand . In seeing , you will see , and will in no way perceive .
44028027	For this people's heart has grown callous . Their ears are dull of hearing . Their eyes they have closed . Lest they should see with their eyes , Hear with their ears , Understand with their heart , Would turn again , And I would heal them . '
44028028	" Be it known therefore to you , that the salvation of God is sent to the Gentiles . They will also hear . "
44028029	When he had said these words , the Jews departed , having a great dispute among themselves .
44028030	Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house , and received all who went in to him ,
44028031	preaching the kingdom of God , and teaching the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness , without hinderance .
45001001	Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , called to be an apostle , set apart for the gospel of God ,
45001002	which he promised before through his prophets in the holy scriptures ,
45001003	concerning his Son , who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh ,
45001004	who was declared to be the Son of God with power , according to the spirit of holiness , by the resurrection from the dead , Jesus Christ our Lord ,
45001005	through whom we received grace and apostleship , to obedience of faith among all the nations , for his name's sake .
45001006	Among whom you are also called to be Jesus Christ's .
45001007	To all who are in Rome , beloved of God , called to be saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
45001008	First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you , that your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world .
45001009	For God is my witness , whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son , how unceasingly I make mention of you always in my prayers ,
45001010	requesting , if by any means now at length I may be prospered by the will of God to come to you .
45001011	For I long to see you , that I may impart to you some spiritual gift , to the end you may be established ;
45001012	that is , that I with you may be comforted in you , each of us by the other's faith , both yours and mine .
45001013	Now I don't desire to have you unaware , brothers , that often I planned to come to you , and was hindered so far , that I might have some fruit in you also , even as in the rest of the Gentiles .
45001014	I am debtor both to Greeks and to foreigners , both to the wise and to the foolish .
45001015	So , as much as in me is , I am ready to preach the gospel to you also who are in Rome .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ , for it is the power of God to salvation to everyone who believes ; to the Jew first , and also to the Greek .
45001017	For therein is revealed a righteousness of God from faith to faith . As it is written , " But the righteous shall live by faith . "
45001018	For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men , who hinder the truth in unrighteousness ,
45001019	because that which is known by God is revealed in them , for God revealed it to them .
45001020	For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen , being perceived through the things that are made , even his everlasting power and divinity ; that they may be without excuse .
45001021	Because , knowing God , they didn't glorify him as God , neither gave thanks , but became vain in their reasoning , and their senseless heart was darkened .
45001022	Professing themselves to be wise , they became fools ,
45001023	and traded the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man , and of birds , and four-footed animals , and creeping things .
45001024	Therefore God also gave them up in the lusts of their hearts to uncleanness , that their bodies should be dishonored among themselves ,
45001025	who exchanged the truth of God for a lie , and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator , who is blessed forever . Amen .
45001026	For this reason , God gave them up to vile passions . For their women changed the natural function into that which is against nature .
45001027	Likewise also the men , leaving the natural function of the woman , burned in their lust toward one another , men doing what is inappropriate with men , and receiving in themselves the due penalty of their error .
45001028	Even as they refused to have God in their knowledge , God gave them up to a reprobate mind , to do those things which are not fitting ;
45001029	being filled with all unrighteousness , sexual immorality , wickedness , covetousness , maliciousness ; full of envy , murder , strife , deceit , evil habits , secret slanderers ,
45001030	backbiters , hateful to God , insolent , haughty , boastful , inventors of evil things , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	without understanding , covenant-breakers , without natural affection , unforgiving , unmerciful ;
45001032	who , knowing the ordinance of God , that those who practice such things are worthy of death , not only do the same , but also consent with those who practice them .
45002001	Therefore you are without excuse , man , whoever you are who judge . For in that which you judge another , you condemn yourself . For you who judge practice the same things .
45002002	We know that the judgment of God is according to truth against those who practice such things .
45002003	Do you know this , O man who judges those who practice such things , and do the same , that you will escape the judgment of God ?
45002004	Or do you despise the riches of his goodness , forbearance , and patience , not knowing that the goodness of God leads you to repentance ?
45002005	But according to your hardness and impenitent heart you are treasuring up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God ;
45002006	who " will render to every man according to his works : "
45002007	to those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honor and incorruptibility , eternal life ;
45002008	but to those who are self-seeking , and don't obey the truth , but obey unrighteousness , will be wrath and indignation ,
45002009	oppression and anguish , on every soul of man who works evil , on the Jew first , and also on the Greek .
45002010	But glory and honor and peace to every man who works good , to the Jew first , and also to the Greek .
45002011	For there is no partiality with God .
45002012	For as many as have sinned without law will also perish without the law . As many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law .
45002013	For it isn't the hearers of the law who are righteous before God , but the doers of the law will be justified
45002014	( for when Gentiles who don't have the law do by nature the things of the law , these , not having the law , are a law to themselves ,
45002015	in that they show the work of the law written in their hearts , their conscience testifying with them , and their thoughts among themselves accusing or else excusing them )
45002016	in the day when God will judge the secrets of men , according to my gospel , by Jesus Christ .
45002017	Indeed you bear the name of a Jew , and rest on the law , and glory in God ,
45002018	and know his will , and approve the things that are excellent , being instructed out of the law ,
45002019	and are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind , a light to those who are in darkness ,
45002020	a corrector of the foolish , a teacher of babies , having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth .
45002021	You therefore who teach another , don't you teach yourself ? You who preach that a man shouldn't steal , do you steal ?
45002022	You who say a man shouldn't commit adultery , do you commit adultery ? You who abhor idols , do you rob temples ?
45002023	You who glory in the law , through your disobedience of the law do you dishonor God ?
45002024	For " the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you , " just as it is written .
45002025	For circumcision indeed profits , if you be a doer of the law , but if you be a transgressor of the law , your circumcision has become uncircumcision .
45002026	If therefore the uncircumcised keep the ordinances of the law , won't his uncircumcision be accounted as circumcision ?
45002027	Won't the uncircumcision which is by nature , if it fulfills the law , judge you , who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of the law ?
45002028	For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly , neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh ;
45002029	but he is a Jew who is one inwardly , and circumcision is that of the heart , in the spirit not in the letter ; whose praise is not from men , but from God .
45003001	Then what advantage does the Jew have ? Or what is the profit of circumcision ?
45003002	Much in every way ! Because first of all , that they were entrusted with the oracles of God .
45003003	For what if some were without faith ? Will their lack of faith make of no effect the faithfulness of God ?
45003004	Certainly not ! Yes , let God be found true , but every man a liar . As it is written , " That you might be justified in your words , And might prevail when you come into judgment . "
45003005	But if our unrighteousness commends the righteousness of God , what will we say ? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath ? I speak like men do .
45003006	Certainly not ! For then how will God judge the world ?
45003007	For if the truth of God through my lie abounded to his glory , why am I also still judged as a sinner ?
45003008	Why not ( as we are slanderously reported , and as some affirm that we say ) , " Let us do evil , that good may come ? " Those who say so are justly condemned .
45003009	What then ? Are we better than they ? No , in no way . For we previously charged both Jews and Greeks , that they are all under sin .
45003010	As it is written , " There is no one righteous . No , not one .
45003011	There is no one who understands . There is no one who seeks after God .
45003012	They have all turned aside . They have together become unprofitable . There is no one who does good , no , not , so much as one . "
45003013	" Their throat is an open tomb . With their tongues they have used deceit . " " The poison of vipers is under their lips ; "
45003014	" Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness . "
45003015	" Their feet are swift to shed blood .
45003016	Destruction and misery are in their ways .
45003017	The way of peace , they haven't known . "
45003018	" There is no fear of God before their eyes . "
45003019	Now we know that whatever things the law says , it speaks to those who are under the law , that every mouth may be closed , and all the world may be brought under the judgment of God .
45003020	Because by the works of the law , no flesh will be justified in his sight . For through the law comes the knowledge of sin .
45003021	But now apart from the law , a righteousness of God has been revealed , being testified by the law and the prophets ;
45003022	even the righteousness of God through faith in Jesus Christ to all and on all those who believe . For there is no distinction ,
45003023	for all have sinned , and fall short of the glory of God ;
45003024	being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus ;
45003025	whom God set forth to be an atoning sacrifice , through faith , in his blood , to show his righteousness because of the passing over of the sins done before , in the forbearance of God ;
45003026	for the showing of his righteousness at this present time ; that he might himself be just , and the justifier of him who has faith in Jesus .
45003027	Where then is the boasting ? It is excluded . By what manner of law ? Of works ? No , but by a law of faith .
45003028	We maintain therefore that a man is justified by faith apart from the works of the law .
45003029	Or is God the God of Jews only ? Isn't he the God of Gentiles also ? Yes , of Gentiles also ,
45003030	if it is so that God is one . He will justify the circumcised by faith , and the uncircumcised through faith .
45003031	Do we then make the law of no effect through faith ? Certainly not ! No , we establish the law .
45004001	What then will we say that Abraham , our forefather , has found according to the flesh ?
45004002	For if Abraham was justified by works , he has something to boast about , but not toward God .
45004003	For what does the scripture say ? " Abraham believed God , and it was accounted to him for righteousness . "
45004004	Now to him who works , the reward is not accounted as of grace , but as of debt .
45004005	But to him who doesn't work , but believes in him who justifies the ungodly , his faith is accounted for righteousness .
45004006	Even as David also pronounces blessing on the man to whom God counts righteousness apart from works ,
45004007	" Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven , Whose sins are covered .
45004008	Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not charge with sin . "
45004009	Is this blessing then pronounced on the circumcised , or on the uncircumcised also ? For we say that faith was accounted to Abraham for righteousness .
45004010	How then was it counted ? When he was in circumcision , or in uncircumcision ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision .
45004011	He received the sign of circumcision , a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision , that he might be the father of all those who believe , though they be in uncircumcision , that righteousness might also be accounted to them .
45004012	The father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision , but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father , Abraham , which he had in uncircumcision .
45004013	For not through the law was the promise to Abraham or to his seed that he should be heir of the world , but through the righteousness of faith .
45004014	For if those who are of the law are heirs , faith is made void , and the promise is made of no effect .
45004015	For the law works wrath , for where there is no law , neither is there disobedience .
45004016	For this cause it is of faith , that it may be according to grace , to the end that the promise may be sure to all the seed , not to that only which is of the law , but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham , who is the father of us all .
45004017	As it is written , " I have made you a father of many nations . " This is before him whom he believed , God , who gives life to the dead , and calls the things that are not , as though they were .
45004018	Who in hope believed against hope , to the end that he might become a father of many nations , according to that which had been spoken , " So will your seed be . "
45004019	Without being weakened in faith , he didn't consider his own body , already having been worn out , ( he being about a hundred years old ) , and the deadness of Sarah's womb .
45004020	Yet , looking to the promise of God , he wavered not through unbelief , but grew strong through faith , giving glory to God ,
45004021	and being fully assured that what he had promised , he was able also to perform .
45004022	Therefore also it was " reckoned to him for righteousness . "
45004023	Now it was not written that it was accounted to him for his sake alone ,
45004024	but for our sake also , to whom it will be accounted , who believe in him who raised Jesus , our Lord , from the dead ,
45004025	who was delivered up for our trespasses , and was raised for our justification .
45005001	Being therefore justified by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ ;
45005002	through whom we also have our access by faith into this grace in which we stand . We rejoice in hope of the glory of God .
45005003	Not only so , but we also rejoice in our sufferings , knowing that suffering works perseverance ;
45005004	and perseverance , proven character ; and proven character , hope :
45005005	and hope doesn't disappoint us , because God's love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit which was given to us .
45005006	For while we were yet weak , at the right time Christ died for the ungodly .
45005007	For one will hardly die for a righteous man . For perhaps for a righteous person someone would even dare to die .
45005008	But God commends his own love toward us , in that while we were yet sinners , Christ died for us .
45005009	Much more then , being now justified by his blood , we will be saved from God's wrath through him .
45005010	For if , while we were enemies , we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son , much more , being reconciled , we will be saved by his life .
45005011	Not only so , but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom we have now received the reconciliation .
45005012	Therefore , as sin entered into the world through one man , and death through sin ; and so death passed to all men , because all sinned .
45005013	For until the law , sin was in the world ; but sin is not charged when there is no law .
45005014	Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses , even over those whose sins weren't like Adam's disobedience , who is a foreshadowing of him who was to come .
45005015	But the free gift isn't like the trespass . For if by the trespass of the one the many died , much more did the grace of God , and the gift by the grace of the one man , Jesus Christ , abound to the many .
45005016	The gift is not as through one who sinned : for the judgment came by one to condemnation , but the free gift came of many trespasses to justification .
45005017	For if by the trespass of the one , death reigned through the one ; so much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one , Jesus Christ .
45005018	So then as through one trespass , all men were condemned ; even so through one act of righteousness , all men were justified to life .
45005019	For as through the one man's disobedience many were made sinners , even so through the obedience of the one will many be made righteous .
45005020	The law came in besides , that the trespass might abound ; but where sin abounded , grace did abound more exceedingly ;
45005021	that as sin reigned in death , even so might grace reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	What will we say then ? Will we continue in sin , that grace may abound ?
45006002	Certainly not ! We who died to sin , how could we live in it any longer ?
45006003	Or don't you know that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death ?
45006004	We were buried therefore with him through baptism to death , that just like Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father , so we also might walk in newness of life .
45006005	For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death , we will also be part of his resurrection ;
45006006	knowing this , that our old man was crucified with him , that the body of sin might be done away with , so that we would no longer be in bondage to sin .
45006007	For he who has died has been freed from sin .
45006008	But if we died with Christ , we believe that we will also live with him ;
45006009	knowing that Christ , being raised from the dead , dies no more . Death no more has dominion over him !
45006010	For the death that he died , he died to sin once ; but the life that he lives , he lives to God .
45006011	Thus also consider yourselves also to be dead to sin , but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45006012	Therefore don't let sin reign in your mortal body , that you should obey it in its lusts .
45006013	Neither present your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness , but present yourselves to God , as alive from the dead , and your members as instruments of righteousness to God .
45006014	For sin will not have dominion over you . For you are not under law , but under grace .
45006015	What then ? Will we sin , because we are not under law , but under grace ? Certainly not !
45006016	Don't you know that to whom you present yourselves as servants to obedience , his servants you are whom you obey ; whether of sin to death , or of obedience to righteousness ?
45006017	But thanks be to God , that , whereas you were servants of sin , you became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto you were delivered .
45006018	Being made free from sin , you became servants of righteousness .
45006019	I speak in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh , for as you presented your members as servants to uncleanness and to wickedness upon wickedness , even so now present your members as servants to righteousness for sanctification .
45006020	For when you were servants of sin , you were free in regard to righteousness .
45006021	What fruit then did you have at that time in the things of which you are now ashamed ? For the end of those things is death .
45006022	But now , being made free from sin , and having become servants of God , you have your fruit of sanctification , and the result of eternal life .
45006023	For the wages of sin is death , but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Or don't you know , brothers ( for I speak to men who know the law ) , that the law has dominion over a man for as long as he lives ?
45007002	For the woman that has a husband is bound by law to the husband while he lives , but if the husband dies , she is discharged from the law of the husband .
45007003	So then if , while the husband lives , she is joined to another man , she would be called an adulteress . But if the husband dies , she is free from the law , so that she is no adulteress , though she is joined to another man .
45007004	Therefore , my brothers , you also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ , that you would be joined to another , to him who was raised from the dead , that we might bring forth fruit to God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , the sinful passions which were through the law , worked in our members to bring forth fruit to death .
45007006	But now we have been discharged from the law , having died to that in which we were held ; so that we serve in newness of the spirit , and not in oldness of the letter .
45007007	What will we say then ? Is the law sin ? Certainly not ! However , I wouldn't have known sin , except through the law . For I wouldn't have known coveting , unless the law had said , " You shall not covet . "
45007008	But sin , finding occasion through the commandment , produced in me all kinds of coveting . For apart from the law , sin is dead .
45007009	I was alive apart from the law once , but when the commandment came , sin revived , and I died .
45007010	The commandment , which was to life , this I found to be to death ;
45007011	for sin , finding occasion through the commandment , deceived me , and through it killed me .
45007012	So that the law is holy , and the commandment holy , and righteous , and good .
45007013	Did then that which is good become death to me ? Certainly not ! But sin , that it might be shown to be sin , by working death to me through that which is good ; that through the commandment sin might become exceeding sinful .
45007014	For we know that the law is spiritual , but I am fleshly , sold under sin .
45007015	For I don't know what I am doing . For I don't practice what I desire to do ; but what I hate , that I do .
45007016	But if what I don't desire , that I do , I consent to the law that it is good .
45007017	So now it is no more I that do it , but sin which dwells in me .
45007018	For I know that in me , that is , in my flesh , dwells no good thing . For desire is present with me , but I don't find it doing that which is good .
45007019	For the good which I desire , I don't do ; but the evil which I don't desire , that I practice .
45007020	But if what I don't desire , that I do , it is no more I that do it , but sin which dwells in me .
45007021	I find then the law , that , to me , while I desire to do good , evil is present .
45007022	For I delight in God's law after the inward man ,
45007023	but I see a different law in my members , warring against the law of my mind , and bringing me into captivity under the law of sin which is in my members .
45007024	What a wretched man I am ! Who will deliver me out of the body of this death ?
45007025	I thank God through Jesus Christ , our Lord . So then I of myself with the mind , indeed serve the law of God , but with the flesh the law of sin .
45008001	There is therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus , who don't walk according to the flesh , but according to the Spirit .
45008002	For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and of death .
45008003	For what the law couldn't do , in that it was weak through the flesh , God , sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin , condemned sin in the flesh ;
45008004	that the ordinance of the law might be fulfilled in us , who walk not after the flesh , but after the Spirit .
45008005	For those who are after the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh , but those who are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit .
45008006	For the mind of the flesh is death , but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace ;
45008007	because the mind of the flesh is hostile towards God ; for it is not subject to God's law , neither indeed can it be .
45008008	Those who are in the flesh can't please God .
45008009	But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit , if it is so that the Spirit of God dwells in you . But if any man doesn't have the Spirit of Christ , he is not his .
45008010	If Christ is in you , the body is dead because of sin , but the spirit is alive because of righteousness .
45008011	But if the Spirit of him who raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you , he who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit who dwells in you .
45008012	So then , brothers , we are debtors , not to the flesh , to live after the flesh .
45008013	For if you live after the flesh , you must die ; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body , you will live .
45008014	For as many as are led by the Spirit of God , these are children of God .
45008015	For you didn't receive the spirit of bondage again to fear , but you received the spirit of adoption , whereby we cry , " Abba ! Father ! "
45008016	The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are children of God ;
45008017	and if children , then heirs ; heirs of God , and joint-heirs with Christ ; if indeed we suffer with him , that we may also be glorified with him .
45008018	For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which will be revealed toward us .
45008019	For the creation waits with eager expectation for the sons of God to be revealed .
45008020	For the creation was subjected to vanity , not of its own will , but by reason of him who subjected it , in hope
45008021	that the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of decay into the liberty of the glory of the children of God .
45008022	For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now .
45008023	Not only so , but ourselves also , who have the first fruits of the Spirit , even we ourselves groan within ourselves , waiting for adoption , the redemption of our body .
45008024	For we were saved in hope , but hope that is seen is not hope . For who hopes for that which he sees ?
45008025	But if we hope for that which we don't see , we wait for it with patience .
45008026	In the same way , the Spirit also helps our weaknesses , for we don't know how to pray as we ought . But the Spirit himself makes intercession for us with groanings which can't be uttered .
45008027	He who searches the hearts knows what is on the Spirit's mind , because he makes intercession for the saints according to God .
45008028	We know that all things work together for good for those who love God , to those who are called according to his purpose .
45008029	For whom he foreknew , he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son , that he might be the firstborn among many brothers .
45008030	Whom he foreordained , them he also called . Whom he called , them he also justified . Whom he justified , them he also glorified .
45008031	What then will we say about these things ? If God is for us , who can be against us ?
45008032	He who didn't spare his own Son , but delivered him up for us all , how would he not also with him freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who could bring a charge against God's elect ? It is God who justifies .
45008034	Who is he who condemns ? It is Christ who died , yes rather , who was raised from the dead , who is at the right hand of God , who also makes intercession for us .
45008035	Who shall separate us from the love of Christ ? Could oppression , or anguish , or persecution , or famine , or nakedness , or peril , or sword ?
45008036	Even as it is written , " For your sake we are killed all day long . We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter . "
45008037	No , in all these things , we are more than conquerors through him who loved us .
45008038	For I am persuaded , that neither death , nor life , nor angels , nor principalities , nor things present , nor things to come , nor powers ,
45008039	nor height , nor depth , nor any other creature , will be able to separate us from the love of God , which is in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I tell the truth in Christ . I am not lying , my conscience testifying with me in the Holy Spirit ,
45009002	that I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart .
45009003	For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers ' sake , my relatives according to the flesh ,
45009004	who are Israelites ; whose is the adoption , the glory , the covenants , the giving of the law , the service , and the promises ;
45009005	whose are the fathers , and of whom is Christ as concerning the flesh , who is over all , God , blessed forever . Amen .
45009006	But it is not as though the word of God has come to nothing . For they are not all Israel , that are of Israel .
45009007	Neither , because they are Abraham's seed , are they all children . But , " In Isaac will your seed be called . "
45009008	That is , it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God , but the children of the promise are counted as a seed .
45009009	For this is a word of promise , " At the appointed time I will come , and Sarah will have a son . "
45009010	Not only so , but Rebecca also conceived by one , by our father Isaac .
45009011	For being not yet born , neither having done anything good or bad , that the purpose of God according to election might stand , not of works , but of him who calls ,
45009012	it was said to her , " The elder will serve the younger . "
45009013	Even as it is written , " Jacob I loved , but Esau I hated . "
45009014	What will we say then ? Is there unrighteousness with God ? Certainly not !
45009015	For he said to Moses , " I will have mercy on whom I have mercy , and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion . "
45009016	So then it is not of him who wills , nor of him who runs , but of God who has mercy .
45009017	For the scripture says to Pharaoh , " For this very purpose I caused you to be raised up , that I might show in you my power , and that my name might be published abroad in all the earth . "
45009018	So then , he has mercy on whom he desires , and he hardens whom he desires .
45009019	You will say then to me , " Why does he still find fault ? For who withstands his will ? "
45009020	But no , man , who are you who replies against God ? Will the thing formed ask him who formed it , " Why did you make me like this ? "
45009021	Or hasn't the potter a right over the clay , from the same lump to make one part a vessel for honor , and another for dishonor ?
45009022	What if God , willing to show his wrath , and to make his power known , endured with much patience vessels of wrath made for destruction ,
45009023	and that he might make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy , which he prepared beforehand for glory ,
45009024	us , whom he also called , not from the Jews only , but also from the Gentiles ?
45009025	As he says also in Hosea , " I will call them ' my people , ' which were not my people ; And her ' beloved , ' who was not beloved . "
45009026	" It will be that in the place where it was said to them , ' You are not my people , ' There will they be called ' sons of the living God . ' "
45009027	Isaiah cries concerning Israel , " If the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea , It is the remnant who will be saved ;
45009028	For He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness , Because the LORD will make a short work upon the earth . "
45009029	As Isaiah has said before , " Unless the Lord of Hosts had left us a seed , We would have become like Sodom , And would have been made like Gomorrah . "
45009030	What will we say then ? That the Gentiles , who didn't follow after righteousness , attained to righteousness , even the righteousness which is of faith ;
45009031	but Israel , following after a law of righteousness , didn't arrive at the law of righteousness .
45009032	Why ? Because they didn't seek it by faith , but as it were by works of the law . They stumbled over the stumbling stone ;
45009033	even as it is written , " Behold , I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense . And no one who believes in him will be put to shame . "
45010001	Brothers , my heart's desire and my prayer to God is for Israel , that they may be saved .
45010002	For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God , but not according to knowledge .
45010003	For being ignorant of God's righteousness , and seeking to establish their own righteousness , they didn't subject themselves to the righteousness of God .
45010004	For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes .
45010005	For Moses writes about the righteousness of the law , " The one who does them will live by them . "
45010006	But the righteousness which is of faith says this , " Don't say in your heart , ' Who will ascend into heaven ? ' ( that is , to bring Christ down ) ;
45010007	or , ' Who will descend into the abyss ? ' ( that is , to bring Christ up from the dead . ) "
45010008	But what does it say ? " The word is near you , in your mouth , and in your heart ; " that is , the word of faith , which we preach :
45010009	that if you will confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus , and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead , you will be saved .
45010010	For with the heart , one believes unto righteousness ; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation .
45010011	For the scripture says , " Whoever believes in him will not be put to shame . "
45010012	For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek ; for the same Lord is Lord of all , and is rich to all who call on him .
45010013	For , " Whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved . "
45010014	How then will they call on him in whom they have not believed ? How will they believe in him whom they have not heard ? How will they hear without a preacher ?
45010015	And how will they preach unless they are sent ? As it is written : " How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace , Who bring glad tidings of good things ! "
45010016	But they didn't all listen to the glad news . For Isaiah says , " Lord , who has believed our report ? "
45010017	So faith comes by hearing , and hearing by the word of God .
45010018	But I say , didn't they hear ? Yes , most assuredly , " Their sound went out into all the earth , Their words to the ends of the world . "
45010019	But I ask , didn't Israel know ? First Moses says , " I will provoke you to jealousy with that which is no nation , With a nation void of understanding I will make you angry . "
45010020	Isaiah is very bold , and says , " I was found by those who didn't seek me . I was revealed to those who didn't ask for me . "
45010021	But as to Israel he says , " All day long I stretched out my hands to a disobedient and contrary people .
45011001	I ask then , Did God reject his people ? Certainly not ! For I also am an Israelite , a descendant of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God didn't reject his people , which he foreknew . Or don't you know what the scripture says about Elijah ? How he pleads with God against Israel :
45011003	" Lord , they have killed your prophets , they have broken down your altars ; and I am left alone , and they seek my life . "
45011004	But how does God answer him ? " I have reserved for myself seven thousand men , who have not bowed the knee to Baal . "
45011005	Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace .
45011006	And if by grace , then it is no longer of works ; otherwise grace is no longer grace . But if it is of works , it is no longer grace ; otherwise work is no longer work .
45011007	What then ? That which Israel seeks for , that he didn't obtain , but the election obtained it , and the rest were hardened .
45011008	According as it is written , " God gave them a spirit of stupor , eyes that they should not see , and ears that they should not hear , to this very day . "
45011009	David says , " Let their table be made a snare , and a trap , A stumbling block , and a retribution to them .
45011010	Let their eyes be darkened , that they may not see . Bow down their back always . "
45011011	I ask then , did they stumble that they might fall ? Certainly not ! But by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles , to provoke them to jealousy .
45011012	Now if their fall is the riches of the world , and their loss the riches of the Gentiles ; how much more their fullness ?
45011013	For I speak to you who are Gentiles . Since then as I am an apostle to Gentiles , I glorify my ministry ;
45011014	if by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh , and may save some of them .
45011015	For if the rejection of them [ is ] the reconciling of the world , what would the receiving of them be , but life from the dead ?
45011016	If the first fruit is holy , so is the lump . If the root is holy , so are the branches .
45011017	But if some of the branches were broken off , and you , being a wild olive , were grafted in among them , and became partaker with them of the root of the richness of the olive tree ;
45011018	don't boast over the branches . But if you boast , it is not you who bear the root , but the root you .
45011019	You will say then , " Branches were broken off , that I might be grafted in . "
45011020	True ; by their unbelief they were broken off , and you stand by your faith . Don't be conceited , but fear ;
45011021	for if God didn't spare the natural branches , neither will he spare you .
45011022	See then the goodness and severity of God . Toward those who fell , severity ; but toward you , goodness , if you continue in his goodness ; otherwise you also will be cut off .
45011023	They also , if they don't continue in their unbelief , will be grafted in , for God is able to graft them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut out of that which is by nature a wild olive tree , and were grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree , how much more will these , which are the natural branches , be grafted into their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I don't desire , brothers , to have you ignorant of this mystery , so that you won't be wise in your own conceits , that a hardening in part has happened to Israel , until the fullness of the Gentiles have come in ,
45011026	and so all Israel will be saved . Even as it is written , " There will come out of Zion the Deliverer , And he will turn away ungodliness from Jacob .
45011027	This is my covenant to them , When I will take away their sins . "
45011028	Concerning the gospel , they are enemies for your sake . But concerning the election , they are beloved for the fathers ' sake .
45011029	For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable .
45011030	For as you in time past were disobedient to God , but now have obtained mercy by their disobedience ,
45011031	even so these also have now been disobedient , that by the mercy shown to you they may also obtain mercy .
45011032	For God has shut up all to disobedience , that he might have mercy on all .
45011033	Oh the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and the knowledge of God ! How unsearchable are his judgments , and his ways past tracing out !
45011034	" For who has known the mind of the Lord ? Or who has been his counselor ? "
45011035	" Or who has first given to him , And it will be repaid to him again ? "
45011036	For of him , and through him , and to him , are all things . To him be the glory for ever ! Amen .
45012001	Therefore I beg you , brothers , by the mercies of God , to present your bodies a living sacrifice , holy , acceptable to God , which is your spiritual service .
45012002	Don't be fashioned according to this world , but be transformed by the renewing of your mind , so that you may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God .
45012003	For I say , through the grace that was given me , to every man who is among you , not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think ; but to think reasonably , as God has apportioned to each person a measure of faith .
45012004	For even as we have many members in one body , and all the members don't have the same function ,
45012005	so we , who are many , are one body in Christ , and individually members one of another .
45012006	Having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us , if prophecy , let us prophesy according to the proportion of our faith ;
45012007	or service , let us give ourselves to service ; or he who teaches , to his teaching ;
45012008	or he who exhorts , to his exhorting : he who gives , let him do it with liberality ; he who rules , with diligence ; he who shows mercy , with cheerfulness .
45012009	Let love be without hypocrisy . Abhor that which is evil . Cling to that which is good .
45012010	In love of the brothers be tenderly affectionate one to another ; in honor preferring one another ;
45012011	not lagging in diligence ; fervent in spirit ; serving the Lord ;
45012012	rejoicing in hope ; enduring in oppression ; continuing steadfastly in prayer ;
45012013	contributing to the needs of the saints ; given to hospitality .
45012014	Bless those who persecute you ; bless , and don't curse .
45012015	Rejoice with those who rejoice . Weep with those who weep .
45012016	Be of the same mind one toward another . Don't set your mind on high things , but associate with the humble . Don't be wise in your own conceits .
45012017	Repay no one evil for evil . Respect what is honorable in the sight of all men .
45012018	If it is possible , as much as it is up to you , be at peace with all men .
45012019	Don't seek revenge yourselves , beloved , but give place to God's wrath . For it is written , " Vengeance belongs to me ; I will repay , says the Lord . "
45012020	Therefore " If your enemy is hungry , feed him . If he is thirsty , give him a drink . For in doing so , you will heap coals of fire on his head . "
45012021	Don't be overcome by evil , but overcome evil with good .
45013001	Let every soul be in subjection to the higher authorities , for there is no authority except from God , and those who be are ordained by God .
45013002	Therefore he who resists the authority , withstands the ordinance of God ; and those who withstand will receive to themselves judgment .
45013003	For rulers are not a terror to the good work , but to the evil . Do you desire to have no fear of the authority ? Do that which is good , and you will have praise from the same ,
45013004	for he is a servant of God to you for good . But if you do that which is evil , be afraid , for he doesn't bear the sword in vain ; for he is a minister of God , an avenger for wrath to him who does evil .
45013005	Therefore you need to be in subjection , not only because of the wrath , but also for conscience ' sake .
