45013006	For this reason you also pay taxes , for they are ministers of God's service , attending continually on this very thing .
45013007	Give therefore to everyone what you owe : taxes to whom taxes are due ; customs to whom customs ; respect to whom respect ; honor to whom honor .
45013008	Owe no one anything , except to love one another ; for he who loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law .
45013009	For the commandments , " You shall not commit adultery , " " You shall not murder , " " You shall not steal , " " You shall not give false testimony , " " You shall not covet , " and whatever other commandments there are , are all summed up in this saying , namely , " You shall love your neighbor as yourself . "
45013010	Love doesn't harm his neighbor . Love therefore is the fulfillment of the law .
45013011	This , knowing the time , that it is already time for you to awake out of sleep , for salvation is now nearer to us than when we first believed .
45013012	The night is far gone , and the day is near . Let's therefore throw off the works of darkness , and let's put on the armor of light .
45013013	Let us walk properly , as in the day ; not in reveling and drunkenness , not in sexual promiscuity and lustful acts , and not in strife and jealousy .
45013014	But put on the Lord Jesus Christ , and make no provision for the flesh , for its lusts .
45014001	But receive him who is weak in faith , not for judging thoughts .
45014002	One man has faith to eat all things , but he who is weak eats herbs .
45014003	Don't let him who eats despise him who doesn't eat . Don't let him who doesn't eat judge him who eats , for God has received him .
45014004	Who are you who judge the servant of another ? To his own lord he stands or falls . Yes , he will be made to stand , for God has power to make him stand .
45014005	One man esteems one day above another . Another esteems every day alike . Let each man be fully assured in his own mind .
45014006	He who observes the day , observes it to the Lord ; and he who does not observe the day , to the Lord he does not observe it . He who eats , eats to the Lord , for he gives God thanks . He who doesn't eat , to the Lord he doesn't eat , and gives God thanks .
45014007	For none of us lives to himself , and none dies to himself .
45014008	For if we live , we live to the Lord . Or if we die , we die to the Lord . If therefore we live or die , we are the Lord's .
45014009	For to this end Christ died , rose , and lived again , that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living .
45014010	But you , why do you judge your brother ? Or you again , why do you despise your brother ? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of Christ .
45014011	For it is written , " ' As I live , ' says the Lord , ' to me every knee will bow . Every tongue will confess to God . ' "
45014012	So then each one of us will give account of himself to God .
45014013	Therefore Let's not judge one another any more , but judge this rather , that no man put a stumbling block in his brother's way , or an occasion of falling .
45014014	I know , and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus , that nothing is unclean of itself ; except that to him who considers anything to be unclean , to him it is unclean .
45014015	Yet if because of food your brother is grieved , you walk no longer in love . Don't destroy with your food him for whom Christ died .
45014016	Then don't let your good be slandered ,
45014017	for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking , but righteousness , peace , and joy in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	For he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men .
45014019	So then , let us follow after things which make for peace , and things whereby we may build one another up .
45014020	Don't overthrow God's work for food's sake . All things indeed are clean , however it is evil for that man who creates a stumbling block by eating .
45014021	It is good not to eat meat , drink wine nor do anything by which your brother stumbles , is offended , or is made weak .
45014022	Do you have faith ? Have it to yourself before God . Happy is he who doesn't judge himself in that which he approves .
45014023	But he who doubts is condemned if he eats , because it isn't of faith ; and whatever is not of faith is sin .
45014024	Now to him who is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ , according to the revelation of the mystery which has been kept in silence through eternal times ,
45014025	but now is revealed , and by the scriptures of the prophets , according to the commandment of the eternal God , is made known to all the nations to obedience of faith ;
45014026	to the only wise God , through Jesus Christ , to whom be the glory forever ! Amen .
45015001	Now we who are strong ought to bear the weaknesses of the weak , and not to please ourselves .
45015002	Let each one of us please his neighbor for that which is good , to be building him up .
45015003	For Christ also didn't please himself . But , as it is written , " The reproaches of those who reproached you fell on me . "
45015004	For whatever things were written before were written for our learning , that through patience and through comfort of the scriptures we might have hope .
45015005	Now the God of patience and of comfort grant you to be of the same mind one with another according to Christ Jesus ,
45015006	that with one accord you may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	Therefore receive one another , even as Christ also received you , to the glory of God .
45015008	Now I say that Christ has been made a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God , that he might confirm the promises given to the fathers ,
45015009	and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy . As it is written , " Therefore will I give praise to you among the Gentiles , And sing to your name . "
45015010	Again he says , " Rejoice , you Gentiles , with his people . "
45015011	Again , " Praise the Lord , all you Gentiles ! Let all the peoples praise him . "
45015012	Again , Isaiah says , " There will be the root of Jesse , He who arises to rule over the Gentiles ; On him will the Gentiles hope . "
45015013	Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing , that you may abound in hope , in the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	I myself am also persuaded about you , my brothers , that you yourselves are full of goodness , filled with all knowledge , able also to admonish others .
45015015	But I write the more boldly to you in some measure , as putting you again in memory , because of the grace that was given to me by God ,
45015016	that I should be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles , serving the gospel of God , that the offering up of the Gentiles might be made acceptable , being sanctified by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	I have therefore my boasting in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God .
45015018	For I will not dare to speak of any things except those which Christ worked through me , for the obedience of the Gentiles , by word and deed ,
45015019	in the power of signs and wonders , in the power of God's Spirit ; so that from Jerusalem , and around as far as to Illyricum , I have fully preached the gospel of Christ ;
45015020	yes , making it my aim so to preach the gospel , not where Christ was already named , that I might not build on another man's foundation .
45015021	But , as it is written , " They will see , to whom no news of him came . They who haven't heard will understand . "
45015022	Therefore also I was hindered these many times from coming to you ,
45015023	but now , no longer having any place in these regions , and having these many years a longing to come to you ,
45015024	whenever I journey to Spain , I will come to you . For I hope to see you on my journey , and to be helped on my way there by you , if first I may enjoy your company for a while .
45015025	But now , I say , I am going to Jerusalem , serving the saints .
45015026	For it has been the good pleasure of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints who are at Jerusalem .
45015027	Yes , it has been their good pleasure , and they are their debtors . For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things , they owe it to them also to serve them in fleshly things .
45015028	When therefore I have accomplished this , and have sealed to them this fruit , I will go on by you to Spain .
45015029	I know that , when I come to you , I will come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ .
45015030	Now I beg you , brothers , by our Lord Jesus Christ , and by the love of the Spirit , that you strive together with me in your prayers to God for me ,
45015031	that I may be delivered from those who are disobedient in Judea , and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints ;
45015032	that I may come to you in joy through the will of God , and together with you , find rest .
45015033	Now the God of peace be with you all . Amen .
45016001	I commend to you Phoebe , our sister , who is a servant of the assembly that is at Cenchreae ,
45016002	that you receive her in the Lord , in a way worthy of the saints , and that you assist her in whatever matter she may need from you , for she herself also has been a helper of many , and of my own self .
45016003	Greet Prisca and Aquila , my fellow workers in Christ Jesus ,
45016004	who for my life , laid down their own necks ; to whom not only I give thanks , but also all the assemblies of the Gentiles .
45016005	Greet the assembly that is in their house . Greet Epaenetus , my beloved , who is the first-fruits of Achaia to Christ .
45016006	Greet Mary , who labored much for us .
45016007	Greet Andronicus and Junias , my relatives and my fellow prisoners , who are notable among the apostles , who also have been in Christ before me .
45016008	Greet Amplias , my beloved in the Lord .
45016009	Greet Urbanus , our fellow worker in Christ , and Stachys , my beloved .
45016010	Greet Apelles , the approved in Christ . Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus .
45016011	Greet Herodion , my kinsman . Greet them of the household of Narcissus , who are in the Lord .
45016012	Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa , who labor in the Lord . Greet Persis , the beloved , who labored much in the Lord .
45016013	Greet Rufus , the chosen in the Lord , and his mother and mine .
45016014	Greet Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermes , Patrobas , Hermas , and the brothers who are with them .
45016015	Greet Philologus and Julia , Nereus and his sister , and Olympas , and all the saints who are with them .
45016016	Greet one another with a holy kiss . The assemblies of Christ greet you .
45016017	Now I beg you , brothers , mark those who are causing the divisions and occasions of stumbling , contrary to the doctrine which you learned , and turn away from them .
45016018	For those who are such don't serve our Lord , Jesus Christ , but their own belly ; and by their smooth and flattering speech , they deceive the hearts of the innocent .
45016019	For your obedience has reached all . I rejoice therefore over you . But I desire to have you wise to that which is good , but innocent to that which is evil .
45016020	Now the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet swiftly . The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
45016021	Timothy , my fellow worker , greets you , as do Lucius , Jason , and Sosipater , my relatives .
45016022	I , Tertius , who write the letter , greet you in the Lord .
45016023	Gaius , my host and host of the whole assembly , greets you . Erastus , the treasurer of the city , greets you , as does Quartus , the brother .
45016024	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all ! Amen .
46001001	Paul , called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God , and our brother Sosthenes ,
46001002	to the assembly of God which is at Corinth ; those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus , called to be saints , with all who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ in every place , both theirs and ours :
46001003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
46001004	I always thank my God concerning you , for the grace of God which was given you in Christ Jesus ;
46001005	that in everything you were enriched in him , in all speech and all knowledge ;
46001006	even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you :
46001007	so that you come behind in no gift ; waiting for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ ;
46001008	who will also confirm you until the end , blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46001009	God is faithful , through whom you were called into the fellowship of his Son , Jesus Christ , our Lord .
46001010	Now I beg you , brothers , through the name of our Lord , Jesus Christ , that you all speak the same thing and that there be no divisions among you , but that you be perfected together in the same mind and in the same judgment .
46001011	For it has been reported to me concerning you , my brothers , by those who are from Chloe's household , that there are contentions among you .
46001012	Now I mean this , that each one of you says , " I follow Paul , " " I follow Apollos , " " I follow Cephas , " and , " I follow Christ . "
46001013	Is Christ divided ? Was Paul crucified for you ? Or were you baptized into the name of Paul ?
46001014	I thank God that I baptized none of you , except Crispus and Gaius ,
46001015	so that no one should say that I had baptized you into my own name .
46001016	( I also baptized the household of Stephanas ; besides them , I don't know whether I baptized any other . )
46001017	For Christ sent me not to baptize , but to preach the gospel - - not in wisdom of words , so that the cross of Christ wouldn't be made void .
46001018	For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are dying , but to us who are saved it is the power of God .
46001019	For it is written , " I will destroy the wisdom of the wise , I will bring the discernment of the discerning to nothing . "
46001020	Where is the wise ? Where is the scribe ? Where is the lawyer of this world ? Hasn't God made foolish the wisdom of this world ?
46001021	For seeing that in the wisdom of God , the world through its wisdom didn't know God , it was God's good pleasure through the foolishness of the preaching to save those who believe .
46001022	For Jews ask for signs , Greeks seek after wisdom ,
46001023	but we preach Christ crucified ; a stumbling block to Jews , and foolishness to Greeks ,
46001024	but to those who are called , both Jews and Greeks , Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God .
46001025	Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men , and the weakness of God is stronger than men .
46001026	For you see your calling , brothers , that not many are wise according to the flesh , not many mighty , and not many noble ;
46001027	but God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise . God chose the weak things of the world , that he might put to shame the things that are strong ;
46001028	and God chose the lowly things of the world , and the things that are despised , and the things that are not , that he might bring to nothing the things that are :
46001029	that no flesh should boast before God .
46001030	But of him , you are in Christ Jesus , who was made to us wisdom from God , and righteousness and sanctification , and redemption :
46001031	that , according as it is written , " He who boasts , let him boast in the Lord . "
46002001	When I came to you , brothers , I didn't come with excellence of speech or of wisdom , proclaiming to you the testimony of God .
46002002	For I determined not to know anything among you , except Jesus Christ , and him crucified .
46002003	I was with you in weakness , in fear , and in much trembling .
46002004	My speech and my preaching were not in persuasive words of human wisdom , but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power ,
46002005	that your faith wouldn't stand in the wisdom of men , but in the power of God .
46002006	We speak wisdom , however , among those who are full grown ; yet a wisdom not of this world , nor of the rulers of this world , who are coming to nothing .
46002007	But we speak God's wisdom in a mystery , the wisdom that has been hidden , which God foreordained before the worlds to our glory ,
46002008	which none of the rulers of this world has known . For had they known it , they wouldn't have crucified the Lord of glory .
46002009	But as it is written , " Things which eye didn't see , and ear didn't hear , Which didn't enter into the heart of man , Whatever things God prepared for those who love him . "
46002010	But to us , God revealed them through the Spirit . For the Spirit searches all things , yes , the deep things of God .
46002011	For who among men knows the things of a man , except the spirit of the man , which is in him ? Even so , no one knows the things of God , except God's Spirit .
46002012	But we received , not the spirit of the world , but the Spirit which is from God , that we might know the things that were freely given to us by God .
46002013	Which things also we speak , not in words which man's wisdom teaches , but which the Holy Spirit teaches , comparing spiritual things with spiritual things .
46002014	Now the natural man doesn't receive the things of the God's Spirit , for they are foolishness to him , and he can't know them , because they are spiritually discerned .
46002015	But he who is spiritual discerns all things , and he himself is judged by no one .
46002016	" For who has known the mind of the Lord , that he should instruct him ? " But we have Christ's mind .
46003001	Brothers , I couldn't speak to you as to spiritual , but as to fleshly , as to babes in Christ .
46003002	I fed you with milk , not with meat ; for you weren't yet ready . Indeed , not even now are you ready ,
46003003	for you are still fleshly . For insofar as there is jealousy , strife , and factions among you , aren't you fleshly , and don't you walk in the ways of men ?
46003004	For when one says , " I follow Paul , " and another , " I follow Apollos , " aren't you fleshly ?
46003005	Who then is Apollos , and who is Paul , but servants through whom you believed ; and each as the Lord gave to him ?
46003006	I planted . Apollos watered . But God gave the increase .
46003007	So then neither he who plants is anything , nor he who waters , but God who gives the increase .
46003008	Now he who plants and he who waters are the same , but each will receive his own reward according to his own labor .
46003009	For we are God's fellow workers . You are God's farming , God's building .
46003010	According to the grace of God which was given to me , as a wise master builder I laid a foundation , and another builds on it . But let each man be careful how he builds on it .
46003011	For no one can lay any other foundation than that which has been laid , which is Jesus Christ .
46003012	But if anyone builds on the foundation with gold , silver , costly stones , wood , hay , or stubble ;
46003013	each man's work will be revealed . For the Day will declare it , because it is revealed in fire ; and the fire itself will test what sort of work each man's work is .
46003014	If any man's work remains which he built on it , he will receive a reward .
46003015	If any man's work is burned , he will suffer loss , but he himself will be saved , but as through fire .
46003016	Don't you know that you are a temple of God , and that God's Spirit lives in you ?
46003017	If anyone destroys the temple of God , God will destroy him ; for God's temple is holy , which you are .
46003018	Let no one deceive himself . If anyone thinks that he is wise among you in this world , let him become a fool , that he may become wise .
46003019	For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God . For it is written , " He has taken the wise in their craftiness . "
46003020	And again , " The Lord knows the reasoning of the wise , that it is worthless . "
46003021	Therefore let no one boast in men . For all things are yours ,
46003022	whether Paul , or Apollos , or Cephas , or the world , or life , or death , or things present , or things to come . All are yours ,
46003023	and you are Christ's , and Christ is God's .
46004001	So let a man think of us as Christ's servants , and stewards of God's mysteries .
46004002	Here , moreover , it is required of stewards , that they be found faithful .
46004003	But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you , or by man's judgment . Yes , I don't judge my own self .
46004004	For I know nothing against myself . Yet I am not justified by this , but he who judges me is the Lord .
46004005	Therefore judge nothing before the time , until the Lord comes , who will both bring to light the hidden things of darkness , and reveal the counsels of the hearts . Then each man will get his praise from God .
46004006	Now these things , brothers , I have in a figure transferred to myself and Apollos for your sakes , that in us you might learn not to think beyond the things which are written , that none of you be puffed up against one another .
46004007	For who makes you different ? And what do you have that you didn't receive ? But if you did receive it , why do you boast as if you had not received it ?
46004008	You are already filled . You have already become rich . You have come to reign without us . Yes , and I wish that you did reign , that we also might reign with you .
46004009	For , I think that God has displayed us , the apostles , last of all , like men sentenced to death . For we are made a spectacle to the world , both to angels and men .
46004010	We are fools for Christ's sake , but you are wise in Christ . We are weak , but you are strong . You have honor , but we have dishonor .
46004011	Even to this present hour we hunger , thirst , are naked , are beaten , and have no certain dwelling place .
46004012	We toil , working with our own hands . Being reviled , we bless . Being persecuted , we endure .
46004013	Being defamed , we entreat . We are made as the filth of the world , the dirt wiped off by all , even until now .
46004014	I don't write these things to shame you , but to admonish you as my beloved children .
46004015	For though you have ten thousand tutors in Christ , yet not many fathers . For in Christ Jesus , I became your father through the gospel .
46004016	I beg you therefore , be imitators of me .
46004017	Because of this I have sent Timothy to you , who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord , who will remind you of my ways which are in Christ , even as I teach everywhere in every assembly .
46004018	Now some are puffed up , as though I were not coming to you .
46004019	But I will come to you shortly , if the Lord is willing . And I will know , not the word of those who are puffed up , but the power .
46004020	For the kingdom of God is not in word , but in power .
46004021	What do you want ? Will I come to you with a rod , or in love and a spirit of gentleness ?
46005001	It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you , and such sexual immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles , that one has his father's wife .
46005002	You are puffed up , and didn't rather mourn , that he who had done this deed might be removed from among you .
46005003	For I most assuredly , as being absent in body but present in spirit , have already , as though I were present , judged him who has done this thing .
46005004	In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , you being gathered together , and my spirit , with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
46005005	are to deliver such a one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh , that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus .
46005006	Your boasting is not good . Don't you know that a little yeast leavens the whole lump ?
46005007	Purge out the old yeast , that you may be a new lump , even as you are unleavened . For indeed Christ , our Passover , has been sacrificed in our place .
46005008	Therefore let us keep the feast , not with old yeast , neither with the yeast of malice and wickedness , but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
46005009	I wrote to you in my letter to have no company with sexual sinners ;
46005010	yet not at all meaning with the sexual sinners of this world , or with the covetous and extortioners , or with idolaters ; for then you would have to leave the world .
46005011	But as it is , I wrote to you not to keep company , if any man who is named a brother is a sexual sinner , or covetous , or an idolater , or a slanderer , or a drunkard , or an extortioner . Don't even eat with such a person .
46005012	For what have I to do with also judging those who are outside ? Don't you judge those who are within ?
46005013	But those who are outside , God judges . " Put away the wicked man from among yourselves . "
46006001	Dare any of you , having a matter against his neighbor , go to law before the unrighteous , and not before the saints ?
46006002	Don't you know that the saints will judge the world ? And if the world is judged by you , are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters ?
46006003	Don't you know that we will judge angels ? How much more , things that pertain to this life ?
46006004	If then , you have to judge things pertaining to this life , do you set them to judge who are of no account in the assembly ?
46006005	I say this to move you to shame . What , can't there be one wise man among you who will be able to decide between his brothers ;
46006006	but brother goes to law with brother , and that before unbelievers ?
46006007	Therefore it is already altogether a defect in you , that you have lawsuits one with another . Why not rather be wronged ? Why not rather be defrauded ?
46006008	No , but you yourselves do wrong , and defraud , and that against your brothers .
46006009	Or don't you know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God ? Don't be deceived . Neither the sexually immoral , nor idolaters , nor adulterers , nor male prostitutes , nor homosexuals ,
46006010	nor thieves , nor covetous , nor drunkards , nor slanderers , nor extortioners , will inherit the kingdom of God .
46006011	Such were some of you , but you were washed . But you were sanctified . But you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus , and in the Spirit of our God .
46006012	" All things are lawful for me , " but not all things are expedient . " All things are lawful for me , " but I will not be brought under the power of anything .
46006013	" Foods for the belly , and the belly for foods , " but God will bring to nothing both it and them . But the body is not for sexual immorality , but for the Lord ; and the Lord for the body .
46006014	Now God raised up the Lord , and will also raise us up by his power .
46006015	Don't you know that your bodies are members of Christ ? Will I then take away the members of Christ , and make them members of a prostitute ? Certainly not !
46006016	Or don't you know that he who is joined to a prostitute is one body ? For , " The two , " says he , " will become one flesh . "
46006017	But he who is joined to the Lord is one spirit .
46006018	Flee sexual immorality . " Every sin that a man does is outside the body , " but he who commits sexual immorality sins against his own body .
46006019	Or don't you know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit which is in you , which you have from God ? You are not your own ,
46006020	for you were bought with a price . Therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit , which are God's .
46007001	Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me . It is good for a man not to touch a woman .
46007002	But , because of sexual sins , let each man have his own wife , and let each woman have her own husband .
46007003	Let the husband render to the wife her due , and likewise also the wife to the husband .
46007004	The wife doesn't have authority over her own body , but the husband . Likewise also the husband doesn't have power over his own body , but the wife .
46007005	Don't defraud one another , unless it is by consent for a season , that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer , and may be together again , that Satan doesn't tempt you because of your lack of self-control .
46007006	But this I say by way of concession , not of commandment .
46007007	Yet I wish that all men were like me . However each man has his own gift from God , one of this kind , and another of that kind .
46007008	But I say to the unmarried and to widows , it is good for them if they remain even as I am .
46007009	But if they don't have self-control , let them marry . For it's better to marry than to burn .
46007010	But to the married I command - - not I , but the Lord - - that the wife not leave her husband
46007011	( but if she departs , let her remain unmarried , or else be reconciled to her husband ) , and that the husband not leave his wife .
46007012	But to the rest I - - not the Lord - - say , if any brother has an unbelieving wife , and she is content to live with him , let him not leave her .
46007013	The woman who has an unbelieving husband , and he is content to live with her , let her not leave her husband .
46007014	For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife , and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the husband . Otherwise your children would be unclean , but now are they holy .
46007015	Yet if the unbeliever departs , let there be separation . The brother or the sister is not under bondage in such cases , but God has called us in peace .
46007016	For how do you know , wife , whether you will save your husband ? Or how do you know , husband , whether you will save your wife ?
46007017	Only , as the Lord has distributed to each man , as God has called each , so let him walk . So I command in all the assemblies .
46007018	Was anyone called being circumcised ? Let him not become uncircumcised . Has any been called in uncircumcision ? Let him not be circumcised .
46007019	Circumcision is nothing , and uncircumcision is nothing , but the keeping of the commandments of God .
46007020	Let each man stay in that calling in which he was called .
46007021	Were you called being a bondservant ? Don't let that bother you , but if you get an opportunity to become free , use it .
46007022	For he who was called in the Lord being a bondservant is the Lord's free man . Likewise he who was called being free is Christ's bondservant .
46007023	You were bought with a price . Don't become bondservants of men .
46007024	Brothers , let each man , in whatever condition he was called , stay in that condition with God .
46007025	Now concerning virgins , I have no commandment from the Lord , but I give my judgment as one who has obtained mercy from the Lord to be trustworthy .
46007026	I think that it is good therefore , because of the distress that is on us , that it is good for a man to be as he is .
46007027	Are you bound to a wife ? Don't seek to be freed . Are you free from a wife ? Don't seek a wife .
46007028	But if you marry , you have not sinned . If a virgin marries , she has not sinned . Yet such will have oppression in the flesh , and I want to spare you .
46007029	But I say this , brothers : the time is short , that from now on , both those who have wives may be as though they had none ;
46007030	and those who weep , as though they didn't weep ; and those who rejoice , as though they didn't rejoice ; and those who buy , as though they didn't possess ;
46007031	and those who use the world , as not using it to the fullest . For the mode of this world passes away .
46007032	But I desire to have you to be free from cares . He who is unmarried is concerned for the things of the Lord , how he may please the Lord ;
46007033	but he who is married is concerned about the things of the world , how he may please his wife .
46007034	There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin . The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord , that she may be holy both in body and in spirit . But she who is married cares about the things of the world - - how she may please her husband .
46007035	This I say for your own profit ; not that I may throw a snare on you , but for that which is appropriate , and that you may attend to the Lord without distraction .
46007036	But if any man thinks that he is behaving inappropriately toward his virgin , if she is past the flower of her age , and if need so requires , let him do what he desires . He doesn't sin . Let them marry .
46007037	But he who stands steadfast in his heart , having no necessity , but has power over his own heart , to keep his own virgin , will do well .
46007038	So then both he who gives his own virgin in marriage does well , and he who doesn't give her in marriage will do better .
46007039	A wife is bound by law for so long time as her husband lives ; but if the husband is dead , she is free to be married to whoever she desires , only in the Lord .
46007040	But she is happier if she stays as she is , in my judgment , and I think that I also have God's Spirit .
46008001	Now concerning things sacrificed to idols : We know that we all have knowledge . Knowledge puffs up , but love builds up .
46008002	But if anyone thinks that he knows anything , he doesn't yet know as he ought to know .
46008003	But if anyone loves God , the same is known by him .
46008004	Therefore concerning the eating of things sacrificed to idols , we know that no idol is anything in the world , and that there is no other God but one .
46008005	For though there are things that are called " gods , " whether in the heavens or on earth ; as there are many " gods " and many " lords ; "
46008006	yet to us there is one God , the Father , of whom are all things , and we to him ; and one Lord , Jesus Christ , through whom are all things , and we through him .
46008007	However , that knowledge isn't in all men . But some , being used until now to the idol , eat as of a thing sacrificed to an idol , and their conscience , being weak , is defiled .
46008008	But food will not commend us to God . For neither , if we don't eat , are we the worse ; nor , if we eat , are we the better .
46008009	But be careful that by any means this liberty of yours doesn't become a stumbling block to the weak .
46008010	For if a man sees you who have knowledge sitting in an idol's temple , won't his conscience , if he is weak , be emboldened to eat things sacrificed to idols ?
46008011	And through your knowledge , he who is weak perishes , the brother for whose sake Christ died .
46008012	Thus , sinning against the brothers , and wounding their conscience when it is weak , you sin against Christ .
46008013	Therefore , if food causes my brother to stumble , I will eat no meat forevermore , that I don't cause my brother to stumble .
46009001	Am I not free ? Am I not an apostle ? Haven't I seen Jesus Christ , our Lord ? Aren't you my work in the Lord ?
46009002	If to others I am not an apostle , yet at least I am to you ; for you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord .
46009003	My defense to those who examine me is this .
46009004	Have we no right to eat and to drink ?
46009005	Have we no right to take along a wife who is a believer , even as the rest of the apostles , and the brothers of the Lord , and Cephas ?
46009006	Or have only Barnabas and I no right to not work ?
46009007	What soldier ever serves at his own expense ? Who plants a vineyard , and doesn't eat of its fruit ? Or who feeds a flock , and doesn't drink from the flock's milk ?
46009008	Do I speak these things according to the ways of men ? Or doesn't the law also say the same thing ?
46009009	For it is written in the law of Moses , " You shall not muzzle the ox when he treads out the corn . " Is it for the oxen that God cares ,
46009010	or does he say it assuredly for our sake ? Yes , for our sake it was written , because he who plows ought to plow in hope , and he who threshes in hope should partake of his hope .
46009011	If we sowed to you spiritual things , is it a great thing if we reap your fleshly things ?
46009012	If others partake of this right over you , don't we yet more ? Nevertheless we did not use this right , but we bear all things , that we may cause no hindrance to the gospel of Christ .
46009013	Don't you know that those who serve around sacred things eat from the things of the temple , and those who wait on the altar have their portion with the altar ?
46009014	Even so did the Lord ordain that those who proclaim the gospel should live from the gospel .
46009015	But I have used none of these things , and I don't write these things that it may be done so in my case ; for I would rather die , than that anyone should make my boasting void .
46009016	For if I preach the gospel , I have nothing to boast about ; for necessity is laid on me ; but woe is to me , if I don't preach the gospel .
46009017	For if I do this of my own will , I have a reward . But if not of my own will , I have a stewardship entrusted to me .
46009018	What then is my reward ? That , when I preach the gospel , I may present the gospel of Christ without charge , so as not to abuse my authority in the gospel .
46009019	For though I was free from all , I brought myself under bondage to all , that I might gain the more .
46009020	To the Jews I became as a Jew , that I might gain Jews ; to those who are under the law , as under the law , that I might gain those who are under the law ;
46009021	to those who are without law , as without law ( not being without law toward God , but under law toward Christ ) , that I might win those who are without law .
46009022	To the weak I became as weak , that I might gain the weak . I have become all things to all men , that I may by all means save some .
46009023	Now I do this for the gospel's sake , that I may be a joint partaker of it .
46009024	Don't you know that those who run in a race all run , but one receives the prize ? Run like that , that you may win .
46009025	Every man who strives in the games exercises self-control in all things . Now they do it to receive a corruptible crown , but we an incorruptible .
46009026	I therefore run like that , as not uncertainly . I fight like that , as not beating the air ,
46009027	but I beat my body and bring it into submission , for fear that by any means , that after I have preached to others , I myself should be rejected .
46010001	Now I would not have you ignorant , brothers , that our fathers were all under the cloud , and all passed through the sea ;
46010002	and were all baptized to Moses in the cloud and in the sea ;
46010003	and all ate the same spiritual food ;
46010004	and all drank the same spiritual drink . For they drank of a spiritual rock that followed them , and the rock was Christ .
46010005	However with most of them , God was not well pleased , for they were overthrown in the wilderness .
46010006	Now these things were our examples , to the intent we should not lust after evil things , as they also lusted .
46010007	Neither be idolaters , as some of them were . As it is written , " The people sat down to eat and drink , and rose up to play . "
46010008	Neither let us commit sexual immorality , as some of them committed , and in one day twenty-three thousand fell .
46010009	Neither let us test the Lord , as some of them tested , and perished by the serpents .
46010010	Neither grumble , as some of them also grumbled , and perished by the destroyer .
46010011	Now all these things happened to them by way of example , and they were written for our admonition , on whom the ends of the ages have come .
46010012	Therefore let him who thinks he stands be careful that he doesn't fall .
46010013	No temptation has taken you but such as man can bear . God is faithful , who will not allow you to be tempted above what you are able , but will with the temptation make also the way of escape , that you may be able to endure it .
46010014	Therefore , my beloved , flee from idolatry .
46010015	I speak as to wise men . Judge what I say .
46010016	The cup of blessing which we bless , isn't it a communion of the blood of Christ ? The bread which we break , isn't it a communion of the body of Christ ?
46010017	Seeing that we , who are many , are one bread , one body ; for we all partake of the one bread .
46010018	Consider Israel after the flesh . Don't those who eat the sacrifices have communion with the altar ?
46010019	What am I saying then ? That a thing sacrificed to idols is anything , or that an idol is anything ?
46010020	But I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice , they sacrifice to demons , and not to God , and I don't desire that you would have communion with demons .
46010021	You can't both drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons . You can't both partake of the table of the Lord , and of the table of demons .
46010022	Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy ? Are we stronger than he ?
46010023	" All things are lawful for me , " but not all things are expedient . " All things are lawful for me , " but not all things build up .
46010024	Let no one seek his own , but each one his neighbor's good .
46010025	Whatever is sold in the butcher shop , eat , asking no question for the sake of conscience ,
46010026	for " the earth is the Lord's , and its fullness . "
46010027	But if one of those who don't believe invites you to a meal , and you are inclined to go , eat whatever is set before you , asking no questions for the sake of conscience .
46010028	But if anyone says to you , " This was offered to idols , " don't eat it for the sake of the one who told you , and for the sake of conscience . For " the earth is the Lord's , and all its fullness . "
46010029	Conscience , I say , not your own , but the other's conscience . For why is my liberty judged by another conscience ?
46010030	If I partake with thankfulness , why am I denounced for that for which I give thanks ?
46010031	Whether therefore you eat , or drink , or whatever you do , do all to the glory of God .
46010032	Give no occasions for stumbling , either to Jews , or to Greeks , or to the assembly of God ;
46010033	even as I also please all men in all things , not seeking my own profit , but the profit of the many , that they may be saved .
46011001	Be imitators of me , even as I also am of Christ .
46011002	Now I praise you , brothers , that you remember me in all things , and hold firm the traditions , even as I delivered them to you .
46011003	But I would have you know , that the head of every man is Christ , and the head of the woman is the man , and the head of Christ is God .
46011004	Every man praying or prophesying , having his head covered , dishonors his head .
46011005	But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonors her head . For it is one and the same thing as if she were shaved .
46011006	For if a woman is not covered , let her also be shorn . But if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved , let her be covered .
46011007	For a man indeed ought not to have his head covered , because he is the image and glory of God , but the woman is the glory of the man .
46011008	For man is not from woman , but woman from man ;
46011009	for neither was man created for the woman , but woman for the man .
46011010	For this cause the woman ought to have authority on her head , because of the angels .
46011011	Nevertheless , neither is the woman independent of the man , nor the man independent of the woman , in the Lord .
46011012	For as the woman is from the man , so is the man also by the woman ; but all things are from God .
46011013	Judge for yourselves . Is it appropriate that a woman pray to God unveiled ?
46011014	Doesn't even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair , it is a dishonor to him ?
46011015	But if a woman has long hair , it is a glory to her , for her hair is given to her for a covering .
46011016	But if any man seems to be contentious , we have no such custom , neither do God's assemblies .
46011017	But in giving you this command , I don't praise you , that you come together not for the better but for the worse .
46011018	For first of all , when you come together in the assembly , I hear that divisions exist among you , and I partly believe it .
46011019	For there must be also factions among you , that those who are approved may be revealed among you .
46011020	When therefore you assemble yourselves together , it is not possible to eat the Lord's supper .
46011021	For in your eating each one takes his own supper before others . One is hungry , and another is drunken .
46011022	What , don't you have houses to eat and to drink in ? Or do you despise God's assembly , and put them to shame who don't have ? What will I tell you ? Will I praise you ? In this I don't praise you .
46011023	For I received from the Lord that which also I delivered to you , that the Lord Jesus on the night in which he was betrayed took bread .
46011024	When he had given thanks , he broke it , and said , " Take , eat . This is my body , which is broken for you . Do this in memory of me . "
46011025	In the same way he also took the cup , after supper , saying , " This cup is the new covenant in my blood . Do this , as often as you drink , in memory of me . "
46011026	For as often as you eat this bread , and drink this cup , you proclaim the Lord's death until he comes .
46011027	Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks the Lord's cup in an unworthy manner , will be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord .
46011028	But let a man examine himself , and so let him eat of the bread , and drink of the cup .
46011029	For he who eats and drinks in an unworthy manner eats and drinks judgment to himself , if he doesn't discern the Lord's body .
46011030	For this cause many among you are weak and sickly , and not a few sleep .
46011031	For if we discerned ourselves , we wouldn't be judged .
46011032	But when we are judged , we are punished by the Lord , that we may not be condemned with the world .
46011033	Therefore , my brothers , when you come together to eat , wait one for another .
46011034	But if anyone is hungry , let him eat at home , that your coming together may not be to judgment . The rest I will set in order whenever I come .
46012001	Now concerning spiritual gifts , brothers , I don't want you to be ignorant .
46012002	You know that when you were Gentiles , you were led away to those mute idols , however you might be led .
46012003	Therefore I make known to you that no man speaking by God's Spirit says , " Jesus is accursed . " No one can say , " Jesus is Lord , " but by the Holy Spirit .
46012004	Now there are various kinds of gifts , but the same Spirit .
46012005	There are various kinds of service , and the same Lord .
46012006	There are various kinds of workings , but the same God , who works all things in all .
46012007	But to each one is given the manifestation of the Spirit for the profit of all .
46012008	For to one is given through the Spirit the word of wisdom , and to another the word of knowledge , according to the same Spirit ;
46012009	to another faith , by the same Spirit ; and to another gifts of healings , by the same Spirit ;
46012010	and to another workings of miracles ; and to another prophecy ; and to another discerning of spirits ; to another different kinds of languages ; and to another the interpretation of languages .
46012011	But the one and the same Spirit works all of these , distributing to each one separately as he desires .
46012012	For as the body is one , and has many members , and all the members of the body , being many , are one body ; so also is Christ .
46012013	For in one Spirit were we all baptized into one body , whether Jews or Greeks , whether bond or free ; and were all made to drink into one Spirit .
46012014	For the body is not one member , but many .
46012015	If the foot would say , " Because I'm not the hand , I'm not part of the body , " it is not therefore not part of the body .
46012016	If the ear would say , " Because I'm not the eye , I'm not part of the body , " it's not therefore not part of the body .
46012017	If the whole body were an eye , where would the hearing be ? If the whole were hearing , where would the smelling be ?
46012018	But now God has set the members , each one of them , in the body , just as he desired .
46012019	If they were all one member , where would the body be ?
46012020	But now they are many members , but one body .
46012021	The eye can't tell the hand , " I have no need for you , " or again the head to the feet , " I have no need for you . "
46012022	No , much rather , those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary .
46012023	Those parts of the body which we think to be less honorable , on those we bestow more abundant honor ; and our unpresentable parts have more abundant propriety ;
46012024	whereas our presentable parts have no such need . But God composed the body together , giving more abundant honor to the inferior part ,
46012025	that there should be no division in the body , but that the members should have the same care for one another .
46012026	When one member suffers , all the members suffer with it . Or when one member is honored , all the members rejoice with it .
46012027	Now you are the body of Christ , and members individually .
46012028	God has set some in the assembly , first apostles , secondly prophets , thirdly teachers , then miracle workers , then gifts of healings , helps , governments , and various kinds of languages .
46012029	Are all apostles ? Are all prophets ? Are all teachers ? Are all miracle workers ?
46012030	Do all have gifts of healings ? Do all speak with various languages ? Do all interpret ?
46012031	But desire earnestly the best gifts . Moreover , I show a most excellent way to you .
46013001	If I speak with the languages of men and of angels , but don't have love , I have become sounding brass , or a clanging cymbal .
46013002	If I have the gift of prophecy , and know all mysteries and all knowledge ; and if I have all faith , so as to remove mountains , but don't have love , I am nothing .
46013003	If I bestow all my goods to feed the poor , and if I give my body to be burned , but don't have love , it profits me nothing .
46013004	Love is patient and is kind ; love doesn't envy . Love doesn't brag , is not proud ,
46013005	doesn't behave itself inappropriately , doesn't seek its own way , is not provoked , takes no account of evil ;
46013006	doesn't rejoice in unrighteousness , but rejoices with the truth ;
46013007	bears all things , believes all things , hopes all things , endures all things .
46013008	Love never fails . But where there are prophecies , they will be done away with . Where there are various languages , they will cease . Where there is knowledge , it will be done away with .
46013009	For we know in part , and we prophesy in part ;
46013010	but when that which is complete has come , then that which is partial will be done away with .
46013011	When I was a child , I spoke as a child , I felt as a child , I thought as a child . Now that I have become a man , I have put away childish things .
46013012	For now we see in a mirror , dimly , but then face to face . Now I know in part , but then I will know fully , even as I was also fully known .
46013013	But now remain faith , hope , and love : these three . The greatest of these is love .
46014001	Follow after love , and earnestly desire spiritual gifts , but especially that you may prophesy .
46014002	For he who speaks in another language speaks not to men , but to God ; for no one understands ; but in the spirit he speaks mysteries .
46014003	But he who prophesies speaks to men for their edification , exhortation , and consolation .
46014004	He who speaks in another language edifies himself , but he who prophesies edifies the assembly .
46014005	Now I desire to have you all speak with other languages , but rather that you would prophesy . For he is greater who prophesies than he who speaks with other languages , unless he interprets , that the assembly may be built up .
46014006	But now , brothers , if I come to you speaking with other languages , what would I profit you , unless I speak to you either by way of revelation , or of knowledge , or of prophesying , or of teaching ?
46014007	Even things without life , giving a voice , whether pipe or harp , if they didn't give a distinction in the sounds , how would it be known what is piped or harped ?
46014008	For if the trumpet gave an uncertain voice , who would prepare himself for war ?
46014009	So also you , unless you uttered by the tongue words easy to understand , how would it be known what is spoken ? For you would be speaking into the air .
46014010	There are , it may be , so many kinds of voices in the world , and none of them is without meaning .
46014011	If then I don't know the meaning of the voice , I would be to him who speaks a foreigner , and he who speaks will be a foreigner to me .
46014012	So also you , since you are zealous for spiritual gifts , seek that you may abound to the building up of the assembly .
46014013	Therefore let him who speaks in another language pray that he may interpret .
46014014	For if I pray in another language , my spirit prays , but my understanding is unfruitful .
46014015	What is it then ? I will pray with the spirit , and I will pray with the understanding also . I will sing with the spirit , and I will sing with the understanding also .
46014016	Else if you bless with the spirit , how will he who fills the place of the unlearned say the " Amen " at your giving of thanks , seeing he doesn't know what you say ?
46014017	For you most assuredly give thanks well , but the other person is not built up .
46014018	I thank my God , I speak with other languages more than you all .
46014019	However in the assembly I would rather speak five words with my understanding , that I might instruct others also , than ten thousand words in another language .
46014020	Brothers , don't be children in mind , yet in malice be babies , but in mind be men .
46014021	In the law it is written , " By men of strange languages and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people . Not even thus will they hear me , says the Lord . "
46014022	Therefore other languages are for a sign , not to those who believe , but to the unbelieving ; but prophesying is for a sign , not to the unbelieving , but to those who believe .
46014023	If therefore the whole assembly is assembled together and all speak with other languages , and unlearned or unbelieving people come in , won't they say that you are crazy ?
46014024	But if all prophesy , and someone unbelieving or unlearned comes in , he is reproved by all , and he is judged by all .
46014025	And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed . So he will fall down on his face and worship God , declaring that God is among you indeed .
46014026	What is it then , brothers ? When you come together , each one of you has a psalm , has a teaching , has a revelation , has another language , has an interpretation . Let all things be done to build each other up .
46014027	If any man speaks in another language , let it be two , or at the most three , and in turn ; and let one interpret .
46014028	But if there is no interpreter , let him keep silence in the assembly , and let him speak to himself , and to God .
46014029	Let the prophets speak , two or three , and let the others discern .
46014030	But if a revelation is made to another sitting by , let the first keep silence .
46014031	For you all can prophesy one by one , that all may learn , and all may be exhorted .
46014032	The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets ,
46014033	for God is not a God of confusion , but of peace . As in all the assemblies of the saints ,
46014034	let your women keep silence in the assemblies , for it is not permitted for them to speak ; but let them be in subjection , as the Law also says .
46014035	If they desire to learn anything , let them ask their own husbands at home , for it is shameful for a woman to chatter in the assembly .
46014036	What ? Was it from you that the word of God went forth ? Or did it come to you alone ?
46014037	If any man thinks himself to be a prophet , or spiritual , let him recognize the things which I write to you , that they are the commandment of the Lord .
46014038	But if anyone is ignorant , let him be ignorant .
46014039	Therefore , brothers , desire earnestly to prophesy , and don't forbid speaking with other languages .
46014040	Let all things be done decently and in order .
46015001	Now I declare to you , brothers , the gospel which I preached to you , which also you received , in which you also stand ,
46015002	by which also you are saved , if you hold firmly the word which I preached to you - - unless you believed in vain .
46015003	For I delivered to you first of all that which also I received : that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures ,
46015004	that he was buried , that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures ,
46015005	and that he appeared to Cephas , then to the twelve .
46015006	Then he appeared to over five hundred brothers at once , most of whom remain until now , but some have also fallen asleep .
46015007	Then he appeared to James , then to all the apostles ,
46015008	and last of all , as to the child born at the wrong time , he appeared to me also .
46015009	For I am the least of the apostles , who is not worthy to be called an apostle , because I persecuted the assembly of God .
46015010	But by the grace of God I am what I am . His grace which was bestowed on me was not found vain , but I worked more than all of them ; yet not I , but the grace of God which was with me .
46015011	Whether then it is I or they , so we preach , and so you believed .
46015012	Now if Christ is preached , that he has been raised from the dead , how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead ?
46015013	But if there is no resurrection of the dead , neither has Christ been raised .
46015014	If Christ has not been raised , then our preaching is in vain , and your faith also is in vain .
46015015	Yes , we are found false witnesses of God , because we testified about God that he raised up Christ , whom he didn't raise up , if it is so that the dead are not raised .
46015016	For if the dead aren't raised , neither has Christ been raised .
46015017	If Christ has not been raised , your faith is vain ; you are still in your sins .
46015018	Then they also who are fallen asleep in Christ have perished .
46015019	If we have only hoped in Christ in this life , we are of all men most pitiable .
46015020	But now Christ has been raised from the dead . He became the first fruits of those who are asleep .
46015021	For since death came by man , the resurrection of the dead also came by man .
46015022	For as in Adam all die , so also in Christ all will be made alive .
46015023	But each in his own order : Christ the first fruits , then those who are Christ's , at his coming .
46015024	Then the end comes , when he will deliver up the kingdom to God , even the Father ; when he will have abolished all rule and all authority and power .
46015025	For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet .
46015026	The last enemy that will be abolished is death .
46015027	For , " He put all things in subjection under his feet . " But when he says , " All things are put in subjection , " it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him .
46015028	When all things have been subjected to him , then the Son will also himself be subjected to him who subjected all things to him , that God may be all in all .
46015029	Or else what will they do who are baptized for the dead ? If the dead aren't raised at all , why then are they baptized for the dead ?
46015030	Why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour ?
46015031	I die daily , by your boasting which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord .
46015032	If I fought with animals at Ephesus like men , what does it profit me ? If the dead are not raised , then " let us eat and drink , for tomorrow we die . "
46015033	Don't be deceived ! " Evil companionships corrupt good morals . "
46015034	Wake up righteously , and don't sin , for some have no knowledge of God . I say this to your shame .
46015035	But some one will say , " How are the dead raised ? " and , " With what kind of body do they come ? "
46015036	You foolish one , that which you yourself sow is not made alive unless it dies .
46015037	That which you sow , you don't sow the body that will be , but a bare grain , maybe of wheat , or of some other kind .
46015038	But God gives it a body even as it pleased him , and to each seed a body of its own .
46015039	All flesh is not the same flesh , but there is one flesh of men , another flesh of animals , another of fish , and another of birds .
46015040	There are also celestial bodies , and terrestrial bodies ; but the glory of the celestial differs from that of the terrestrial .
46015041	There is one glory of the sun , another glory of the moon , and another glory of the stars ; for one star differs from another star in glory .
46015042	So also is the resurrection of the dead . It is sown in corruption ; it is raised in incorruption .
46015043	It is sown in dishonor ; it is raised in glory . It is sown in weakness ; it is raised in power .
46015044	It is sown a natural body ; it is raised a spiritual body . If there is a natural body , there is also a spiritual body .
46015045	So also it is written , " The first man , Adam , became a living soul . " The last Adam became a life-giving spirit .
46015046	However that which is spiritual isn't first , but that which is natural , then that which is spiritual .
46015047	The first man is of the earth , made of dust . The second man is the Lord from heaven .
46015048	As is the one made of dust , such are those who are also made of dust ; and as is the heavenly , such are they also that are heavenly .
46015049	As we have borne the image of those made of dust , let's also bear the image of the heavenly .
46015050	Now I say this , brothers , that flesh and blood can't inherit the kingdom of God ; neither does corruption inherit incorruption .
46015051	Behold , I tell you a mystery . We will not all sleep , but we will all be changed ,
46015052	in a moment , in the twinkling of an eye , at the last trumpet . For the trumpet will sound , and the dead will be raised incorruptible , and we will be changed .
46015053	For this corruptible must put on incorruption , and this mortal must put on immortality .
46015054	But when this corruptible will have put on incorruption , and this mortal will have put on immortality , then what is written will happen : " Death is swallowed up in victory . "
46015055	" Death , where is your sting ? Hades , where is your victory ? "
46015056	The sting of death is sin , and the power of sin is the law .
46015057	But thanks be to God , who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ .
46015058	Therefore , my beloved brothers , be steadfast , immovable , always abounding in the Lord's work , because you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord .
46016001	Now concerning the collection for the saints , as I commanded the assemblies of Galatia , you do likewise .
46016002	On the first day of the week , let each one of you save , as he may prosper , that no collections be made when I come .
46016003	When I arrive , I will send whoever you approve with letters to carry your gracious gift to Jerusalem .
46016004	If it is appropriate for me to go also , they will go with me .
46016005	But I will come to you when I have passed through Macedonia , for I am passing through Macedonia .
46016006	But with you it may be that I will stay , or even winter , that you may send me on my journey wherever I go .
46016007	For I do not wish to see you now in passing , but I hope to stay a while with you , if the Lord permits .
46016008	But I will stay at Ephesus until Pentecost ,
46016009	for a great and effective door has opened to me , and there are many adversaries .
46016010	Now if Timothy comes , see that he is with you without fear , for he does the work of the Lord , as I also do .
46016011	Therefore let no one despise him . But set him forward on his journey in peace , that he may come to me ; for I expect him with the brothers .
46016012	But concerning Apollos , the brother , I begged him much to come to you with the brothers ; and it was not all his desire to come now ; but he will come when he has an opportunity .
46016013	Watch ! Stand firm in the faith ! Be men ! Be strong !
46016014	Let all that you do be done in love .
46016015	Now I beg you , brothers ( you know the house of Stephanas , that it is the first fruits of Achaia , and that they have set themselves to minister to the saints ) ,
46016016	that you also be in subjection to such , and to everyone who helps in the work and labors .
46016017	I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas , Fortunatus , and Achaicus ; for that which was lacking on your part , they supplied .
46016018	For they refreshed my spirit and yours . Therefore acknowledge those who are like that .
46016019	The assemblies of Asia greet you . Aquila and Priscilla greet you much in the Lord , together with the assembly that is in their house .
46016020	All the brothers greet you . Greet one another with a holy kiss .
46016021	This greeting is by me , Paul , with my own hand .
46016022	If any man doesn't love the Lord Jesus Christ , let him be accursed . Come , Lord !
46016023	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
46016024	My love to all of you in Christ Jesus . Amen .
47001001	Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God , and Timothy our brother , to the assembly of God which is at Corinth , with all the saints who are in the whole of Achaia :
47001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
47001003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of mercies and God of all comfort ;
47001004	who comforts us in all our affliction , that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction , through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God .
47001005	For as the sufferings of Christ abound to us , even so our comfort also abounds through Christ .
47001006	But if we are afflicted , it is for your comfort and salvation . If we are comforted , it is for your comfort , which works in the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer .
47001007	Our hope for you is steadfast , knowing that , since you are partakers of the sufferings , so also are you of the comfort .
47001008	For we don't desire to have you uninformed , brothers , concerning our affliction which happened to us in Asia , that we were weighed down exceedingly , beyond our power , so much that we despaired even of life .
47001009	Yes , we ourselves have had the sentence of death within ourselves , that we should not trust in ourselves , but in God who raises the dead ,
47001010	who delivered us out of so great a death , and does deliver ; on whom we have set our hope that he will also still deliver us ;
47001011	you also helping together on our behalf by your supplication ; that , for the gift bestowed on us by means of many , thanks may be given by many persons on your behalf .
47001012	For our boasting is this : the testimony of our conscience , that in holiness and sincerity of God , not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God we behaved ourselves in the world , and more abundantly toward you .
47001013	For we write no other things to you , than what you read or even acknowledge , and I hope you will acknowledge to the end ;
47001014	as also you acknowledged us in part , that we are your boasting , even as you also are ours , in the day of our Lord Jesus .
47001015	In this confidence , I was determined to come first to you , that you might have a second benefit ;
47001016	and by you to pass into Macedonia , and again from Macedonia to come to you , and to be sent forward by you on my journey to Judea .
47001017	When I therefore was thus determined , did I show fickleness ? Or the things that I purpose , do I purpose according to the flesh , that with me there should be the " Yes , yes " and the " No , no ? "
47001018	But as God is faithful , our word toward you was not " Yes and no . "
47001019	For the Son of God , Jesus Christ , who was preached among you by us , by me , Silvanus , and Timothy , was not " Yes and no , " but in him is " Yes . "
47001020	For however many are the promises of God , in him is the " Yes . " Therefore also through him is the " Amen , " to the glory of God through us .
47001021	Now he who establishes us with you in Christ , and anointed us , is God ;
47001022	who also sealed us , and gave us the down payment of the Spirit in our hearts .
47001023	But I call God for a witness to my soul , that I didn't come to Corinth to spare you .
47001024	Not that we have lordship over your faith , but are fellow workers with you for your joy . For you stand firm in faith .
47002001	But I determined this for myself , that I would not come to you again in sorrow .
47002002	For if I make you sorry , then who will make me glad but he who is made sorry by me ?
47002003	And I wrote this very thing to you , so that , when I came , I wouldn't have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice ; having confidence in you all , that my joy is of you all .
47002004	For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears , not that you should be made sorry , but that you might know the love that I have so abundantly for you .
47002005	But if any has caused sorrow , he has caused sorrow , not to me , but in part ( that I not press too heavily ) to you all .
47002006	Sufficient to such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many ;
47002007	so that on the contrary you should rather forgive him and comfort him , lest by any means such a one should be swallowed up with his excessive sorrow .
47002008	Therefore I beg you to confirm your love toward him .
47002009	For to this end I also wrote , that I might know the proof of you , whether you are obedient in all things .
47002010	Now I also forgive whomever you forgive anything . For if indeed I have forgiven anything , I have forgiven that one for your sakes in the presence of Christ ,
47002011	that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan ; for we are not ignorant of his schemes .
47002012	Now when I came to Troas for the gospel of Christ , and when a door was opened to me in the Lord ,
47002013	I had no relief for my spirit , because I didn't find Titus , my brother , but taking my leave of them , I went forth into Macedonia .
47002014	But thanks be to God , who always leads us in triumph in Christ , and reveals through us the sweet aroma of his knowledge in every place .
47002015	For we are a sweet aroma of Christ to God , in those who are saved , and in those who perish ;
47002016	to the one a stench from death to death ; to the other a sweet aroma from life to life . Who is sufficient for these things ?
47002017	For we are not as so many , peddling the word of God . But as of sincerity , but as of God , in the sight of God , we speak in Christ .
47003001	Are we beginning again to commend ourselves ? Or do we need , as do some , letters of commendation to you or from you ?
47003002	You are our letter , written in our hearts , known and read by all men ;
47003003	being revealed that you are a letter of Christ , ministered by us , written not with ink , but with the Spirit of the living God ; not in tablets of stone , but in tablets that are hearts of flesh .
47003004	Such confidence we have through Christ toward God ;
47003005	not that we are sufficient of ourselves , to account anything as from ourselves ; but our sufficiency is from God ;
47003006	who also made us sufficient as servants of a new covenant ; not of the letter , but of the spirit . For the letter kills , but the spirit gives life .
47003007	But if the service of death , written engraved on stones , came with glory , so that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly on the face of Moses for the glory of his face ; which was passing away :
47003008	won't rather service of the spirit be rather with more glory ?
47003009	For if the service of condemnation has glory , much rather does the service of righteousness exceed in glory .
47003010	For most assuredly that which has been made glorious has not been made glorious in this respect , by reason of the glory that surpasses .
47003011	For if that which passes away was with glory , much more that which remains is in glory .
47003012	Having therefore such a hope , we use great boldness of speech ,
47003013	and not as Moses , who put a veil on his face , that the children of Israel wouldn't look steadfastly on the end of that which was passing away .
47003014	But their minds were hardened , for until this very day at the reading of the old covenant the same veil remains , because in Christ in passes away .
47003015	But to this day , when Moses is read , a veil lies on their heart .
47003016	But whenever one turns to the Lord , the veil is taken away .
47003017	Now the Lord is the Spirita and where the Spirit of the Lord is , there is liberty .
47003018	But we all , with unveiled face beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord , are transformed into the same image from glory to glory , even as from the Lord , the Spirit .
47004001	Therefore seeing we have this ministry , even as we obtained mercy , we don't faint .
47004002	But we have renounced the hidden things of shame , not walking in craftiness , nor handling the word of God deceitfully ; but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God .
47004003	Even if our gospel is veiled , it is veiled in those who perish ;
47004004	in whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelieving , that the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ , who is the image of God , should not dawn on them .
47004005	For we don't preach ourselves , but Christ Jesus as Lord , and ourselves as your servants for Jesus ' sake .
47004006	Seeing it is God who said , " Light will shine out of darkness , " who shined in our hearts , to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ .
47004007	But we have this treasure in earthen vessels , that the exceeding greatness of the power may be of God , and not from ourselves .
47004008	We are pressed on every side , yet not crushed ; perplexed , yet not to despair ;
47004009	pursued , yet not forsaken ; struck down , yet not destroyed ;
47004010	always carrying in the body the putting to death of the Lord Jesus , that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body .
47004011	For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus ' sake , that the life also of Jesus may be revealed in our mortal flesh .
47004012	So then death works in us , but life in you .
47004013	But having the same spirit of faith , according to that which is written , " I believed , and therefore I spoke . " We also believe , and therefore also we speak ;
47004014	knowing that he who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus , and will present us with you .
47004015	For all things are for your sakes , that the grace , being multiplied through the many , may cause the thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God .
47004016	Therefore we don't faint , but though our outward man is decaying , yet our inward man is renewed day by day .
47004017	For our light affliction , which is for the moment , works for us more and more exceedingly an eternal weight of glory ;
47004018	while we don't look at the things which are seen , but at the things which are not seen . For the things which are seen are temporal , but the things which are not seen are eternal .
47005001	For we know that if the earthly house of our tent is dissolved , we have a building from God , a house not made with hands , eternal , in the heavens .
47005002	For most assuredly in this we groan , longing to be clothed with our habitation which is from heaven ;
47005003	if so be that being clothed we will not be found naked .
47005004	For indeed we who are in this tent do groan , being burdened ; not that we desire to be unclothed , but that we desire to be clothed , that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life .
47005005	Now he who made us for this very thing is God , who also gave to us the down payment of the Spirit .
47005006	Being therefore always of good courage , and knowing that , while we are at home in the body , we are absent from the Lord ;
47005007	for we walk by faith , not by sight .
47005008	We are of good courage , I say , and are willing rather to be absent from the body , and to be at home with the Lord .
47005009	Therefore also we make it our aim , whether at home or absent , to be well pleasing to him .
47005010	For we must all be revealed before the judgment seat of Christ ; that each one may receive the things in the body , according to what he has done , whether good or bad .
47005011	Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord , we persuade men , but we are revealed to God ; and I hope that we are revealed also in your consciences .
47005012	For we are not commending ourselves to you again , but speak as giving you occasion of boasting on our behalf , that you may have something to answer those who boast in appearance , and not in heart .
47005013	For if we are beside ourselves , it is for God . Or if we are of sober mind , it is for you .
47005014	For the love of Christ constrains us ; because we judge thus , that one died for all , therefore all died .
47005015	He died for all , that those who live should no longer live to themselves , but to him who for their sakes died and rose again .
47005016	Therefore we know no one after the flesh from now on . Even though we have known Christ after the flesh , yet now we know him so no more .
47005017	Therefore if anyone is in Christ , he is a new creation . The old things have passed away . Behold , they have become new .
47005018	But all things are of God , who reconciled us to himself through Jesus Christ , and gave to us the ministry of reconciliation ;
47005019	namely , that God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself , not reckoning to them their trespasses , and having committed to us the word of reconciliation .
47005020	We are therefore ambassadors on behalf of Christ , as though God were entreating by us . We beg you on behalf of Christ , be reconciled to God .
47005021	For him who knew no sin he made to be sin on our behalf ; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God .
47006001	Working together , we entreat also that you not receive the grace of God in vain ,
47006002	for he says , " At an acceptable time I listened to you , In a day of salvation I helped you . " Behold , now is the acceptable time . Behold , now is the day of salvation .
47006003	We give no occasion of stumbling in anything , that our service may not be blamed ,
47006004	but in everything commending ourselves , as servants of God , in great endurance , in afflictions , in hardships , in distresses ,
47006005	in beatings , in imprisonments , in riots , in labors , in watchings , in fastings ;
47006006	in pureness , in knowledge , in patience , in kindness , in the Holy Spirit , in sincere love ,
47006007	in the word of truth , in the power of God ; by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left ,
