47006008	by glory and dishonor , by evil report and good report ; as deceivers , and yet true ;
47006009	as unknown , and yet well known ; as dying , and behold , we live ; as punished , and not killed ;
47006010	as sorrowful , yet always rejoicing ; as poor , yet making many rich ; as having nothing , and yet possessing all things .
47006011	Our mouth is open to you , Corinthians . Our heart is enlarged .
47006012	You are not restricted by us , but you are restricted by your own affections .
47006013	Now in return , I speak as to my children , you also be enlarged .
47006014	Don't be unequally yoked with unbelievers , for what fellowship have righteousness and iniquity ? Or what communion has light with darkness ?
47006015	What agreement has Christ with Belial ? Or what portion has a believer with an unbeliever ?
47006016	What agreement has a temple of God with idols ? For you are a temple of the living God . Even as God said , " I will dwell in them , and walk in them ; and I will be their God , and they will be my people . "
47006017	Therefore , " ' Come out from among them , And be separate , ' says the Lord , ' Touch no unclean thing . I will receive you .
47006018	I will be to you a Father . You will be to me sons and daughters , ' says the Lord Almighty . "
47007001	Having therefore these promises , beloved , let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of flesh and spirit , perfecting holiness in the fear of God .
47007002	Open your hearts to us . We wronged no one . We corrupted no one . We took advantage of no one .
47007003	I say this not to condemn you , for I have said before , that you are in our hearts to die together and live together .
47007004	Great is my boldness of speech toward you . Great is my boasting on your behalf . I am filled with comfort . I overflow with joy in all our affliction .
47007005	For even when we had come into Macedonia , our flesh had no relief , but we were afflicted on every side . Fightings were outside . Fear was inside .
47007006	Nevertheless , he who comforts the lowly , God , comforted us by the coming of Titus ;
47007007	and not by his coming only , but also by the comfort with which he was comforted in you , while he told us your longing , your mourning , and your zeal for me ; so that I rejoiced still more .
47007008	For though I made you sorry with my letter , I do not regret it , though I did regret it . For I see that my letter made you sorry , though just for a while .
47007009	I now rejoice , not that you were made sorry , but that you were made sorry to repentance . For you were made sorry in a Godly way , that you might suffer loss by us in nothing .
47007010	For Godly sorrow works repentance to salvation , which brings no regret . But the sorrow of the world works death .
47007011	For behold , this same thing , that you were made sorry in a godly way , what earnest care it worked in you . Yes , what defense , indignation , fear , longing , zeal , and vengeance ! In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be pure in the matter .
47007012	So although I wrote to you , I wrote not for his cause that did the wrong , nor for his cause that suffered the wrong , but that your earnest care for us might be revealed in you in the sight of God .
47007013	Therefore we have been comforted . In our comfort we rejoiced the more exceedingly for the joy of Titus , because his spirit has been refreshed by you all .
47007014	For if in anything I have boasted to him on your behalf , I was not put to shame . But as we spoke all things to you in truth , so our glorying also which I made before Titus was found to be truth .
47007015	His affection is more abundantly toward you , while he remembers all of your obedience , how with fear and trembling you received him .
47007016	I rejoice that in everything I am of good courage concerning you .
47008001	Moreover , brothers , we make known to you the grace of God which has been given in the assemblies of Macedonia ;
47008002	how that in much proof of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded to the riches of their liberality .
47008003	For according to their power , I testify , yes and beyond their power , they gave of their own accord ,
47008004	begging us with much entreaty in regard to this grace and the fellowship in the service to the saints .
47008005	This was not as we had hoped , but first they gave their own selves to the Lord , and to us through the will of God .
47008006	Insomuch that we exhorted Titus , that as he made a beginning before , so he would also complete in you this grace .
47008007	But as you abound in everything , in faith , utterance , knowledge , all earnestness , and in your love to us , see that you also abound in this grace .
47008008	I speak not by way of commandment , but as proving through the earnestness of others the sincerity also of your love .
47008009	For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ , that , though he was rich , yet for your sakes he became poor , that you through his poverty might become rich .
47008010	I give a judgment in this : for this is expedient for you , who were the first to start a year ago , not only to do , but also to be willing .
47008011	But now complete the doing also , that as there was the readiness to be willing , so there may be the completion also out of your ability .
47008012	For if the readiness is there , it is acceptable according to what you have , not according to what you don't have .
47008013	For this is not that others may be eased and you distressed ,
47008014	but for equality . Your abundance at this present time supplies their lack , that their abundance also may become a supply for your lack ; that there may be equality .
47008015	As it is written , " He who gathered much had nothing left over , and he who gathered little had no lack . "
47008016	But thanks be to God , who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus .
47008017	For he indeed accepted our exhortation , but being himself very earnest , he went forth to you of his own accord .
47008018	We have sent together with him the brother whose praise in the gospel is known through all the assemblies .
47008019	Not only so , but who was also appointed by the assemblies to travel with us in this grace , which is served by us to the glory of the Lord himself , and to show our readiness .
47008020	We are avoiding this , that any man should blame us in concerning this bounty which is served by us .
47008021	Having regard for honorable things , not only in the sight of the Lord , but also in the sight of men .
47008022	We have sent with them our brother , whom we have many times proved earnest in many things , but now much more earnest , by reason of the great confidence which he has in you .
47008023	As for Titus , he is my partner and fellow worker toward you . As for our brothers , they are the messengers of the assemblies , the glory of Christ .
47008024	Therefore show the proof of your love to them in front of the assemblies , and of our boasting on your behalf .
47009001	It is indeed unnecessary for me to write to you concerning the service to the saints ,
47009002	for I know your readiness , of which I boast on your behalf to them of Macedonia , that Achaia has been prepared for a year past . Your zeal has stirred up very many of them .
47009003	But I have sent the brothers , that our glorying on your behalf may not be made void in this respect , that , even as I said , you may be prepared ,
47009004	so that I won't by any means , if there come with me any of Macedonia and find you unprepared , we ( to say nothing of you ) should be put to shame in this confident boasting .
47009005	I thought it necessary therefore to entreat the brothers that they would go before to you , and arrange ahead of time the generous gift that you promised before , that the same might be ready as a matter of generosity , and not of greediness .
47009006	Remember this : he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly . He who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully .
47009007	Let each man give according as he has determined in his heart ; not grudgingly , or under compulsion ; for God loves a cheerful giver .
47009008	God is able to make all grace abound to you , that you , always having all sufficiency in everything , may abound to every good work .
47009009	As it is written , " He has scattered abroad , he has given to the poor . His righteousness remains forever . "
47009010	Now may he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food , supply and multiply your seed for sowing , and increase the fruits of your righteousness ;
47009011	you being enriched in everything to all liberality , which works through us thanksgiving to God .
47009012	For this service of giving that you perform not only makes up for lack among the saints , but abounds also through many givings of thanks to God ;
47009013	seeing that through the proof given by this service , they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the gospel of Christ , and for the liberality of your contribution to them and to all ;
47009014	while they themselves also , with supplication on your behalf , yearn for you by reason of the exceeding grace of God in you .
47009015	Thanks be to God for his unspeakable gift !
47010001	Now I Paul , myself , entreat you by the humility and gentleness of Christ ; I who in your presence am lowly among you , but being absent am of good courage toward you .
47010002	Yes , I beg you , that I may not , when present , show courage with the confidence with which I count to be bold against some , who count of us as if we walked according to the flesh .
47010003	For though we walk in the flesh , we don't wage war according to the flesh ;
47010004	for the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh , but mighty before God to the throwing down of strongholds ,
47010005	throwing down imaginations and every high thing that is exalted against the knowledge of God , and bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ ;
47010006	and being in readiness to avenge all disobedience , when your obedience will be made full .
47010007	Do you look at things only as they appear in front of your face ? If anyone trusts in himself that he is Christ's , let him consider this again with himself , that , even as he is Christ's , so also we are Christ's .
47010008	For though I should boast somewhat abundantly concerning our authority , ( which the Lord gave for building you up , and not for casting you down ) I will not be put to shame ,
47010009	that I may not seem as if I desire to terrify you by my letters .
47010010	For , " His letters , " they say , " are weighty and strong , but his bodily presence is weak , and his speech is despised .
47010011	Let such a person consider this , that what we are in word by letters when we are absent , such are we also in deed when we are present .
47010012	For we are not bold to number or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves . But they themselves , measuring themselves by themselves , and comparing themselves with themselves , are without understanding .
47010013	But we will not boast beyond proper limits , but within the boundaries with which God appointed to us , which reach even to you .
47010014	For we don't stretch ourselves too much , as though we didn't reach to you . For we came even as far as to you in the gospel of Christ ,
47010015	not boasting beyond proper limits in other men's labors , but having hope that as your faith grows , we will be magnified in you according to our boundaries to abundance ,
47010016	so as to preach the gospel even to the parts beyond you , not to boast in what someone else has already done .
47010017	But " he who boasts , let him boast in the Lord . "
47010018	For it isn't he who commends himself who is approved , but whom the Lord commends .
47011001	I wish that you would bear with me in a little foolishness , but indeed you do bear with me .
47011002	For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy . For I married you to one husband , that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ .
47011003	But I am afraid that by any means , as the serpent deceived Eve in his craftiness , your minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is toward Christ .
47011004	For if he who comes preaches another Jesus , whom we did not preach , or if you receive a different spirit , which you did not receive , or a different gospel , which you did not accept , you put up with that well enough .
47011005	For I reckon that I am not at all behind the very best apostles .
47011006	But though I am unskilled in speech , yet I am not unskilled in knowledge . No , in every way we have been revealed to you in all things .
47011007	Or did I commit a sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted , because I preached to you God's gospel for nothing ?
47011008	I robbed other assemblies , taking wages from them that I might serve you .
47011009	When I was present with you and was in need , I wasn't a burden on anyone , for the brothers , when they came from Macedonia , supplied the measure of my need . In everything I kept myself from being burdensome to you , and I will continue to do so .
47011010	As the truth of Christ is in me , no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia .
47011011	Why ? Because I don't love you ? God knows .
47011012	But what I do , that I will do , that I may cut off occasion from them that desire an occasion , that in which they boast , they may be found even as we .
47011013	For such men are false apostles , deceitful workers , masquerading as Christ's apostles .
47011014	No wonder , for even Satan masquerades as an angel of light .
47011015	It is no great thing therefore if his ministers also masquerade as servants of righteousness , whose end will be according to their works .
47011016	I say again , let no one think me foolish . But if so , yet receive me as foolish , that I also may boast a little .
47011017	That which I speak , I don't speak after the Lord , but as in foolishness , in this confidence of boasting .
47011018	Seeing that many boast after the flesh , I will also boast .
47011019	For you bear with the foolish gladly , being wise .
47011020	For you bear with a man , if he brings you into bondage , if he devours you , if he takes you captive , if he exalts himself , if he strikes you on the face .
47011021	I speak by way of disparagement , as though we had been weak . Yet however any is bold ( I speak in foolishness ) , I am bold also .
47011022	Are they Hebrews ? So am I . Are they Israelites ? So am I . Are they the seed of Abraham ? So am I .
47011023	Are they servants of Christ ? ( I speak as one beside himself ) I am more so ; in labors more abundantly , in prisons more abundantly , in stripes above measure , in deaths often .
47011024	Five times from the Jews I received forty stripes minus one .
47011025	Three times I was beaten with rods . Once I was stoned . Three times I suffered shipwreck . I have been a night and a day in the deep .
47011026	I have been in travels often , perils of rivers , perils of robbers , perils from my countrymen , perils from the Gentiles , perils in the city , perils in the wilderness , perils in the sea , perils among false brothers ;
47011027	labor and travail , in watchings often , in hunger and thirst , in fastings often , and in cold and nakedness .
47011028	Besides those things that are outside , there is that which presses on me daily , anxiety for all the assemblies .
47011029	Who is weak , and I am not weak ? Who is caused to stumble , and I don't burn ?
47011030	If I must boast , I will boast of the things that concern my weakness .
47011031	The God and Father of the Lord Jesus , he who is blessed forevermore , knows that I don't lie .
47011032	In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king guarded the city of the Damascenes in order to take me .
47011033	Through a window I was let down in a basket by the wall , and escaped his hands .
47012001	It is doubtless not profitable for me to boast . I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord .
47012002	I know a man in Christ , fourteen years ago ( whether in the body , I don't know , or whether out of the body , I don't know ; God knows ) , such a one caught up into the third heaven .
47012003	I know such a man ( whether in the body , or apart from the body , I don't know ; God knows ) ,
47012004	how he was caught up into Paradise , and heard unspeakable words , which it is not lawful for a man to utter .
47012005	On behalf of such a one I will boast , but on my own behalf I will not boast , except in my weaknesses .
47012006	For if I would desire to boast , I will not be foolish ; for I will speak the truth . But I forbear , so that no man may account of me above that which he sees in me , or hears from me .
47012007	By reason of the exceeding greatness of the revelations , that I should not be exalted excessively , there was given to me a thorn in the flesh , a messenger of Satan to buffet me , that I should not be exalted excessively .
47012008	Concerning this thing , I begged the Lord three times that it might depart from me .
47012009	He has said to me , " My grace is sufficient for you , for my power is made perfect in weakness . " Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my weaknesses , that the power of Christ may rest on me .
47012010	Therefore I take pleasure in weaknesses , in injuries , in necessities , in persecutions , in distresses , for Christ's sake . For when I am weak , then am I strong .
47012011	I have become foolish . You compelled me , for I ought to have been commended by you , for in nothing was I behind the very best apostles , though I am nothing .
47012012	Truly the signs of an apostle were worked among you in all patience , by signs and wonders and mighty works .
47012013	For what is there in which you were made inferior to the rest of the assemblies , unless it is that I myself was not a burden to you ? Forgive me this wrong .
47012014	Behold , this is the third time I am ready to come to you , and I will not be a burden to you ; for I seek not your possessions , but you . For the children ought not to save up for the parents , but the parents for the children .
47012015	I will most gladly spend and be spent for your souls . If I love you more abundantly , am I loved the less ?
47012016	But be it so , I did not myself burden you . But , being crafty , I caught you with deception .
47012017	Did I take advantage of you by anyone of them whom I have sent to you ?
47012018	I exhorted Titus , and I sent the brother with him . Did Titus take any advantage of you ? Didn't we walk in the same spirit ? Didn't we walk in the same steps ?
47012019	Again , do you think that we are excusing ourselves to you ? In the sight of God we speak in Christ . But all things , beloved , are for your edifying .
47012020	For I am afraid that by any means , when I come , I might find you not the way I want to , and that I might be found by you as you don't desire ; that by any means there would be strife , jealousy , outbursts of anger , factions , slander , whisperings , proud thoughts , riots ;
47012021	that again when I come my God would humble me before you , and I would mourn for many of those who have sinned before now , and not repented of the uncleanness and sexual immorality and lustfulness which they committed .
47013001	This is the third time I am coming to you . " At the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word established . "
47013002	I have said beforehand , and I do say beforehand , as when I was present the second time , so now , being absent , I write to those who have sinned before now , and to all the rest , that , if I come again , I will not spare ;
47013003	seeing that you seek a proof of Christ that speaks in me ; who toward you is not weak , but is powerful in you .
47013004	For he was crucified through weakness , yet he lives through the power of God . For we also are weak in him , but we will live with him through the power of God toward you .
47013005	Test your own selves , whether you are in the faith . Test your own selves . Or don't you know as to your own selves , that Jesus Christ is in you ? Unless indeed you are reprobate .
47013006	But I hope that you will know that we aren't reprobate .
47013007	Now I pray to God that you do no evil ; not that we may appear approved , but that you may do that which is honorable , though we are as reprobate .
47013008	For we can do nothing against the truth , but for the truth .
47013009	For we rejoice when we are weak and you are strong . This we also pray for , even your perfecting .
47013010	For this cause I write these things while absent , that I may not deal sharply when present , according to the authority which the Lord gave me for building up , and not for tearing down .
47013011	Finally , brothers , rejoice . Be perfected , be comforted , be of the same mind , live in peace , and the God of love and peace will be with you .
47013012	Greet one another with a holy kiss .
47013013	All the saints greet you .
47013014	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ , the love of God , and the communion of the Holy Spirit , be with you all .
48001001	Paul , an apostle ( not from men , neither through man , but through Jesus Christ , and God the Father , who raised him from the dead ) ,
48001002	and all the brothers who are with me , to the assemblies of Galatia :
48001003	Grace to you and peace from God the Father , and our Lord Jesus Christ ,
48001004	who gave himself for our sins , that he might deliver us out of this present evil age , according to the will of our God and Father - -
48001005	to whom be the glory forever and ever . Amen .
48001006	I marvel that you are so quickly deserting him who called you in the grace of Christ to a different gospel ;
48001007	and there isn't another gospel . Only there are some who trouble you , and want to pervert the gospel of Christ .
48001008	But even though we , or an angel from heaven , should preach to you any gospel other than that which we preached to you , let him be cursed .
48001009	As we have said before , so I now say again : if any man preaches to you any gospel other than that which you received , let him be cursed .
48001010	For am I now seeking the favor of men , or of God ? Or am I striving to please men ? For if I were still pleasing men , I wouldn't be a servant of Christ .
48001011	But I make known to you , brothers , concerning the gospel which was preached by me , that it is not according to man .
48001012	For neither did I receive it from man , nor was I taught it , but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ .
48001013	For you have heard of my way of living in time past in the Jews ' religion , how that beyond measure I persecuted the assembly of God , and ravaged it .
48001014	I advanced in the Jews ' religion beyond many of my own age among my countrymen , being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers .
48001015	But when it was the good pleasure of God , who separated me from my mother's womb , and called me through his grace ,
48001016	to reveal his Son in me , that I might preach him among the Gentiles , I didn't immediately confer with flesh and blood ,
48001017	nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me , but I went away into Arabia . Then I returned to Damascus .
48001018	Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter , and stayed with him fifteen days .
48001019	But of the other apostles I saw no one , except James , the Lord's brother .
48001020	Now about the things which I write to you , behold , before God , I'm not lying .
48001021	Then I came to the regions of Syria and Cilicia .
48001022	I was still unknown by face to the assemblies of Judea which were in Christ ,
48001023	but they only heard : " He who once persecuted us now preaches the faith that he once tried to destroy . "
48001024	They glorified God in me .
48002001	Then after a period of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas , taking Titus also with me .
48002002	I went up by revelation , and I laid before them the gospel which I preach among the Gentiles , but privately before those who were respected , for fear that I might be running , or had run , in vain .
48002003	But not even Titus , who was with me , being a Greek , was compelled to be circumcised .
48002004	This was because of the false brothers secretly brought in , who stole in to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus , that they might bring us into bondage ;
48002005	to whom we gave no place in the way of subjection , not for an hour , that the truth of the gospel might continue with you .
48002006	But from those who were reputed to be important ( whatever they were , it makes no difference to me ; God doesn't show partiality to man ) - - they , I say , who were respected imparted nothing to me ,
48002007	but to the contrary , when they saw that I had been entrusted with the gospel for the uncircumcision , even as Peter with the gospel for the circumcision
48002008	( for he who appointed Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision appointed me also to the Gentiles ) ;
48002009	and when they perceived the grace that was given to me , James and Cephas and John , they who were reputed to be pillars , gave to me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship , that we should go to the Gentiles , and they to the circumcision .
48002010	They only asked us to remember the poor - - which very thing I was also zealous to do .
48002011	But when Peter came to Antioch , I resisted him to the face , because he stood condemned .
48002012	For before some people came from James , he ate with the Gentiles . But when they came , he drew back and separated himself , fearing those who were of the circumcision .
48002013	The rest of the Jews joined him in his hypocrisy ; so much that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy .
48002014	But when I saw that they didn't walk uprightly according to the truth of the gospel , I said to Cephas before them all , " If you , being a Jew , live as the Gentiles do , and not as the Jews do , why do you compel the Gentiles to live as the Jews do ?
48002015	" We , being Jews by nature , and not Gentile sinners ,
48002016	yet knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but through the faith of Jesus Christ , even we believed in Christ Jesus , that we might be justified by faith in Christ , and not by the works of the law , because no flesh will be justified by the works of the law .
48002017	But if , while we sought to be justified in Christ , we ourselves also were found sinners , is Christ a servant of sin ? God forbid !
48002018	For if I build up again those things which I destroyed , I prove myself a law-breaker .
48002019	For I , through the law , died to the law , that I might live to God .
48002020	I have been crucified with Christ , and it is no longer I that live , but Christ living in me . That life which I now live in the flesh , I live by faith in the Son of God , who loved me , and gave himself up for me .
48002021	I don't make void the grace of God . For if righteousness is through the law , then Christ died for nothing ! "
48003001	Foolish Galatians , who has bewitched you not to obey the truth , before whose eyes Jesus Christ was openly set forth among you as crucified ?
48003002	I just want to learn this from you . Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law , or by hearing of faith ?
48003003	Are you so foolish ? Having begun in the Spirit , are you now completed in the flesh ?
48003004	Did you suffer so many things in vain , if it is indeed in vain ?
48003005	He therefore that supplies the Spirit to you , and works miracles among you , does he do it by the works of the law , or by hearing of faith ?
48003006	Even as Abraham " believed God , and it was counted to him for righteousness . "
48003007	Know therefore that those who are of faith , the same are sons of Abraham .
48003008	The scripture , foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith , preached the gospel beforehand to Abraham , saying , " In you will all the nations be blessed . "
48003009	So then , those who are of faith are blessed with the faithful Abraham .
48003010	For as many as are of the works of the law are under a curse . For it is written , " Cursed is everyone who doesn't continue in all things that are written in the book of the law , to do them . "
48003011	Now that no man is justified by the law before God is evident , for , " The righteous will live by faith . "
48003012	The law is not of faith , but , " He that does them will live in them . "
48003013	Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law , having become a curse for us . For it is written , " Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree , "
48003014	that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Jesus ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith .
48003015	Brothers , I speak like men . Though it is only a man's covenant , yet when it has been confirmed , no one makes it void , or adds to it .
48003016	Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his seed . He doesn't say , " To seeds , " as of many , but as of one , " To your seed , " which is Christ .
48003017	Now I say this . A covenant confirmed beforehand by God in Christ , the law , which came four hundred and thirty years after , does not annul , so as to make the promise of no effect .
48003018	For if the inheritance is of the law , it is no more of promise ; but God has granted it to Abraham by promise .
48003019	What then is the law ? It was added because of transgressions , until the seed should come to whom the promise has been made . It was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator .
48003020	Now a mediator is not between one , but God is one .
48003021	Is the law then against the promises of God ? Certainly not ! For if there had been a law given which could make alive , most assuredly righteousness would have been of the law .
48003022	But the scriptures shut up all things under sin , that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe .
48003023	But before faith came , we were kept in custody under the law , shut up to the faith which should afterwards be revealed .
48003024	So that the law has become our tutor to bring us to Christ , that we might be justified by faith .
48003025	But now that faith is come , we are no longer under a tutor .
48003026	For you are all sons of God , through faith in Christ Jesus .
48003027	For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ .
48003028	There is neither Jew nor Greek , there is neither slave nor free man , there is neither male nor female ; for you are all one in Christ Jesus .
48003029	If you are Christ's , then you are Abraham's seed , heirs according to promise .
48004001	But I say that so long as the heir is a child , he is no different from a bondservant , though he is lord of all ;
48004002	but is under guardians and stewards until the day appointed by the father .
48004003	So we also , when we were children , were held in bondage under the elements of the world .
48004004	But when the fullness of the time came , God sent forth his Son , born to a woman , born under the law ,
48004005	that he might redeem those who were under the law , that we might receive the adoption of sons .
48004006	Because you are sons , God sent forth the Spirit of his Son into our hearts , crying , " Abba ! Father ! "
48004007	So you are no longer a bondservant , but a son ; and if a son , then an heir of God through Christ .
48004008	However at that time , not knowing God , you were in bondage to those who by nature are no gods .
48004009	But now that you have come to know God , or rather to be known by God , why do you turn back again to the weak and miserable elements , to which you desire to be in bondage all over again ?
48004010	You observe days , months , seasons , and years .
48004011	I am afraid for you , that I might have wasted my labor for you .
48004012	I beg you , brothers , become as I am , for I also have become as you are . You did me no wrong ,
48004013	but you know that because of weakness of the flesh I preached the gospel to you the first time .
48004014	That which was a temptation to you in my flesh , you didn't despise nor reject ; but you received me as an angel of God , even as Christ Jesus .
48004015	What has become of the blessing you enjoyed ? For I testify to you that , if possible , you would have plucked out your eyes and given them to me .
48004016	So then , have I become your enemy by telling you the truth ?
48004017	They zealously seek you in no good way . No , they desire to alienate you , that you may seek them .
48004018	But it is always good to be zealous in a good cause , and not only when I am present with you .
48004019	My little children , of whom I am again in travail until Christ is formed in you - -
48004020	but I could wish to be present with you now , and to change my tone , for I am perplexed about you .
48004021	Tell me , you that desire to be under the law , don't you listen to the law ?
48004022	For it is written that Abraham had two sons , one by the handmaid , and one by the free woman .
48004023	However , the son by the handmaid was born according to the flesh , but the son by the free woman was born through promise .
48004024	These things contain an allegory , for these are two covenants . One is from Mount Sinai , bearing children to bondage , which is Hagar .
48004025	Now this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia , and answers to the Jerusalem that exists now , for she is in bondage with her children .
48004026	But the Jerusalem that is above is free , which is our mother .
48004027	For it is written , " Rejoice , you barren who don't bear . Break forth and shout , you that don't travail . For more are the children of the desolate than of her who has the husband . "
48004028	Now we , brothers , as Isaac was , are children of promise .
48004029	But as then , he who was born according to the flesh persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit , so also it is now .
48004030	However what does the scripture say ? " Throw out the handmaid and her son , for the son of the handmaid will not inherit with the son of the free woman . "
48004031	Therefore , brothers , we are not children of a handmaid , but of the free woman .
48005001	Stand firm therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free , and don't be entangled again with a yoke of bondage .
48005002	Behold , I , Paul , tell you that if you receive circumcision , Christ will profit you nothing .
48005003	Yes , I testify again to every man who receives circumcision , that he is a debtor to do the whole law .
48005004	You are alienated from Christ , you desire to be justified by the law . You have fallen away from grace .
48005005	For we , through the Spirit , by faith wait for the hope of righteousness .
48005006	For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision amounts to anything , nor uncircumcision , but faith working through love .
48005007	You were running well ! Who interfered with you that you should not obey the truth ?
48005008	This persuasion is not from him who calls you .
48005009	A little yeast grows through the whole lump .
48005010	I have confidence toward you in the Lord that you will think no other way . But he who troubles you will bear his judgment , whoever he is .
48005011	But I , brothers , if I still preach circumcision , why am I still persecuted ? Then the stumbling-block of the cross has been removed .
48005012	I wish that those who disturb you would cut themselves off .
48005013	For you , brothers , were called for freedom . Only don't use your freedom for gain to the flesh , but through love be servants to one another .
48005014	For the whole law is fulfilled in one word , in this : " You shall love your neighbor as yourself . "
48005015	But if you bite and devour one another , be careful that you don't consume one another .
48005016	But I say , walk by the Spirit , and you won't fulfill the lust of the flesh .
48005017	For the flesh lusts against the Spirit , and the Spirit against the flesh ; for these are contrary the one to the other , that you may not do the things that you desire .
48005018	But if you are led by the Spirit , you are not under the law .
48005019	Now the works of the flesh are obvious , which are : adultery , sexual immorality , uncleanness , lustfulness ,
48005020	idolatry , sorcery , hatred , strife , jealousies , outbursts of anger , rivalries , divisions , heresies ,
48005021	envyings , murders , drunkenness , orgies , and things like these ; of which I forewarn you , even as I did forewarn you , that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God .
48005022	But the fruit of the Spirit is love , joy , peace , patience , kindness , goodness , faithfulness ,
48005023	gentleness , and self-control . Against such things there is no law .
48005024	Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its passions and lusts .
48005025	If we live by the Spirit , let's also walk by the Spirit .
48005026	Let's not become conceited , provoking one another , and envying one another .
48006001	Brothers , even if a man is caught in some fault , you who are spiritual must restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness ; looking to yourself so that you also aren't tempted .
48006002	Bear one another's burdens , and so fulfill the law of Christ .
48006003	For if a man thinks himself to be something when he is nothing , he deceives himself .
48006004	But let each man test his own work , and then he will take pride in himself and not in his neighbor .
48006005	For each man will bear his own burden .
48006006	But let him who is taught in the word share all good things with him who teaches .
48006007	Don't be deceived . God is not mocked , for whatever a man sows , that will he also reap .
48006008	For he who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption . But he who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life .
48006009	Let us not be weary in doing good , for we will reap in due season , if we don't give up .
48006010	So then , as we have opportunity , let us work that which is good toward all men , and especially toward those who are of the household of the faith .
48006011	See with what large letters I write to you with my own hand .
48006012	As many as desire to look good in the flesh , they compel you to be circumcised ; only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ .
48006013	For even they who receive circumcision don't keep the law themselves , but they desire to have you circumcised , that they may boast in your flesh .
48006014	But far be it from me to boast , except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ , through which the world has been crucified to me , and I to the world .
48006015	For neither is circumcision anything , nor uncircumcision , but a new creation .
48006016	As many as will walk by this rule , peace and mercy be on them , and on God's Israel .
48006017	From now on , let no one cause me any trouble , for I bear the marks of Jesus branded on my body .
48006018	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit , brothers . Amen .
49001001	Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God , to the saints who are at Ephesus , and the faithful in Christ Jesus :
49001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord , Jesus Christ .
49001003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord , Jesus Christ , who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ ;
49001004	even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world , that we would be holy and without blemish before him in love ;
49001005	having predestined us for adoption as sons through Jesus Christ to himself , according to the good pleasure of his desire ,
49001006	to the praise of the glory of his grace , which he freely bestowed on us in the Beloved ,
49001007	in whom we have our redemption through his blood , the forgiveness of our trespasses , according to the riches of his grace ,
49001008	which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence ,
49001009	making known to us the mystery of his will , according to his good pleasure which he purposed in him
49001010	to an administration of the fullness of the times , to sum up all things in Christ , the things in the heavens , and the things on the earth , in him ;
49001011	in whom also we were made a heritage , having been foreordained according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his will ;
49001012	to the end that we should be to the praise of his glory , we who had before hoped in Christ :
49001013	in whom you also , having heard the word of the truth , the gospel of your salvation , - - in whom , having also believed , you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise ,
49001014	who is a pledge of our inheritance , to the redemption of God's own possession , to the praise of his glory .
49001015	For this cause I also , having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you , and the love which you have toward all the saints ,
49001016	don't cease to give thanks for you , making mention in my prayers ,
49001017	that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of glory , may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him ;
49001018	having the eyes of your hearts enlightened , that you may know what is the hope of his calling , what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints ,
49001019	and what is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe , according to that working of the strength of his might
49001020	which he worked in Christ , when he raised him from the dead , and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places ,
49001021	far above all rule , and authority , and power , and dominion , and every name that is named , not only in this world , but also in that which is to come .
49001022	He put all things in subjection under his feet , and gave him to be head over all things to the assembly ,
49001023	which is his body , the fullness of him who fills all in all .
49002001	You were made alive when you were dead through your trespasses and sins ,
49002002	in which you once walked according to the course of this world , according to the prince of the powers of the air , of the spirit who now works in the sons of disobedience ;
49002003	among whom we also all once lived in the lust of our flesh , doing the desires of the flesh and of the mind , and were by nature children of wrath , even as the rest .
49002004	But God , being rich in mercy , for his great love with which he loved us ,
49002005	even when we were dead through our trespasses , made us alive together with Christ ( by grace have you been saved ) ,
49002006	and raised us up with him , and made us to sit with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus ,
49002007	that in the ages to come he might show the exceeding riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus ;
49002008	for by grace you have been saved through faith , and that not of yourselves ; it is the gift of God ,
49002009	not of works , that no one would boast .
49002010	For we are his workmanship , created in Christ Jesus for good works , which God prepared before that we would walk in them .
49002011	Therefore remember that once you , the Gentiles in the flesh , who are called " uncircumcision " by that which is called " circumcision , " ( in the flesh , made by hands ) ;
49002012	that you were at that time separate from Christ , alienated from the commonwealth of Israel , and strangers from the covenants of the promise , having no hope and without God in the world .
49002013	But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off are made near in the blood of Christ .
49002014	For he is our peace , who made both one , and broke down the middle wall of partition ,
49002015	having abolished in the flesh the hostility , the law of commandments contained in ordinances , that he might create in himself one new man of the two , making peace ;
49002016	and might reconcile them both in one body to God through the cross , having killed the hostility thereby .
49002017	He came and preached peace to you who were far off , and peace to those who were near .
49002018	For through him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father .
49002019	So then you are no longer strangers and sojourners , but you are fellow citizens with the saints , and of the household of God ,
49002020	being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets , Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone ;
49002021	in whom the whole building , fitted together , grows into a holy temple in the Lord ;
49002022	in whom you also are built together for a habitation of God in the Spirit .
49003001	For this cause I , Paul , am the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles ,
49003002	if it is so that you have heard of the administration of that grace of God which was given me toward you ;
49003003	how that by revelation the mystery was made known to me , as I wrote before in few words ,
49003004	whereby , when you read , you can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ ;
49003005	which in other generations was not made known to the sons of men , as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit ;
49003006	that the Gentiles are fellow heirs , and fellow members of the body , and fellow partakers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel ,
49003007	whereof I was made a servant , according to the gift of that grace of God which was given me according to the working of his power .
49003008	To me , the very least of all saints , was this grace given , to preach to the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ ,
49003009	and to make all men see what is the administration of the mystery which for ages has been hidden in God , who created all things through Jesus Christ ;
49003010	to the intent that now through the assembly the manifold wisdom of God might be made known to the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places ,
49003011	according to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus , our Lord ;
49003012	in whom we have boldness and access in confidence through our faith in him .
49003013	Therefore I ask that you may not lose heart at my troubles for you , which are your glory .
49003014	For this cause , I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord , Jesus Christ ,
49003015	from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named ,
49003016	that he would grant you , according to the riches of his glory , that you may be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inward man ;
49003017	that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith ; to the end that you , being rooted and grounded in love ,
49003018	may be strengthened to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth ,
49003019	and to know Christ's love which surpasses knowledge , that you may be filled to all the fullness of God .
49003020	Now to him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think , according to the power that works in us ,
49003021	to him be the glory in the assembly and in Christ Jesus to all generations forever and ever . Amen .
49004001	I therefore , the prisoner in the Lord , beg you to walk worthily of the calling with which you were called ,
49004002	with all lowliness and humility , with longsuffering , bearing with one another in love ;
49004003	being eager to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace .
49004004	There is one body , and one Spirit , even as you also were called in one hope of your calling ;
49004005	one Lord , one faith , one baptism ,
49004006	one God and Father of all , who is over all , and through all , and in us all .
49004007	But to each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of Christ .
49004008	Therefore he says , " When he ascended on high , he led captivity captive , and gave gifts to men . "
49004009	Now this , " He ascended , " what is it but that he also first descended into the lower parts of the earth ?
49004010	He who descended is the same also who ascended far above all the heavens , that he might fill all things .
49004011	He gave some to be apostles ; and some , prophets ; and some , evangelists ; and some , shepherds and teachers ;
49004012	for the perfecting of the saints , to the work of serving , to the building up of the body of Christ ;
49004013	until we all attain to the unity of the faith , and of the knowledge of the Son of God , to a full grown man , to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ ;
49004014	that we may no longer be children , tossed back and forth and carried about with every wind of doctrine , by the trickery of men , in craftiness , after the wiles of error ;
49004015	but speaking truth in love , we may grow up in all things into him , who is the head , Christ ;
49004016	from whom all the body , being fitted and knit together through that which every joint supplies , according to the working in measure of each individual part , makes the body increase to the building up of itself in love .
49004017	This I say therefore , and testify in the Lord , that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk , in the vanity of their mind ,
49004018	being darkened in their understanding , alienated from the life of God , because of the ignorance that is in them , because of the hardening of their hearts ;
49004019	who having become callous gave themselves up to lust , to work all uncleanness with greediness .
49004020	But you did not learn Christ that way ;
49004021	if indeed you heard him , and were taught in him , even as truth is in Jesus :
49004022	that you put away , as concerning your former way of life , the old man , that grows corrupt after the lusts of deceit ;
49004023	and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind ,
49004024	and put on the new man , that like God has been created in righteousness and holiness of truth .
49004025	Therefore , putting away falsehood , speak truth each one with his neighbor . For we are members one of another .
49004026	" Be angry , and don't sin . " Don't let the sun go down on your wrath ,
49004027	neither give place to the devil .
49004028	Let him who stole steal no more ; but rather let him labor , working with his hands the thing that is good , that he may have something to give to him who has need .
49004029	Let no corrupt speech proceed out of your mouth , but such as is good for building up as the need may be , that it may give grace to those who hear .
49004030	Don't grieve the Holy Spirit of God , in whom you were sealed to the day of redemption .
49004031	Let all bitterness , wrath , anger , outcry , and slander , be put away from you , with all malice .
49004032	Be kind to one another , tenderhearted , forgiving each other , just as God also in Christ forgave you .
49005001	Be therefore imitators of God , as beloved children .
49005002	Walk in love , even as Christ also loved you , and gave himself up for us , an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling fragrance .
49005003	But sexual immorality , and all uncleanness , or covetousness , let it not even be mentioned among you , as becomes saints ;
49005004	nor filthiness , nor foolish talking , or jesting , which are not appropriate ; but rather giving of thanks .
49005005	Know this for sure , that no sexually immoral person , nor unclean person , nor covetous man , who is an idolater , has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God .
49005006	Let no man deceive you with empty words . For because of these things , the wrath of God comes on the sons of disobedience .
49005007	Don't be therefore partakers with them .
49005008	For you were once darkness , but are now light in the Lord . Walk as children of light ,
49005009	for the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth ,
49005010	proving what is well-pleasing to the Lord .
49005011	Have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness , but rather even reprove them .
49005012	For the things which are done by them in secret , it is a shame even to speak of .
49005013	But all things , when they are reproved , are revealed by the light , for everything that is revealed is light .
49005014	Therefore he says , " Awake , you who sleep , and arise from the dead , and Christ will shine on you . "
49005015	Therefore watch carefully how you walk , not as unwise , but as wise ;
49005016	redeeming the time , because the days are evil .
49005017	Therefore don't be foolish , but understand what the will of the Lord is .
49005018	Don't be drunken with wine , in which is an abandoned life , but be filled with the Spirit ,
49005019	speaking to one another in psalms , hymns , and spiritual songs ; singing , and singing praises in your heart to the Lord ;
49005020	giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord , Jesus Christ , to God , even the Father ;
49005021	subjecting yourselves one to another in the fear of Christ .
49005022	Wives , be subject to your own husbands , as to the Lord .
49005023	For the husband is the head of the wife , and Christ also is the head of the assembly , being himself the savior of the body .
49005024	But as the assembly is subject to Christ , so let the wives also be to their husbands in everything .
49005025	Husbands , love your wives , even as Christ also loved the assembly , and gave himself up for it ;
49005026	that he might sanctify it , having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word ,
49005027	that he might present the assembly to himself gloriously , not having spot or wrinkle or any such thing ; but that it should be holy and without blemish .
49005028	Even so ought husbands also to love their own wives as their own bodies . He who loves his own wife loves himself .
49005029	For no man ever hated his own flesh ; but nourishes and cherishes it , even as Christ also the assembly ;
49005030	because we are members of his body , of his flesh and bones .
49005031	" For this cause a man will leave his father and mother , and will be joined to his wife . The two will become one flesh . "
49005032	This mystery is great , but I speak in regard of Christ and of the assembly .
49005033	Nevertheless each of you must also love his own wife even as himself ; and let the wife see that she respects her husband .
49006001	Children , obey your parents in the Lord , for this is right .
49006002	" Honor your father and mother , " which is the first commandment with a promise :
49006003	" that it may be well with you , and you may live long on the earth . "
49006004	You fathers , don't provoke your children to wrath , but nurture them in the discipline and instruction of the Lord .
49006005	Servants , be obedient to those who according to the flesh are your masters , with fear and trembling , in singleness of your heart , as to Christ ;
49006006	not in the way of service only when eyes are on you , as men-pleasers ; but as servants of Christ , doing the will of God from the heart ;
49006007	with good will doing service , as to the Lord , and not to men ;
49006008	knowing that whatever good thing each one does , he will receive the same again from the Lord , whether he is bound or free .
49006009	You masters , do the same things to them , and give up threatening , knowing that he who is both their Master and yours is in heaven , and there is no partiality with him .
49006010	Finally , be strong in the Lord , and in the strength of his might .
49006011	Put on the whole armor of God , that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil .
49006012	For our wrestling is not against flesh and blood , but against the principalities , against the powers , against the world's rulers of the darkness of this age , and against the spiritual hosts of wickedness in the heavenly places .
49006013	Therefore , put on the whole armor of God , that you may be able to withstand in the evil day , and , having done all , to stand .
49006014	Stand therefore , having the utility belt of truth buckled around your waist , and having put on the breastplate of righteousness ,
49006015	and having fitted your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace ;
49006016	above all , taking up the shield of faith , with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one .
49006017	Take the helmet of salvation , and the sword of the Spirit , which is the word of God ;
49006018	with all prayer and requests , praying at all times in the Spirit , and being watchful to this end in all perseverance and requests for all the saints :
49006019	On my behalf , that utterance may be given to me in opening my mouth , to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel ,
49006020	for which I am an ambassador in chains ; that in it I may speak boldly , as I ought to speak .
49006021	But that you also may know my affairs , how I am doing , Tychicus , the beloved brother and faithful servant in the Lord , will make known to you all things ;
49006022	whom I have sent to you for this very purpose , that you may know our state , and that he may comfort your hearts .
49006023	Peace be to the brothers , and love with faith , from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
49006024	Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ with incorruptible love .
50001001	Paul and Timothy , servants of Christ Jesus ; To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi , with the overseers and deacons :
50001002	Grace to you , and peace from God , our Father , and the Lord , Jesus Christ .
50001003	I thank my God whenever I remember you ,
50001004	always in every request of mine on behalf of you all making my requests with joy ,
50001005	for your fellowship in furtherance of the gospel from the first day until now ;
50001006	being confident of this very thing , that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ .
50001007	It is even right for me to think this way on behalf of all of you , because I have you in my heart , inasmuch as , both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel , you all are partakers with me of grace .
50001008	For God is my witness , how I long after all of you in the tender mercies of Christ Jesus .
50001009	This I pray , that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all discernment ;
50001010	so that you may approve the things that are excellent ; that you may be sincere and without offense to the day of Christ ;
50001011	being filled with the fruits of righteousness , which are through Jesus Christ , to the glory and praise of God .
50001012	Now I desire to have you know , brothers , that the things which happened to me have turned out rather to the progress of the gospel ;
50001013	so that my bonds became revealed in Christ throughout the whole praetorian guard , and to all the rest ;
50001014	and that most of the brothers in the Lord , being confident through my bonds , are more abundantly bold to speak the word of God without fear .
50001015	Some indeed preach Christ even out of envy and strife , and some also out of good will .
50001016	The former preach Christ from selfish ambition , not sincerely , thinking that they add affliction to my chains ;
50001017	but the latter out of love , knowing that I am appointed for the defense of the gospel .
50001018	What does it matter ? Only that in every way , whether in pretense or in truth , Christ is proclaimed . I rejoice in this , yes , and will rejoice .
50001019	For I know that this will turn out to my salvation , through your supplication and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ ,
50001020	according to my earnest expectation and hope , that I will in no way be put to shame , but with all boldness , as always , now also Christ will be magnified in my body , whether by life , or by death .
50001021	For to me to live is Christ , and to die is gain .
50001022	But if to live in the flesh , this will bring fruit from my work ; then I don't make known what I will choose .
50001023	But I am in a dilemma between the two , having the desire to depart and be with Christ , for that is very far better .
50001024	Yet , to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sake .
50001025	Having this confidence , I know that I will remain , yes , and remain with you all , for your progress and joy in the faith ,
50001026	that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence with you again .
50001027	Only let your manner of life be worthy of the gospel of Christ , that , whether I come and see you or am absent , I may hear of your state , that you stand firm in one spirit , with one soul striving for the faith of the gospel ;
50001028	and in nothing frightened by the adversaries , which is for them a proof of destruction , but to you of salvation , and that from God .
50001029	Because it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ , not only to believe in him , but also to suffer on his behalf ,
50001030	having the same conflict which you saw in me , and now hear is in me .
50002001	If there is therefore any exhortation in Christ , if any consolation of love , if any fellowship of the Spirit , if any tender mercies and compassion ,
50002002	make my joy full , that you be of the same mind , having the same love , being of one accord , of one mind ;
50002003	doing nothing through rivalry or through conceit , but in humility , each counting others better than himself ;
50002004	each of you not just looking to his own things , but each of you also to the things of others .
50002005	Have this in your mind , which was also in Christ Jesus ,
50002006	who , existing in the form of God , didn't consider it robbery to be equal with God ,
50002007	but emptied himself , taking the form of a servant , being made in the likeness of men .
50002008	Being found in human form , he humbled himself , becoming obedient to death , yes , the death of the cross .
50002009	Therefore God also highly exalted him , and gave to him the name which is above every name ;
50002010	that at the name of Jesus every knee would bow , of those in heaven , those on earth , and those under the earth ,
50002011	and that every tongue would confess that Jesus Christ is Lord , to the glory of God , the Father .
50002012	So then , my beloved , even as you have always obeyed , not only in my presence , but now much more in my absence , work out your own salvation with fear and trembling .
50002013	For it is God who works in you both to will and to work , for his good pleasure .
50002014	Do all things without murmurings and disputes ,
50002015	that you may become blameless and harmless , children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation , among whom you are seen as lights in the world ,
50002016	holding up the word of life ; that I may have something to boast in the day of Christ , that I didn't run in vain nor labor in vain .
50002017	Yes , and if I am poured out on the sacrifice and service of your faith , I rejoice , and rejoice with you all .
50002018	In the same way , you also rejoice , and rejoice with me .
50002019	But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon , that I also may be cheered up when I know how you are doing .
50002020	For I have no one else like-minded , who will truly care about you .
50002021	For they all seek their own , not the things of Jesus Christ .
50002022	But you know the proof of him , that , as a child serves a father , so he served with me in furtherance of the gospel .
50002023	Therefore I hope to send him at once , as soon as I see how it will go with me .
50002024	But I trust in the Lord that I myself also will come shortly .
50002025	But I counted it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus , my brother , fellow worker , fellow soldier , and your messenger and minister to my need ;
50002026	since he longed for you all , and was very troubled , because you had heard that he was sick .
50002027	For indeed he was sick , nearly to death , but God had mercy on him ; and not on him only , but on me also , that I might not have sorrow on sorrow .
50002028	I have sent him therefore the more diligently , that , when you see him again , you may rejoice , and that I may be the less sorrowful .
50002029	Receive him therefore in the Lord with all joy , and hold such in honor ,
50002030	because for the work of Christ he came near to death , risking his life to supply that which was lacking in your service toward me .
50003001	Finally , my brothers , rejoice in the Lord . To write the same things to you , to me indeed is not tiresome , but for you it is safe .
50003002	Beware of the dogs , beware of the evil workers , beware of the false circumcision .
50003003	For we are the circumcision , who worship God in the Spirit , and rejoice in Christ Jesus , and have no confidence in the flesh ;
50003004	though I myself might have confidence even in the flesh . If any other man thinks that he has confidence in the flesh , I yet more :
50003005	circumcised the eighth day , of the stock of Israel , of the tribe of Benjamin , a Hebrew of Hebrews ; concerning the law , a Pharisee ;
50003006	concerning zeal , persecuting the assembly ; concerning the righteousness which is in the law , found blameless .
50003007	However , what things were gain to me , these have I counted loss for Christ .
50003008	Yes most assuredly , and I count all things to be loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus , my Lord , for whom I suffered the loss of all things , and count them nothing but refuse , that I may gain Christ
50003009	and be found in him , not having a righteousness of my own , that which is of the law , but that which is through faith in Christ , the righteousness which is from God by faith ;
50003010	that I may know him , and the power of his resurrection , and the fellowship of his sufferings , becoming conformed to his death ;
50003011	if by any means I may attain to the resurrection from the dead .
50003012	Not that I have already obtained , or am already made perfect ; but I press on , if it is so that I may take hold of that for which also I was laid hold of by Christ Jesus .
50003013	Brothers , I don't regard myself as yet having laid hold , but one thing I do . Forgetting the things which are behind , and stretching forward to the things which are before ,
50003014	I press on toward the goal to the prize of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus .
50003015	Let us therefore , as many as are perfect , think this way . If in anything you think otherwise , this God will also reveal that to you .
50003016	Nevertheless , to the extent that we have already attained , let us walk by the same rule . Let us be of the same mind .
50003017	Brothers , be imitators together of me , and note those who walk this way , even as you have us for an example .
50003018	For many walk , of whom I told you often , and now tell you even weeping , as the enemies of the cross of Christ ,
50003019	whose end is destruction , whose god is the belly , and whose glory is in their shame , who think about earthly things .
50003020	For our citizenship is in heaven , from where we also wait for a Savior , the Lord , Jesus Christ ;
50003021	who will change the body of our humiliation to be conformed to the body of his glory , according to the working whereby he is able even to subject all things to himself .
50004001	Therefore , my brothers , beloved and longed for , my joy and crown , so stand firm in the Lord , my beloved .
50004002	I exhort Euodia , and I exhort Syntyche , to think the same way in the Lord .
50004003	Yes , I beg you also , true yoke-fellow , help these women , for they labored with me in the gospel , with Clement also , and the rest of my fellow workers , whose names are in the book of life .
50004004	Rejoice in the Lord always . Again I will say , Rejoice !
50004005	Let your mildness be known to all men . The Lord is at hand .
50004006	In nothing be anxious , but in everything , by prayer and petition with thanksgiving , let your requests be made known to God .
50004007	The peace of God , which passes all understanding , will guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus .
50004008	Finally , brothers , whatever things are true , whatever things are honorable , whatever things are just , whatever things are pure , whatever things are lovely , whatever things are of good report ; if there is any virtue , and if there is any praise , think about these things .
50004009	The things which you learned , received , heard , and saw in me : do these things , and the God of peace will be with you .
50004010	But I rejoice in the Lord greatly , that now at length you have revived your thought for me ; in which you did indeed take thought , but you lacked opportunity .
50004011	Not that I speak in respect to lack , for I have learned in whatever state I am , to be content in it .
50004012	I know how to be humbled , and I know also how to abound . In everything and in all things have I learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry , both to abound and to be in need .
50004013	I can do all things through Christ , who strengthens me .
50004014	However you did well that you had fellowship with my affliction .
50004015	You yourselves also know , you Philippians , that in the beginning of the gospel , when I departed from Macedonia , no assembly had fellowship with me in the matter of giving and receiving but you only .
50004016	For even in Thessalonica you sent once and again to my need .
50004017	Not that I seek for the gift , but I seek for the fruit that increases to your account .
50004018	But I have all things , and abound . I am filled , having received from Epaphroditus the things that came from you , a sweet-smelling fragrance , an acceptable and well-pleasing sacrifice to God .
50004019	My God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus .
50004020	Now to our God and Father be the glory forever and ever . Amen .
50004021	Greet every saint in Christ Jesus . The brothers who are with me greet you .
50004022	All the saints greet you , especially those who are of Caesar's household .
50004023	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with you all .
51001001	Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God , and Timothy our brother ,
51001002	To the saints and faithful brothers in Christ [ who are ] at Colossae : Grace to you and peace from God , our Father , and the Lord , Jesus Christ .
51001003	We give thanks to God , the Father of our Lord , Jesus Christ , praying always for you ,
51001004	having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus , and of the love which you have toward all the saints ,
51001005	because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens , whereof you heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel ,
51001006	which has come to you ; even as it is also in all the world bearing fruit and increasing , as it does in you also , since the day you heard and knew the grace of God in truth ;
51001007	even as you learned of Epaphras our beloved fellow-servant , who is a faithful minister of Christ on our behalf ,
51001008	who also declared to us your love in the Spirit .
51001009	For this cause , we also , since the day we heard this , haven't ceased to pray and make requests for you , that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding ,
51001010	to walk worthily of the Lord , to please him in all respects , bearing fruit in every good work , and increasing in the knowledge of God ;
51001011	strengthened with all power , according to the might of his glory , to all patience and perseverance with joy ;
51001012	giving thanks to the Father , who made us fit to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light ;
51001013	who delivered us out of the power of darkness , and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love ;
51001014	in whom we have our redemption through his blood , the forgiveness of our sins ;
51001015	who is the image of the invisible God , the firstborn of all creation .
51001016	For in him were all things created , in the heavens and on the earth , things visible and things invisible , whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers ; all things have been created through him , and to him .
51001017	He is before all things , and in him all things are held together .
51001018	He is the head of the body , the assembly , who is the beginning , the firstborn from the dead ; that in all things he might have the preeminence .
51001019	For all the fullness was pleased to dwell in him ;
51001020	and through him to reconcile all things to himself , having made peace through the blood of his cross . Through him , I say , whether things on the earth , or things in the heavens .
51001021	You , being in past times alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil works ,
51001022	yet now he has reconciled in the body of his flesh through death , to present you holy and without blemish and blameless before him ,
51001023	if it is so that you continue in the faith , grounded and steadfast , and not moved away from the hope of the gospel which you heard , which was preached in all creation under heaven ; of which I , Paul , was made a servant .
51001024	Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake , and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body's sake , which is the assembly ;
51001025	of which I was made a servant , according to the stewardship of God which was given me toward you , to fulfill the word of God ,
51001026	the mystery which has been hidden for ages and generations . But now it has been revealed to his saints ,
51001027	to whom God was pleased to make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles , who is Christ in you , the hope of glory ;
51001028	whom we proclaim , admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom , that we may present every man perfect in Christ ;
51001029	for which I also labor , striving according to his working , which works in me mightily .
51002001	For I desire to have you know how greatly I strive for you , and for them at Laodicea , and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh ;
51002002	that their hearts may be comforted , they being knit together in love , and to all riches of the full assurance of understanding , that they may know the mystery of God , both of the Father and of Christ ,
51002003	in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden .
51002004	This I say that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech .
51002005	For though I am absent in the flesh , yet am I with you in the spirit , rejoicing and seeing your order , and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ .
51002006	As therefore you received Christ Jesus , the Lord , walk in him ,
51002007	rooted and built up in him , and established in your faith , even as you were taught , abounding in it in thanksgiving .
51002008	Be careful that you don't let anyone rob you through his philosophy and vain deceit , after the tradition of men , after the elements of the world , and not after Christ .
51002009	For in him all the fullness of the Godhead dwells bodily ,
51002010	and in him you are made full , who is the head of all principality and power ;
51002011	in whom you were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands , in the putting off of the body of the sins of the flesh , in the circumcision of Christ ;
51002012	having been buried with him in baptism , in which you were also raised with him through faith in the working of God , who raised him from the dead .
51002013	You were dead through your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh . He made you alive together with him , having forgiven us all our trespasses ;
51002014	having blotted out the bond written in ordinances that was against us , which was contrary to us : and he has taken it out that way , nailing it to the cross ;
51002015	having stripped the principalities and the powers , he made a show of them openly , triumphing over them in it .
51002016	Let no man therefore judge you in eating , or in drinking , or with respect to a feast day or a new moon or a Sabbath day ,
51002017	which are a shadow of the things to come ; but the body is Christ's .
51002018	Let no man rob you of your prize by a voluntary humility and worshipping of the angels , dwelling in the things which he has not seen , vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind ,
51002019	and not holding firmly to the Head , from whom all the body , being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments , grows with God's growth .
51002020	If you died with Christ from the elements of the world , why , as though living in the world , do you subject yourselves to ordinances ,
51002021	" Don't handle , nor taste , nor touch "
51002022	( all which things are to perish with the using ) , after the precepts and doctrines of men ?
51002023	Which things indeed appear like wisdom in self-imposed worship , and humility , and severity to the body ; but aren't of any value against the indulgence of the flesh .
51003001	If then you were raised together with Christ , seek the things that are above , where Christ is , seated on the right hand of God .
51003002	Set your mind on the things that are above , not on the things that are on the earth .
51003003	For you died , and your life is hidden with Christ in God .
51003004	When Christ , our life , is revealed , then you will also be revealed with him in glory .
51003005	Put to death therefore your members which are on the earth : sexual immorality , uncleanness , passion , evil desire , and covetousness , which is idolatry ;
51003006	for which things ' sake the wrath of God comes on the sons of disobedience .
51003007	You also once walked in those , when you lived in these things ;
51003008	but now you also put them all away : anger , wrath , malice , slander , and shameful speaking out of your mouth .
51003009	Don't lie to one another , seeing that you have put off the old man with his doings ,
51003010	and have put on the new man , that is being renewed in knowledge after the image of his Creator ,
51003011	where there can't be Greek and Jew , circumcision and uncircumcision , barbarian , Scythian , bondservant , freeman ; but Christ is all , and in all .
51003012	Put on therefore , as God's elect , holy and beloved , a heart of compassion , kindness , lowliness , humility , and perseverance ;
51003013	bearing with one another , and forgiving each other , if any man has a complaint against any ; even as the Lord forgave you , so also do .
51003014	Above all these things , walk in love , which is the bond of perfection .
51003015	Let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts , to which also you were called in one body . Be thankful .
51003016	Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly ; in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms , hymns , and spiritual songs , singing with grace in your hearts to God .
51003017	Whatever you do , in word or in deed , do all in the name of the Lord Jesus , giving thanks to God , the Father , through him .
51003018	Wives , be in subjection to your husbands , as is fitting in the Lord .
51003019	Husbands , love your wives , and don't be bitter against them .
51003020	Children , obey your parents in all things , for this pleases the Lord .
51003021	Fathers , don't provoke your children , so that they won't be discouraged .
