51003022	Servants , obey in all things those who are your masters according to the flesh , not just when they are looking , as men-pleasers , but in singleness of heart , fearing the Lord .
51003023	Whatever you do , work heartily , as for the Lord , and not for men ,
51003024	knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance ; for you serve the Lord , Christ .
51003025	For he who does wrong will receive again for the wrong that he has done , and there is no partiality .
51004001	Masters , give to your servants that which is just and equal , knowing that you also have a Master in heaven .
51004002	Continue steadfastly in prayer , watching therein with thanksgiving ;
51004003	praying together for us also , that God may open to us a door for the word , to speak the mystery of Christ , for which I am also in bonds ;
51004004	that I may reveal it as I ought to speak .
51004005	Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside , redeeming the time .
51004006	Let your speech always be with grace , seasoned with salt , that you may know how you ought to answer each one .
51004007	All my affairs will be made known to you by Tychicus , the beloved brother , faithful servant , and fellow bondservant in the Lord .
51004008	I am sending him to you for this very purpose , that he may know your circumstances and comfort your hearts ,
51004009	together with Onesimus , the faithful and beloved brother , who is one of you . They will make known to you all things that are going on here .
51004010	Aristarchus , my fellow prisoner greets you , and Mark , the cousin of Barnabas ( concerning whom you received commandments , " if he comes to you , receive him " ) ,
51004011	and Jesus who is called Justus , who are of the circumcision . These are my only fellow workers to the kingdom of God , men who have been a comfort to me .
51004012	Epaphras , who is one of you , a servant of Christ Jesus , salutes you , always striving for you in his prayers , that you may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God .
51004013	For I testify about him , that he has great zeal for you , and for those in Laodicea , and for those in Hierapolis .
51004014	Luke , the beloved physician , and Demas greet you .
51004015	Greet the brothers who are in Laodicea , and Nymphas , and the assembly that is in his house .
51004016	When this letter has been read among you , cause it to be read also in the assembly of the Laodiceans ; and that you also read the letter from Laodicea .
51004017	Tell Archippus , " Take heed to the ministry which you have received in the Lord , that you fulfill it . "
51004018	The salutation of me , Paul , with my own hand . Remember my bonds . Grace be with you .
52001001	Paul , Silvanus , and Timothy , To the assembly of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ : Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
52001002	We always give thanks to God for all of you , mentioning you in our prayers ,
52001003	remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ , before our God and Father .
52001004	We know , brothers loved by God , that you are chosen ,
52001005	and that our gospel came to you not in word only , but also in power , and in the Holy Spirit , and with much assurance . You know what kind of men we showed ourselves to be among you for your sake .
52001006	You became imitators of us , and of the Lord , having received the word in much affliction , with joy of the Holy Spirit ,
52001007	so that you became an example to all who believe in Macedonia and in Achaia .
52001008	For from you has sounded forth the word of the Lord , not only in Macedonia and Achaia , but in every place your faith toward God has gone forth ; so that we need not to say anything .
52001009	For they themselves report concerning us what kind of a reception we had from you ; and how you turned to God from idols , to serve a living and true God ,
52001010	and to wait for his Son from heaven , whom he raised from the dead - - Jesus , who delivers us from the wrath to come .
52002001	For you yourselves know , brothers , our visit to you hasn't been found vain ,
52002002	but having suffered before and been shamefully treated , as you know , at Philippi , we grew bold in our God to tell you the gospel of God in much conflict .
52002003	For our exhortation is not of error , nor of uncleanness , nor in deception .
52002004	But even as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel , so we speak ; not as pleasing men , but God , who tests our hearts .
52002005	For neither were we at any time found using words of flattery , as you know , nor a cloak of covetousness ( God is witness ) ,
52002006	nor seeking glory from men ( neither from you nor from others ) , when we might have claimed authority as apostles of Christ .
52002007	But we were gentle in the midst of you , as when a nurse cherishes her own children .
52002008	Even so , affectionately longing for you , we were well pleased to impart to you , not the gospel of God only , but also our own souls , because you had become very dear to us .
52002009	For you remember , brothers , our labor and travail . Working night and day , that we might not burden any of you , we preached to you the gospel of God .
52002010	You are witnesses with God , how holy , righteously , and blamelessly we behaved ourselves toward you who believe .
52002011	As you know how we exhorted , comforted , and implored everyone of you , as a father does his own children ,
52002012	to the end that you should walk worthily of God , who calls you into his own kingdom and glory .
52002013	For this cause we also thank God without ceasing , that , when you received from us the word of the message of God , you accepted it not as the word of men , but , as it is in truth , the word of God , which also works in you who believe .
52002014	For you , brothers , became imitators of the assemblies of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus ; for you also suffered the same things from your own countrymen , even as they did from the Jews ;
52002015	who killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets , and drove us out , and didn't please God , and are contrary to all men ;
52002016	forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved ; to fill up their sins always . But wrath has come on them to the uttermost .
52002017	But we , brothers , being bereaved of you for a short season , in presence , not in heart , tried even harder to see your face with great desire ,
52002018	because we wanted to come to you - - indeed , I , Paul , once and again - - but Satan hindered us .
52002019	For what is our hope , or joy , or crown of rejoicing ? Isn't it even you , before our Lord Jesus at his coming ?
52002020	For you are our glory and our joy .
52003001	Therefore , when we couldn't stand it any longer , we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone ,
52003002	and sent Timothy , our brother and God's servant in the gospel of Christ , to establish you , and to comfort you concerning your faith ;
52003003	that no one be moved by these afflictions . For you know that we are appointed to this task .
52003004	For most assuredly , when we were with you , we told you beforehand that we are to suffer affliction , even as it happened , and you know .
52003005	For this cause I also , when I couldn't stand it any longer , sent that I might know your faith , for fear that by any means the tempter had tempted you , and our labor would have been in vain .
52003006	But when Timothy came just now to us from you , and brought us glad news of your faith and love , and that you have good memories of us always , longing to see us , even as we also long to see you ;
52003007	for this cause , brothers , we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith .
52003008	For now we live , if you stand fast in the Lord .
52003009	For what thanksgiving can we render again to God for you , for all the joy with which we rejoice for your sakes before our God ;
52003010	night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face , and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith ?
52003011	Now may our God and Father himself , and our Lord Jesus Christ , direct our way to you ;
52003012	and the Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another , and toward all men , even as we also do toward you ,
52003013	to the end he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father , at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints .
52004001	Finally then , brothers , we beg and exhort you in the Lord Jesus , that , as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God , - - that you abound more and more .
52004002	For you know what charge we gave you through the Lord Jesus .
52004003	For this is the will of God : your sanctification , that you abstain from sexual immorality ,
52004004	that each one of you know how to possess himself of his own vessel in sanctification and honor ,
52004005	not in the passion of lust , even as the Gentiles who don't know God ;
52004006	that no one should take advantage of and wrong a brother or sister in this matter ; because the Lord is an avenger in all these things , as also we forewarned you and testified .
52004007	For God called us not for uncleanness , but in sanctification .
52004008	Therefore he who rejects , doesn't reject man , but God , who has also given his Holy Spirit to you .
52004009	But concerning brotherly love , you have no need that one write to you . For you yourselves are taught by God to love one another ,
52004010	for indeed you do it toward all the brothers who are in all Macedonia . But we exhort you , brothers , that you abound more and more ;
52004011	and that you make it your ambition to lead a quiet life , and to do your own business , and to work with your own hands , even as we charged you ;
52004012	that you may walk properly toward those who are outside , and may have need of nothing .
52004013	But we don't want you to be ignorant , brothers , concerning those who have fallen asleep , so that you don't grieve like the rest , who have no hope .
52004014	For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again , even so those who have fallen asleep in Jesus will God bring with him .
52004015	For this we tell you by the word of the Lord , that we who are alive , who are left to the coming of the Lord , will in no way precede those who have fallen asleep .
52004016	For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a shout , with the voice of the archangel , and with God's trumpet . The dead in Christ will rise first ,
52004017	then we who are alive , who are left , will be caught up together with them in the clouds , to meet the Lord in the air . So we will be with the Lord forever .
52004018	Therefore comfort one another with these words .
52005001	But concerning the times and the seasons , brothers , you have no need that anything be written to you .
52005002	For you yourselves know well that the day of the Lord comes like a thief in the night .
52005003	For when they are saying , " Peace and safety , " then sudden destruction will come on them , like birth pains on a pregnant woman ; and they will in no way escape .
52005004	But you , brothers , aren't in darkness , that the day should overtake you like a thief .
52005005	You are all sons of light , and sons of the day . We don't belong to the night , nor to darkness ,
52005006	so then let's not sleep , as the rest do , but let us watch and be sober .
52005007	For those who sleep , sleep in the night , and those who are drunken are drunken in the night .
52005008	But let us , since we belong to the day , be sober , putting on the breastplate of faith and love , and , for a helmet , the hope of salvation .
52005009	For God didn't appoint us to wrath , but to the obtaining of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
52005010	who died for us , that , whether we wake or sleep , we should live together with him .
52005011	Therefore exhort one another , and build each other up , even as you also do .
52005012	But we beg you , brothers , to know those who labor among you , and are over you in the Lord , and admonish you ,
52005013	and to respect and honor them in love for their work's sake . Be at peace among yourselves .
52005014	We exhort you , brothers , admonish the disorderly , encourage the fainthearted , support the weak , be patient toward all .
52005015	See that no one returns evil for evil to anyone , but always follow after that which is good , towards one another , and towards all .
52005016	Rejoice always .
52005017	Pray without ceasing .
52005018	In everything give thanks , for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus toward you .
52005019	Don't quench the Spirit .
52005020	Don't despise prophesies .
52005021	Test all things , and hold firmly that which is good .
52005022	Abstain from every form of evil .
52005023	May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely . May your whole spirit , soul , and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ .
52005024	Faithful is he who calls you , who will also do it .
52005025	Brothers , pray for us .
52005026	Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss .
52005027	I solemnly charge you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the holy brothers .
52005028	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you . Amen .
53001001	Paul , Silvanus , and Timothy , To the assembly of the Thessalonians in God , our Father , and the Lord Jesus Christ :
53001002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53001003	We are bound to always give thanks to God for you , brothers , even as it is appropriate , because your faith grows exceedingly , and the love of each and every one of you towards one another abounds ;
53001004	so that we ourselves boast about you in the assemblies of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which you endure .
53001005	This is an obvious sign of the righteous judgment of God , to the end that you may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God , for which you also suffer .
53001006	Since it is a righteous thing with God to repay affliction to those who afflict you ,
53001007	and to give relief to you that are afflicted with us , when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels in flaming fire ,
53001008	giving vengeance to those who don't know God , and to those who don't obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus ,
53001009	who will pay the penalty : eternal destruction from the face of the Lord and from the glory of his might ,
53001010	when he comes to be glorified in his saints , and to be admired among all those who have believed ( because our testimony to you was believed ) in that day .
53001011	To this end we also pray always for you , that our God may count you worthy of your calling , and fulfill every desire of goodness and work of faith , with power ;
53001012	that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you , and you in him , according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53002001	Now we beg you , brothers , concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ , and our gathering together to him ,
53002002	to the end that you won't be quickly shaken in your mind , nor yet be troubled , either by spirit , or by word , or by letter as from us , saying that the day of Christ had come .
53002003	Let no one deceive you in any way . For it will not be , unless the falling away comes first , and the man of sin is revealed , the son of destruction ,
53002004	he who opposes and exalts himself against all that is called God or that is worshipped ; so that he sits as God in the temple of God , setting himself up as God .
53002005	Don't you remember that , when I was still with you , I told you these things ?
53002006	Now you know what is restraining him , to the end that he may be revealed in his own season .
53002007	For the mystery of lawlessness does already work . Only there is one who restrains now , until he is taken out of the way .
53002008	Then will the lawless one be revealed , whom the Lord will kill with the breath of his mouth , and bring to nothing by the brightness of his coming ;
53002009	even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders ,
53002010	and with all deception of wickedness for those who are being lost , because they didn't receive the love of the truth , that they might be saved .
53002011	Because of this , God sends them a working of error , that they should believe a lie ;
53002012	that they all might be judged who didn't believe the truth , but had pleasure in unrighteousness .
53002013	But we are bound to always give thanks to God for you , brothers loved by the Lord , because God chose you from the beginning for salvation in sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth ;
53002014	whereunto he called you through our gospel , to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53002015	So then , brothers , stand firm , and hold the traditions which you were taught by us , whether by word , or by letter .
53002016	Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself , and God , our Father , who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace ,
53002017	comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word .
53003001	Finally , brothers , pray for us , that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified , even as also with you ;
53003002	and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and evil men ; for not all have faith .
53003003	But the Lord is faithful , who will establish you , and guard you from the evil one .
53003004	We have confidence in the Lord concerning you , that you both do and will do the things which we command .
53003005	May the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God , and into the patience of Christ .
53003006	Now we command you , brothers , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , that you withdraw yourselves from every brother who walks in rebellion , and not after the tradition which they received from us .
53003007	For you know how you ought to imitate us . For we didn't behave ourselves rebelliously among you ,
53003008	neither did we eat bread for nothing from any man's hand , but in labor and travail , working night and day , that we might not burden any of you ;
53003009	not because we don't have the right , but to make ourselves an example to you , that you should imitate us .
53003010	For even when we were with you , we commanded you this : " If anyone will not work , neither let him eat . "
53003011	For we hear of some who walk among you in rebellion , who don't work at all , but are busybodies .
53003012	Now those who are that way , we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ , that with quietness they work , and eat their own bread .
53003013	But you , brothers , don't be weary in doing well .
53003014	If any man doesn't obey our word by this letter , note that man , that you have no company with him , to the end that he may be ashamed .
53003015	Don't count him as an enemy , but admonish him as a brother .
53003016	Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways . The Lord be with you all .
53003017	The greeting of me , Paul , with my own hand , which is the sign in every letter . This is how I write .
53003018	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all . Amen .
54001001	Paul , an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the commandment of God , our Savior , and Christ Jesus , our hope ;
54001002	to Timothy , my true child in faith : Grace , mercy , and peace , from God our Father , and Christ Jesus , our Lord .
54001003	As I exhorted you to stay at Ephesus , when I was going into Macedonia , that you might charge certain men not to teach a different doctrine ,
54001004	neither to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies , which cause disputes , rather than God's stewardship , which is in faith - -
54001005	But the end of the charge is love , out of a pure heart and a good conscience and unfeigned faith ;
54001006	from which things some , having missed the mark , have turned aside to vain talking ;
54001007	desiring to be teachers of the law , though they understand neither what they say , nor about what they strongly affirm .
54001008	But we know that the law is good , if a man uses it lawfully ,
54001009	as knowing this , that law is not made for a righteous man , but for the lawless and insubordinate , for the ungodly and sinners , for the unholy and profane , for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers , for manslayers ,
54001010	for the sexually immoral , for homosexuals , for slave-traders , for liars , for perjurers , and for any other thing contrary to the sound doctrine ;
54001011	according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God , which was committed to my trust .
54001012	And I thank him who enabled me , Christ Jesus , our Lord , because he counted me faithful , appointing me to service ;
54001013	although I was before a blasphemer , a persecutor , and insolent . However , I obtained mercy , because I did it ignorantly in unbelief .
54001014	The grace of our Lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus .
54001015	The saying is faithful , and worthy of all acceptance , that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners ; of whom I am chief .
54001016	However , for this cause I obtained mercy , that in me as chief , Jesus Christ might display all his patience , for an example of those who were going to believe in him to eternal life .
54001017	Now to the King eternal , immortal , invisible , to God who alone is wise , be honor and glory forever and ever . Amen .
54001018	This charge I commit to you , my child Timothy , according to the prophecies which led the way to you , that by them you may wage the good warfare ;
54001019	holding faith and a good conscience ; which some having thrust away made a shipwreck concerning the faith ;
54001020	of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander ; whom I delivered to Satan , that they might be taught not to blaspheme .
54002001	I exhort therefore , first of all , that petitions , prayers , intercessions , and givings of thanks , be made for all men :
54002002	for kings and all who are in high places ; that we may lead a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and reverence .
54002003	For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God , our Savior ;
54002004	who desires to have all men to be saved , and come to full knowledge of the truth .
54002005	For there is one God , and one mediator between God and men , the man Christ Jesus ,
54002006	who gave himself as a ransom for all ; the testimony in its own times ;
54002007	to which I was appointed a preacher and an apostle ( I am telling the truth in Christ , not lying ) , a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth .
54002008	I desire therefore that the men in every place pray , lifting up holy hands , without wrath and doubting .
54002009	In the same way , that women also adorn themselves in decent clothing , with modesty and propriety ; not just with braided hair , and gold or pearls or costly clothing ;
54002010	but ( which becomes women professing godliness ) through good works .
54002011	Let a woman learn in quietness with all subjection .
54002012	But I don't permit a woman to teach , nor to exercise authority over a man , but to be in quietness .
54002013	For Adam was first formed , then Eve .
54002014	Adam wasn't deceived , but the woman , being deceived , has fallen into disobedience ;
54002015	but she will be saved through her child-bearing , if they continue in faith , love , and sanctification with sobriety .
54003001	This is a faithful saying : if a man seeks the office of an overseer , he desires a good work .
54003002	The overseer therefore must be without reproach , the husband of one wife , temperate , sensible , modest , hospitable , good at teaching ;
54003003	not a drinker , not violent , not greedy for money , but gentle , not quarrelsome , not covetous ;
54003004	one who rules his own house well , having children in subjection with all reverence ;
54003005	( but if a man doesn't know how to rule his own house , how will he take care of the assembly of God ? )
54003006	not a novice , to avoid being puffed up and falling into the condemnation of the devil .
54003007	Moreover he must have good testimony from those who are outside , to avoid falling into reproach and the snare of the devil .
54003008	Deacons , in the same way , must be reverent , not double-tongued , not addicted to much wine , not greedy for money ;
54003009	holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience .
54003010	Let them also first be tested ; then let them serve as deacons , if they are blameless .
54003011	Their wives in the same way must be reverent , not slanderers , temperate , faithful in all things .
54003012	Let deacons be husbands of one wife , ruling their children and their own houses well .
54003013	For those who have served well as deacons gain to themselves a good standing , and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus .
54003014	These things I write to you , hoping to come to you shortly ;
54003015	but if I wait long , that you may know how men ought to behave themselves in the house of God , which is the assembly of the living God , the pillar and ground of the truth .
54003016	Without controversy , the mystery of godliness is great : God was revealed in the flesh , Justified in the spirit , Seen by angels , Preached among the nations , Believed on in the world , And received up in glory .
54004001	But the Spirit says expressly that in later times some will fall away from the faith , paying attention to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons ,
54004002	through the hypocrisy of men who speak lies , branded in their own conscience as with a hot iron ;
54004003	forbidding marriage and commanding to abstinence from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth .
54004004	For every creature of God is good , and nothing is to be rejected , if it is received with thanksgiving .
54004005	For it is sanctified through the word of God and prayer .
54004006	If you instruct the brothers of these things , you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus , nourished in the words of the faith , and of the good doctrine which you have followed .
54004007	But refuse profane and old wives ' fables . Exercise yourself toward godliness .
54004008	For bodily exercise has some value , but godliness has value for all things , having the promise of the life which is now , and of that which is to come .
54004009	This saying is faithful and worthy of all acceptance .
54004010	For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach , because we have set our trust in the living God , who is the Savior of all men , especially of those who believe .
54004011	Command and teach these things .
54004012	Let no man despise your youth ; but be an example to those who believe , in word , in your way of life , in love , in spirit , in faith , and in purity .
54004013	Until I come , pay attention to reading , to exhortation , and to teaching .
54004014	Don't neglect the gift that is in you , which was given to you by prophecy , with the laying on of the hands of the elders .
54004015	Be diligent in these things . Give yourself wholly to them , that your progress may be revealed to all .
54004016	Pay attention to yourself , and to your teaching . Continue in these things , for in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you .
54005001	Don't rebuke an older man , but exhort him as a father ; the younger men as brothers ;
54005002	the elder women as mothers ; the younger as sisters , in all purity .
54005003	Honor widows who are widows indeed .
54005004	But if any widow has children or grandchildren , let them learn first to show piety towards their own family , and to repay their parents , for this is acceptable in the sight of God .
54005005	Now she who is a widow indeed , and desolate , has her hope set on God , and continues in petitions and prayers night and day .
54005006	But she who gives herself to pleasure is dead while she lives .
54005007	Also command these things , that they may be without reproach .
54005008	But if anyone doesn't provide for his own , and specially his own household , he has denied the faith , and is worse than an unbeliever .
54005009	Let none be enrolled as a widow under sixty years old , having been the wife of one man ,
54005010	well reported of for good works ; if she has brought up children , if she has used hospitality to strangers , if she has washed the saints ' feet , if she has relieved the afflicted , if she has diligently followed every good work .
54005011	But refuse younger widows , for when they have grown wanton against Christ , they desire to marry ;
54005012	having condemnation , because they have rejected their first pledge .
54005013	Besides , they also learn to be idle , going about from house to house . Not only idle , but also gossips and busybodies , saying things which they ought not .
54005014	I desire therefore that the younger widows marry , bear children , rule the household , and give no occasion to the adversary for reviling .
54005015	For already some have turned aside after Satan .
54005016	If any man or woman who believes has widows , let them relieve them , and don't let the assembly be burdened ; that it might relieve those who are widows indeed .
54005017	Let the elders who rule well be counted worthy of double honor , especially those who labor in the word and in teaching .
54005018	For the scripture says , " You shall not muzzle the ox when he treads out the grain . " And , " The laborer is worthy of his wages . "
54005019	Don't receive an accusation against an elder , except at the word of two or three witnesses .
54005020	Those who sin , reprove in the sight of all , that the rest also may be in fear .
54005021	I charge you in the sight of God , and Christ Jesus , and the elect angels , that you observe these things without prejudice , doing nothing by partiality .
54005022	Lay hands hastily on no one , neither be a participant in other men's sins . Keep yourself pure .
54005023	Be no longer a drinker of water only , but use a little wine for your stomach's sake and your frequent infirmities .
54005024	Some men's sins are evident , going before to judgment , and some men also they follow after .
54005025	In the same way also there are good works that are obvious , and those that are otherwise can't be hidden .
54006001	Let as many as are bondservants under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor , that the name of God and the doctrine not be blasphemed .
54006002	Those who have believing masters , let them not despise them , because they are brothers , but rather let them serve them , because those who partake of the benefit are believing and beloved . Teach and exhort these things .
54006003	If anyone teaches a different doctrine , and doesn't consent to sound words , the words of our Lord , Jesus Christ , and to the doctrine which is according to godliness ;
54006004	he is conceited , knowing nothing , but obsessed with arguments , disputes , and word battles , from which come envy , strife , reviling , evil suspicions ,
54006005	constant friction of men of corrupt minds and destitute of the truth , who suppose that godliness is a means of gain . Withdraw yourself from such .
54006006	But godliness with contentment is great gain .
54006007	For we brought nothing into the world , and we certainly can't carry anything out .
54006008	But having food and clothing , we will be content with that .
54006009	But those who are determined to be rich fall into a temptation and a snare and many foolish and harmful lusts , such as drown men in ruin and destruction .
54006010	For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil . Some have been led astray from the faith in their greed , and have pierced themselves through with many sorrows .
54006011	But you , man of God , flee these things , and follow after righteousness , godliness , faith , love , patience , and gentleness .
54006012	Fight the good fight of the faith . Lay hold of the eternal life , whereunto you were called , and confessed the good confession in the sight of many witnesses .
54006013	I charge you in the sight of God , who gives life to all things , and of Christ Jesus , who before Pontius Pilate testified the good confession ,
54006014	that you keep the commandment , without spot , without reproach , until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ ;
54006015	which in its own times he will show , who is the blessed and only Ruler , the King of kings , and Lord of lords ;
54006016	who alone has immortality , dwelling in unapproachable light ; whom no man has seen , nor can see : to whom be honor and eternal power . Amen .
54006017	Charge those who are rich in this present world , that they not be haughty , nor have their hope set on the uncertainty of riches , but on the living God , who richly provides us with everything to enjoy ;
54006018	that they do good , that they be rich in good works , that they be ready to distribute , willing to communicate ;
54006019	laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come , that they may lay hold of eternal life .
54006020	Timothy , guard that which is committed to you , turning away from the empty chatter and oppositions of the knowledge which is falsely so called ;
54006021	which some professing have erred concerning the faith . Grace be with you . Amen .
55001001	Paul , an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God , according to the promise of the life which is in Christ Jesus ,
55001002	to Timothy , my beloved child : Grace , mercy , and peace , from God , the Father , and Christ Jesus , our Lord .
55001003	I thank God , whom I serve as my forefathers did , with a pure conscience . How unceasing is my memory of you in my petitions , night and day
55001004	longing to see you , remembering your tears , that I may be filled with joy ;
55001005	having been reminded of the unfeigned faith that is in you ; which lived first in your grandmother Lois , and your mother Eunice , and , I am persuaded , in you also .
55001006	For this cause , I remind you that you should stir up the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands .
55001007	For God didn't give us a spirit of fear , but of power and love and discipline .
55001008	Don't be ashamed therefore of the testimony of our Lord , nor of me , his prisoner ; but suffer hardship with the gospel according to the power of God ,
55001009	who saved us , and called us with a holy calling , not according to our works , but according to his own purpose and grace , which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal ,
55001010	but has now been revealed by the appearing of our Savior , Christ Jesus , who abolished death , and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel .
55001011	For this , I was appointed as a preacher , an apostle , and a teacher of the Gentiles .
55001012	For this cause I suffer also these things . Yet I am not ashamed , for I know him whom I have believed , and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day .
55001013	Hold the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me , in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus .
55001014	That good thing which was committed to you , guard through the Holy Spirit which dwells in us .
55001015	This you know , that all who are in Asia turned away from me ; of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes .
55001016	May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus , for he often refreshed me , and was not ashamed of my chain ,
55001017	but when he was in Rome , he sought me diligently , and found me
55001018	( the Lord grant to him to find the Lord's mercy in that day ) ; and in how many things he served at Ephesus , you know very well .
55002001	You therefore , my child , be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus .
55002002	The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses , commit the same to faithful men , who will be able to teach others also .
55002003	You therefore must endure hardship , as a good soldier of Christ Jesus .
55002004	No soldier on service entangles himself in the affairs of life , that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier .
55002005	If also a man competes in the games , he is not crowned , unless he has competed by the rules .
55002006	The farmers who labor must be the first to get a share of the crops .
55002007	Consider what I say , and may the Lord give you understanding in all things .
55002008	Remember Jesus Christ , risen from the dead , of the seed of David , according to my gospel ,
55002009	in which I suffer hardship to bonds , as a criminal . But God's word isn't bound .
55002010	Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sake , that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory .
55002011	This saying is faithful : For if we died with him , we will also live with him .
55002012	If we endure , we will also reign with him . If we will deny him , he also will deny us .
55002013	If we are faithless , he remains faithful - - he can't deny himself .
55002014	Remind them of these things , charging them in the sight of the Lord , that they don't argue about words , to no profit , to the subverting of those who hear .
55002015	Give diligence to present yourself approved by God , a workman who doesn't need to be ashamed , properly handling the Word of Truth .
55002016	But shun empty chatter , for they will proceed further in ungodliness ,
55002017	and their word will consume like gangrene , of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus ;
55002018	men who have erred concerning the truth , saying that the resurrection is already past , and overthrowing the faith of some .
55002019	However God's firm foundation stands , having this seal , " The Lord knows those who are his , " and , " Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness . "
55002020	Now in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver , but also of wood and of clay . Some are for honor , and some for dishonor .
55002021	If a man therefore purges himself from these , he will be a vessel for honor , sanctified , and suitable for the master's use , prepared for every good work .
55002022	Flee from youthful lusts ; but pursue righteousness , faith , love , and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart .
55002023	But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings , knowing that they generate strife .
55002024	The Lord's servant must not quarrel , but be gentle towards all , able to teach , patient ,
55002025	in gentleness correcting those who oppose him ; if perhaps God may give them repentance to the knowledge of the truth ,
55002026	and they may recover themselves out of the devil's snare , having been taken captive by him to his will .
55003001	But know this , that in the last days , grievous times will come .
55003002	For men will be lovers of self , lovers of money , boastful , arrogant , blasphemers , disobedient to parents , unthankful , unholy ,
55003003	without natural affection , unforgiving , slanderers , without self-control , fierce , no lovers of good ,
55003004	traitors , headstrong , conceited , lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God ;
55003005	holding a form of godliness , but having denied the power thereof . Turn away from these , also .
55003006	For of these are those who creep into houses , and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins , led away by various lusts ,
55003007	always learning , and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth .
55003008	Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses , so do these also oppose the truth ; men corrupted in mind , reprobate concerning the faith .
55003009	But they will proceed no further . For their folly will be evident to all men , as theirs also came to be .
55003010	But you did follow my teaching , conduct , purpose , faith , patience , love , steadfastness ,
55003011	persecutions , and sufferings ; those things that happened to me at Antioch , at Iconium , at Lystra ; those persecutions that I endured . Out of them all the Lord delivered me .
55003012	Yes , and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution .
55003013	But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse , deceiving and being deceived .
55003014	But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of , knowing from whom you have learned them .
55003015	From infancy , you have known the sacred writings which are able to make you wise to salvation through faith , which is in Christ Jesus .
55003016	Every scripture inspired by God is also profitable for teaching , for reproof , for correction , for instruction which is in righteousness ,
55003017	that the man of God may be complete , furnished completely to every good work .
55004001	I charge you therefore before God and the Lord , Jesus Christ , who will judge the living and the dead at His appearing and His kingdom :
55004002	preach the word ; be urgent in season and out of season ; reprove , rebuke , and exhort , with all patience and teaching .
55004003	For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine , but , having itching ears , will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts ;
55004004	and will turn away their ears from the truth , and turn aside to fables .
55004005	But you be sober in all things , suffer hardship , do the work of an evangelist , and fulfill your ministry .
55004006	For I am already being offered , and the time of my departure has come .
55004007	I have fought the good fight . I have finished the course . I have kept the faith .
55004008	From now on , there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness , which the Lord , the righteous judge , will give to me at that day ; and not to me only , but also to all those who have loved his appearing .
55004009	Be diligent to come to me soon ,
55004010	for Demas left me , having loved this present world , and went to Thessalonica ; Crescens to Galatia , and Titus to Dalmatia .
55004011	Only Luke is with me . Take Mark , and bring him with you , for he is useful to me for ministering .
55004012	But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus .
55004013	Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus , when you come , and the books , especially the parchments .
55004014	Alexander , the coppersmith , did much evil to me . The Lord will repay him according to his works ,
55004015	of whom you also must beware ; for he greatly opposed our words .
55004016	At my first defense , no one took my part , but all left me . May it not be held against them .
55004017	But the Lord stood by me , and strengthened me , that through me the message might be fully proclaimed , and that all the Gentiles might hear ; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion .
55004018	And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work , and will save me to his heavenly kingdom ; to whom be the glory forever and ever . Amen .
55004019	Greet Prisca and Aquila , and the house of Onesiphorus .
55004020	Erastus remained at Corinth , but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick .
55004021	Be diligent to come before winter . Eubulus salutes you , as do Pudens , Linus , Claudia , and all the brothers .
55004022	The Lord , Jesus Christ , be with your spirit . Grace be with you . Amen .
56001001	Paul , a servant of God , and an apostle of Jesus Christ , according to the faith of God's elect , and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness ,
56001002	in hope of eternal life , which God , who can't lie , promised before eternal times ;
56001003	but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God , our Savior ;
56001004	to Titus , my true child according to a common faith : Grace , mercy , and peace from God , the Father , and the Lord , Jesus Christ , our Savior .
56001005	I left you in Crete for this reason , that you would set in order the things that were lacking , and appoint elders in every city , as I directed you ;
56001006	if anyone is blameless , the husband of one wife , having children who believe , who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior .
56001007	For the overseer must be blameless , as God's steward ; not self-pleasing , not easily angered , not given to wine , not violent , not greedy for dishonest gain ;
56001008	but given to hospitality , as a lover of good , sober-minded , fair , holy , self-controlled ;
56001009	holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching , that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine , and to convict those who contradict him .
56001010	For there are also many unruly men , vain talkers and deceivers , especially those of the circumcision ,
56001011	whose mouths must be stopped ; men who overthrow whole houses , teaching things which they ought not , for dishonest gain's sake .
56001012	One of them , a prophet of their own , said , " Cretans are always liars , evil beasts , and idle gluttons . "
56001013	This testimony is true . For this cause , reprove them sharply , that they may be sound in the faith ,
56001014	not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth .
56001015	To the pure , all things are pure ; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving , nothing is pure ; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled .
56001016	They profess that they know God , but by their works they deny him , being abominable , disobedient , and unfit for any good work .
56002001	But say the things which fit the sound doctrine ,
56002002	that older men should be temperate , sensible , sober-minded , sound in faith , in love , and in patience :
56002003	and that older women likewise be reverent in behavior , not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine , teachers of that which is good ;
56002004	that they may train the young women to love their husbands , to love their children ,
56002005	to be sober-minded , chaste , workers at home , kind , being in subjection to their own husbands , that God's word may not be blasphemed .
56002006	Likewise , exhort the younger men to be sober-minded ;
56002007	in all things showing yourself an example of good works ; in your teaching showing integrity , seriousness , incorruptibility ,
56002008	and soundness of speech that can't be condemned ; that he who opposes you may be ashamed , having no evil thing to say about us .
56002009	Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters , and to be well-pleasing in all things ; not contradicting ;
56002010	not stealing , but showing all good fidelity ; that they may adorn the doctrine of God , our Savior , in all things .
56002011	For the grace of God has appeared , bringing salvation to all men ,
56002012	instructing us to the intent that , denying ungodliness and worldly lusts , we would live soberly , righteously , and godly in this present world ;
56002013	looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of the great God and our Savior , Jesus Christ ;
56002014	who gave himself for us , that he might redeem us from all iniquity , and purify to himself a people for his own possession , zealous for good works .
56002015	Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority . Let no man despise you .
56003001	Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities , to be obedient , to be ready to every good work ,
56003002	to speak evil of no one , not to be contentious , to be gentle , showing all gentleness toward all men .
56003003	For we were also once foolish , disobedient , deceived , serving various lusts and pleasures , living in malice and envy , hateful , and hating one another .
56003004	But when the kindness of God , our Savior , and his love toward man , appeared ,
56003005	not by works of righteousness , which we did ourselves , but according to his mercy , he saved us , through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit ,
56003006	which he poured out on us richly , through Jesus Christ , our Savior ;
56003007	that , being justified by his grace , we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life .
56003008	This saying is faithful , and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently , to the end that they who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works . These things are good and profitable to men ;
56003009	but shun foolish questionings , genealogies , strife , and disputes about the law ; for they are unprofitable and vain .
56003010	Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning ;
56003011	knowing that such a one is perverted , and sins , being self-condemned .
56003012	When I send Artemas to you , or Tychicus , be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis , for I have determined to winter there .
56003013	Send Zenas , the lawyer , and Apollos on their journey diligently , that nothing may be lacking for them .
56003014	Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses , that they may not be unfruitful .
56003015	All who are with me greet you . Greet those who love us in faith . Grace be with you all . Amen .
57001001	Paul , a prisoner of Christ Jesus , and Timothy our brother , to Philemon , our beloved fellow worker ,
57001002	to the beloved Apphia , to Archippus , our fellow soldier , and to the assembly in your house :
57001003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
57001004	I thank my God always , making mention of you in my prayers ,
57001005	hearing of your love , and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus , and toward all the saints ;
57001006	that the fellowship of your faith may become effective , in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us , in Christ Jesus .
57001007	For we have much joy and comfort in your love , because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you , brother .
57001008	Therefore , though I have all boldness in Christ to command you that which is appropriate ,
57001009	yet for love's sake I rather beg , being such a one as Paul , the aged , and now a prisoner also of Christ Jesus .
57001010	I beg you for my child , whom I have fathered in my bonds , Onesimus ,
57001011	who once was useless to you , but now is useful to you and to me ;
57001012	I am sending him back . You therefore receive him , that is , my own heart ,
57001013	whom I wanted to keep with me , that in your behalf he might minister to me in the bonds of the gospel .
57001014	But I was willing to do nothing without your consent , that your goodness would not be as of necessity , but of free will .
57001015	For perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while , that you would have him forever ,
57001016	no longer as a slave , but more than a slave , a beloved brother , specially to me , but how much rather to you , both in the flesh and in the Lord .
57001017	If then you count me a partner , receive him as you would receive me .
57001018	But if he has wronged you at all , or owes you anything , put that to my account .
57001019	I , Paul , write this with my own hand : I will repay it ( not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self besides ) .
57001020	Yes , brother , let me have joy from you in the Lord . Refresh my heart in the Lord .
57001021	Having confidence in your obedience , I write to you , knowing that you will do even beyond what I say .
57001022	Also , prepare a guest room for me , for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you .
57001023	Epaphras , my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus , greets you ,
57001024	as do Mark , Aristarchus , Demas , and Luke , my fellow workers .
57001025	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit . Amen .
58001001	God , having in the past spoken to the fathers through the prophets at many times and in various ways ,
58001002	has at the end of these days spoken to us by his Son , whom he appointed heir of all things , through whom also he made the worlds .
58001003	His Son is the radiance of his glory , the very image of his substance , and upholding all things by the word of his power , when he had by himself made purification for our sins , sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high ;
58001004	having become so much better than the angels , as he has inherited a more excellent name than they have .
58001005	For to which of the angels did he say at any time , " You are my Son , Today have I become your father ? " and again , " I will be to him a Father , And he will be to me a Son ? "
58001006	When he again brings in the firstborn into the world he says , " Let all the angels of God worship him . "
58001007	Of the angels he says , " Who makes his angels winds , And his servants a flame a fire . "
58001008	but of the Son he says , " Your throne , God , is forever and ever ; The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your kingdom .
58001009	You have loved righteousness , and hated iniquity ; Therefore God , your God , has anointed you With the oil of gladness above your fellows . "
58001010	And , " You , Lord , in the beginning , laid the foundation of the earth . The heavens are the works of your hands .
58001011	They will perish , but you continue . They all will grow old like a garment does .
58001012	As a mantle you will roll them up . And they will be changed . But you are the same . Your years will not fail . "
58001013	But of which of the angels has he said at any time , " Sit at my right hand , Until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet ? "
58001014	Aren't they all ministering spirits , sent forth to do service for the sake of those who will inherit salvation ?
58002001	Therefore we ought to pay greater attention to the things that were heard , lest perhaps we drift away .
58002002	For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast , and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense ;
58002003	how will we escape , if we neglect so great a salvation - - which at the first having been spoken through the Lord , was confirmed to us by those who heard ;
58002004	God also bearing witness with them , both by signs and wonders , and by various works of power , and by gifts of the Holy Spirit , according to his own will ?
58002005	For he didn't subject the world to come , whereof we speak , to angels .
58002006	But one has somewhere testified , saying , " What is man , that you think of him ? Or the son of man , that you care for him ?
58002007	You made him a little lower than the angels ; You crowned him with glory and honor .
58002008	You have put all things in subjection under his feet . " For in that he subjected all things to him , he left nothing that is not subject to him . But now we don't see all things subjected to him , yet .
58002009	But we see him who has been made a little lower than the angels , Jesus , because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor , that by the grace of God he should taste of death for everyone .
58002010	For it became him , for whom are all things , and through whom are all things , in bringing many sons to glory , to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings .
58002011	For both he who sanctifies and those who are sanctified are all from one , for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brothers ,
58002012	saying , " I will declare your name to my brothers , In the midst of the congregation will I sing your praise . "
58002013	Again , " I will put my trust in him . " Again , " Behold , here am I and the children whom God has given me . "
58002014	Since then the children have shared in flesh and blood , he also himself in like manner partook of the same , that through death he might bring to nothing him who had the power of death , that is , the devil ,
58002015	and might deliver all of them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage .
58002016	For most assuredly , not to angels does he give help , but he gives help to the seed of Abraham .
58002017	Therefore he was obligated in all things to be made like his brothers , that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God , to make atonement for the sins of the people .
58002018	For in that he himself has suffered being tempted , he is able to help those who are tempted .
58003001	Therefore , holy brothers , partakers of a heavenly calling , consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession , Jesus ;
58003002	who was faithful to him who appointed him , as also was Moses in all his house .
58003003	For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses , by so much as he who built the house has more honor than the house .
58003004	For every house is built by someone ; but he who built all things is God .
58003005	Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant , for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken ,
58003006	but Christ as a Son , over his house ; whose house are we , if we hold fast our boldness and the glorying of our hope firm to the end .
58003007	Therefore , even as the Holy Spirit says , " Today if you will hear his voice ,
58003008	Don't harden your hearts , as in the provocation , Like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness ,
58003009	Where your fathers tested me by proving me , And saw my works for forty years .
58003010	Therefore I was displeased with that generation , And said , ' They always err in their heart , But they didn't know my ways ; '
58003011	As I swore in my wrath , ' They will not enter into my rest . ' "
58003012	Beware , brothers , lest perhaps there will be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief , in falling away from the living God ;
58003013	but exhort one another day by day , so long as it is called " today ; " lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin .
58003014	For we have become partakers of Christ , if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm to the end :
58003015	while it is said , " Today if you will hear his voice , Don't harden your hearts , as in the provocation . "
58003016	For who , when they heard , did provoke ? No , didn't all those who came out of Egypt by Moses ?
58003017	With whom was he displeased forty years ? was it not with those who sinned , whose bodies fell in the wilderness ?
58003018	To whom did he swear that they should not enter into his rest , but to those who were disobedient ?
58003019	We see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief .
58004001	Let us fear therefore , lest perhaps a promise being left of entering into his rest , anyone of you should seem to have come short of it .
58004002	For indeed we have had good news preached to us , even as also they , but the word of hearing did not profit them , because it was not mixed with faith by those who heard .
58004003	For we who have believed do enter into that rest , even as he has said , " As I swore in my wrath , They will not enter into my rest ; " although the works were finished from the foundation of the world .
58004004	For he has said somewhere about the seventh day like this , " God rested on the seventh day from all his works ; "
58004005	and in this place again , " They will not enter into my rest . "
58004006	Seeing therefore it remains that some should enter therein , and they to whom the good news were before preached failed to enter in because of disobedience ,
58004007	he again defines a certain day , today , saying through David so long a time afterward ( just as has been said ) , " Today if you will hear his voice , Don't harden your hearts . "
58004008	For if Joshua had given them rest , he would not have spoken afterward of another day .
58004009	There remains therefore a Sabbath rest for the people of God .
58004010	For he who has entered into his rest has himself also rested from his works , as God did from his .
58004011	Let us therefore give diligence to enter into that rest , that no man fall after the same example of disobedience .
58004012	For the word of God is living , and active , and sharper than any two-edged sword , and piercing even to the dividing of soul and spirit , of both joints and marrow , and quick to discern the thoughts and intents of the heart .
58004013	There is no creature that is hidden from his sight , but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do .
58004014	Having then a great high priest , who has passed through the heavens , Jesus , the Son of God , let us hold tightly to our confession .
58004015	For we don't have a high priest who can't be touched with the feeling of our infirmities , but one who has been in all points tempted like we are , yet without sin .
58004016	Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace , that we may receive mercy , and may find grace for timely help .
58005001	For every high priest , being taken from among men , is appointed for men in things pertaining to God , that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins .
58005002	The high priest can deal gently with those who are ignorant and going astray , because he himself is also surrounded with weakness .
58005003	Because of this , he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people , as well as for himself .
58005004	No man takes this honor on himself , but he is called by God , just like Aaron was .
58005005	So also Christ didn't glorify himself to be made a high priest , but he who said to him , " You are my Son . Today I have become your father . "
58005006	As he says also in another place , " You are a priest forever , After the order of Melchizedek . "
58005007	Who in the days of his flesh , having offered up prayers and petitions with strong crying and tears to him who was able to save him from death , and having been heard for his godly fear ,
58005008	though he was a Son , yet learned obedience by the things which he suffered ;
58005009	and having been made perfect , he became to all of those who obey him the author of eternal salvation ,
58005010	named by God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek .
58005011	Of whom we have many words to say , and hard to interpret , seeing you have become dull of hearing .
58005012	For when by reason of the time you ought to be teachers , you again need to have someone teach you the rudiments of the first principles of the oracles of God . You have come to need milk , and not solid food .
58005013	For everyone who lives on milk is not experienced in the word of righteousness , for he is a baby .
58005014	But solid food is for full grown men , those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil .
58006001	Therefore leaving the doctrine of the first principles of Christ , let us press on to perfection - - not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works , of faith toward God ,
58006002	of the teaching of baptisms , of laying on of hands , of resurrection of the dead , and of eternal judgment .
58006003	This will we do , if God permits .
58006004	For concerning those who were once enlightened and tasted of the heavenly gift , and were made partakers of the Holy Spirit ,
58006005	and tasted the good word of God , and the powers of the age to come ,
58006006	and then fell away , it is impossible to renew them again to repentance ; seeing they crucify the Son of God for themselves again , and put him to open shame .
58006007	For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it , and brings forth a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled , receives blessing from God ;
58006008	but if it bears thorns and thistles , it is rejected and near a curse , whose end is to be burned .
58006009	But , beloved , we are persuaded of better things for you , and things that accompany salvation , though we speak like this ,
58006010	for God is not unrighteous , so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you showed toward his name , in that you served to the saints , and still do serve them .
58006011	We desire that each one of you may show the same diligence to the fullness of hope even to the end ,
58006012	that you won't be sluggish , but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises .
58006013	For when God made a promise to Abraham , since he could swear by none greater , he swore by himself ,
58006014	saying , " Most surely I will bless you , and I will surely multiply you . "
58006015	Thus , having patiently endured , he obtained the promise .
58006016	For men indeed swear by a greater one , and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation .
58006017	Wherein God , being determined to show more abundantly to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel , interposed with an oath ;
58006018	that by two immutable things , in which it is impossible for God to lie , we may have a strong encouragement , who have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us ,
58006019	which we have as an anchor of the soul , a hope both sure and steadfast and entering into that which is within the veil ;
58006020	where as a forerunner Jesus entered for us , having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek .
58007001	For this Melchizedek , king of Salem , priest of God Most High , who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him ,
58007002	to whom also Abraham divided a tenth part of all ( being first , by interpretation , King of righteousness , and then also King of Salem , which is King of peace ;
58007003	without father , without mother , without genealogy , having neither beginning of days nor end of life , but made like the Son of God ) , remains a priest continually .
58007004	Now consider how great this man was , to whom even Abraham , the patriarch , gave a tenth out of the best spoils .
58007005	They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest's office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law , that is , of their brothers , though these have come out of the loins of Abraham ,
58007006	but he whose genealogy is not counted from them has taken tithes of Abraham , and has blessed him who has the promises .
58007007	But without any dispute the less is blessed of the better .
58007008	Here men who die receive tithes , but there one , of whom it is testified that he lives .
58007009	So to say , through Abraham even Levi , who receives tithes , has paid tithes ,
58007010	for he was yet in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him .
58007011	Now if there was perfection through the Levitical priesthood ( for under it have the people received the law ) , what further need was there for another priest to arise after the order of Melchizedek , and not be called after the order of Aaron ?
58007012	For the priesthood being changed , there is of necessity a change made also of the law .
58007013	For he of whom these things are said belongs to another tribe , from which no man has given attendance at the altar .
58007014	For it is evident that our Lord has sprung out of Judah , as to which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood .
58007015	This is yet more abundantly evident , if after the likeness of Melchizedek there arises another priest ,
58007016	who has been made , not after the law of a fleshly commandment , but after the power of an endless life :
58007017	for it is testified , " You are a priest forever , According to the order of Melchizedek . "
58007018	For there is an annulling of a foregoing commandment because of its weakness and uselessness
58007019	( for the law made nothing perfect ) , and a bringing in thereupon of a better hope , through which we draw near to God .
58007020	Inasmuch as it is not without the taking of an oath ,
58007021	for they indeed have been made priests without an oath ; but he with an oath by him that says of him , " The Lord swore and will not change his mind , ' You are a priest forever , According to the order of Melchizedek ' " .
58007022	By so much has Jesus become the collateral of a better covenant .
58007023	Many , indeed , have been made priests , because they are hindered from continuing by death .
58007024	But he , because he lives forever , has his priesthood unchangeable .
58007025	Therefore he is also able to save to the uttermost those who draw near to God through him , seeing he ever lives to make intercession for them .
58007026	For such a high priest was fitting for us : holy , guiltless , undefiled , separated from sinners , and made higher than the heavens ;
58007027	who doesn't need , like those high priests , to daily offer up sacrifices , first for his own sins , and then for the sins of the people . For this he did once for all , when he offered up himself .
58007028	For the law appoints men high priests , having infirmity ; but the word of the oath , which was after the law , appoints a Son , perfected forevermore .
58008001	Now in the things which we are saying , the main point is this . We have such a high priest , who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens ,
58008002	a minister of the sanctuary , and of the true tent , which the Lord pitched , not man .
58008003	For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices . Therefore it is necessary that this high priest also have something to offer .
58008004	For if he were on earth , he would not be a priest at all , seeing there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law ;
58008005	who serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things , even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to make the tent , for , " See , " he said , " that you make all things according to the pattern that was shown you on the mountain . "
58008006	But now he has obtained a more excellent ministry , by so much as he is also the mediator of a better covenant , which has been enacted on better promises .
58008007	For if that first covenant had been faultless , then no place would have been sought for a second .
58008008	For finding fault with them , he said , " Behold , the days come , " says the Lord , " That I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah ;
58008009	Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers , In the day that I took them by the hand to lead them forth out of the land of Egypt ; For they didn't continue in my covenant , And I disregarded them , " says the Lord .
58008010	" For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel . After those days , " says the Lord ; " I will put my laws into their mind , I will also write them on their heart . I will be to them a God , And they will be to me a people .
58008011	They will not teach every man his fellow citizen , Every man his brother , saying , ' Know the Lord , ' For all will know me , From the least of them to the greatest of them .
58008012	For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness . I will remember their sins and lawless deeds no more . "
58008013	In that he says , " A new covenant , " he has made the first old . But that which is becoming old and grows aged is near to vanishing away .
58009001	Now indeed even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service , and an earthly sanctuary .
58009002	For there was a tent prepared , the first , in which were the lampstand , the table , and the show bread ; which is called the Holy Place .
58009003	After the second veil , the tent which is called the Holy of Holies ,
58009004	having a golden altar of incense , and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold , in which was a golden pot holding the manna , Aaron's rod that budded , and the tables of the covenant ;
58009005	and above it cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat , of which things we can't now speak in detail .
58009006	Now these things having been thus prepared , the priests go in continually into the first tent , accomplishing the services ,
58009007	but into the second the high priest alone , once in the year , not without blood , which he offers for himself , and for the errors of the people .
58009008	The Holy Spirit is signifying this , that the way into the Holy Place has not yet been revealed , while the first tent is yet standing ;
58009009	which is an illustration of the present age , where gifts and sacrifices are offered that are incapable , concerning the conscience , of making the worshipper perfect ;
58009010	being only ( with meats and drinks and various washings ) fleshly ordinances , imposed until a time of reformation .
58009011	But Christ having come as a high priest of the coming good things , through the greater and more perfect tent , not made with hands , that is to say , not of this creation ,
58009012	nor yet through the blood of goats and calves , but through his own blood , entered in once for all into the Holy Place , having obtained eternal redemption .
58009013	For if the blood of goats and bulls , and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling those who have been defiled , sanctify to the cleanness of the flesh :
58009014	how much more will the blood of Christ , who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God , cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God ?
58009015	For this cause he is the mediator of a new covenant , that a death having taken place for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first covenant , those who have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance .
58009016	For where a last will and testament is , there must of necessity be the death of him who made it .
58009017	For a will is in force where there has been death , for it is never in force while he who made it lives .
58009018	Therefore even the first covenant has not been dedicated without blood .
58009019	For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses to all the people according to the law , he took the blood of the calves and the goats , with water and scarlet wool and hyssop , and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people ,
58009020	saying , " This is the blood of the covenant which God commanded toward you . "
58009021	Moreover he sprinkled the tent and all the vessels of the ministry in like manner with the blood .
58009022	According to the law , nearly everything is cleansed with blood , and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission .
58009023	It was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these ; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these .
58009024	For Christ entered not into a holy place made with hands , similar in pattern to the true , but into heaven itself , now to appear before the face of God for us ;
58009025	nor yet that he should offer himself often , as the high priest enters into the holy place year by year with blood not his own ,
58009026	or else he must have suffered often since the foundation of the world . But now once at the end of the ages , he has been revealed to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself .
58009027	Inasmuch as it is appointed for men to die once , and after this , judgment ,
58009028	so Christ also , having been once offered to bear the sins of many , will appear a second time , without sin , to those who are eagerly waiting for him for salvation .
58010001	For the law , having a shadow of the good to come , not the very image of the things , can never with the same sacrifices year by year , which they offer continually , make perfect those who draw near .
58010002	Or else wouldn't they have ceased to be offered , because the worshippers , having been once cleansed , would have had no more consciousness of sins ?
58010003	But in those sacrifices there is a memory made of sins year by year .
58010004	For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins .
58010005	Therefore when he comes into the world , he says , " Sacrifice and offering you didn't desire , But a body did you prepare for me ;
58010006	In whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you had no pleasure .
58010007	Then I said , ' Behold , I have come ( In the scroll of the book it is written of me ) To do your will , God . ' "
58010008	Saying above , " Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn't desire , neither had pleasure in them " ( those which are offered according to the law ) ,
58010009	then has he said , " Behold , I have come to do your will . " He takes away the first , that he may establish the second ,
58010010	by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all .
58010011	Every priest indeed stands day by day ministering and often offering the same sacrifices , which can never take away sins ,
58010012	but he , when he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever , sat down on the right hand of God ;
58010013	henceforth expecting until his enemies to be made the footstool of his feet .
58010014	For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are sanctified .
58010015	The Holy Spirit also testifies to us , for after he has said ,
58010016	" This is the covenant that I will make with them : ' After those days , ' says the Lord , ' I will put my laws on their heart , I will also write them on their mind ; ' " then ,
58010017	" I will remember their sins and their iniquities no more . "
58010018	Now where remission of these is , there is no more offering for sin .
58010019	Having therefore , brothers , boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus ,
58010020	by the way which he dedicated for us , a new and living way , through the veil , that is to say , his flesh ;
58010021	and having a great priest over the house of God ;
58010022	let us draw near with a true heart in fullness of faith , having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience , and having our body washed with pure water ,
58010023	let us hold fast the confession of our hope unyieldingly . For he who promised is faithful .
58010024	Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works ,
58010025	not forsaking our own assembling together , as the custom of some is , but exhorting one another ; and so much the more , as you see the Day approaching .
58010026	For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth , there remains no more a sacrifice for sins ,
58010027	but a certain fearful expectation of judgment , and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries .
58010028	A man who has set at nothing Moses ' law dies without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses .
58010029	How much worse punishment , do you think , will he be judged worthy of , who has trodden under foot the Son of God , and has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing , and has insulted the Spirit of grace ?
58010030	For we know him who said , " Vengeance belongs to me , " says the Lord , " I will repay . " Again , " The Lord will judge his people . "
58010031	It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God .
58010032	But remember the former days , in which , after you were enlightened , you endured a great struggle with sufferings ;
58010033	partly , being exposed to both reproaches and oppressions ; and partly , becoming partakers with those who were treated so .
58010034	For you both had compassion on me in my chains , and joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions , knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in the heavens .
58010035	Therefore don't throw away your boldness , which has a great reward .
